She opted to go into business so as to meet her needs comfortably. Through Faulu Kenya, Mercy has managed to educate her daughter and improve her business. She hopes to relocate her business to the town centre in the future. With 40,000 KES, she will buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 43-year-old man, a husband and the father of four daughters and three sons. Jamal has a bakery in Hebron city. He makes all kinds of local sweets and desserts.

Jamal, who is photographed in FATEN's branch in Hebron, moved to a new house recently. He bought as much furniture as he could cover. He needed $3000 to purchase the rest of the needed items such as kitchen tools, chairs and tables. Jamal took out a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
Heydi es una joven de 28 años de edad, habita con su mama a quien aprecia mucjo y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, la Joven es una persona responsable muy trabajdora y con buenas recomendaciones tanto laborales como personales; labora como secretaria de COOTRAPRICA desde hace 4 años.  

Solicita su primer crèdito, para utilizarlo  en  compra de materiales de construcciòn para terminar de construir una habitaciòn en casa de su mamà  y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones.  

Su proposito principal es que su familia cuente con las condiciones nesesarias para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Heydi is a young woman of 28. She lives with her mother whom she loves very much and whom she helps paying for family expenses. She is a very responsible and hardworking young woman, and she has received good recommendations both in the personal and professional fields. She has been working as a secretary at COOTRAPRICA* for 4 years.

This is the first loan she is requesting, and she will use it to buy construction materials to finish building a room in her mother’s house to improve their living conditions.

Her main wish is for her family to have what is necessary to live in decent conditions.

<cite>*COOTRAPRICA (or Cooperativa de Transporte Rigoberto Cabezas) is a Nicaraguan co-op located in the town of Nueva Guinea.</cite>

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an extra room in her mother's house.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhon B. (pictured), 44, is a widow with four sons. One is married and other works for a plywood factory. They are living along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chhon works in the plywood factory along with her sons. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: 28-year-old Fidel farms for a living. He tills his own land in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for six years and sells his harvest to his community. Fidel works hard so he can send his two children to school. Fidel is also a married man. He hopes for his business to grow, which would give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Eyddy Geraldina

texts.es: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en casa propia en el Municipio de Cojutepeque del Departamento de Cuscatlán. Doña Eyddy posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una sala de belleza en la cual ha trabajado duramente para poder tener lo necesario y a la vez se ha especializado para brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Últimamente ha notado un fuerte aumento en la demanda de sus productos y de sus servicios esto la ha puesto en que pensar ya que sabe que entre más clientes solicites sus productos necesita tener más equipada su sala de belleza para no decepcionarlos. Esto  la ha  hecho tomar una decisión bien importante. Solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita ampliar su negocio y comprar más artículos de belleza como: shampoos, cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo, maquillaje, tintes para el cabello, esmaltes, y demás materiales atractivos para los clientes. Con la confianza que de esta forma logrará aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. is 33 years old. She lives in her own house in the municipality of Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán. Eyddy has a small business: a beauty salon in which she has worked hard so that she can have what she needs. She has also specialized in providing the best possible service to her customers. Recently, she has noticed a strong increase in demand for her products and services, which has led her to think that she needs to equip her beauty salon better, because more customers will require more products, and she does not want to disappoint them. This led her to make a very important decision: to request this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to expand her business and buy more beauty articles such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items that are attractive to her customers. She is confident that in this way she will be able to increase her sales and thus her earnings, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items her customers like.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Honyllette

texts.en:
Honyllette is 24 years old and married with one child. Her husband works as a farmer. They are living harmoniously in Gappal Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. 

To assist her husband earn their living, Honyllette operates a general store where she offers different products. She has been in this business for five years already and usually earns 5,000 PHP per month. To further develop her business, Honyllette is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables. In the future, she would like to continue taking loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Muniru

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Miniru.  He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 2. In 2005, Miniru established his provisions business. He began his business because he wanted to have more income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, he earns about $210 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Miniru requires a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, margarine, an additional carton of sweets, a carton of Tiger batteries, a carton of Bama mayonnaise and a carton of cheese. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $47. In the future, Miniru plans to get a bigger shop and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, margarine, sweets, batteries, mayonnaise and cheese.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una clienta de  30 años de edad, vive con su novio  y  3 hijos, en casa propia ubicada en e distrito Las Lomas de Piura. Josefa vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y sólo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica. Josefa tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de chicha de jora la cual la realiza los días viernes, sábados y domingos en su domicilio, cuenta con clientes conocidos en la zona. La chicha de Jora es una bebida ancestral, fermentada y hecha a base de maíz, su consumo es muy común en la zona norte del Perú, sobre todo en las comunidades rurales.

Josefa también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral que comercializa a los pobladores de su caserío y en el mercado de la localidad. Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de insumos para el preparado de su chicha así como en realizar mejoras que su cocina necesita con suma urgencia. 

Este crédito le permitirá continuar desarrollando su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Josefa es una clienta conocida para Edpyme Alternativa y su primer crédito lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 30-year-old client who lives with her boyfriend and three children in their own home in the Las Lomas district in Piura.  Josefa lives in the rural part of this district, with only electricity service.  Josefa is eager to raise her family and give them a better quality of life.

The activity in which she works is selling chicha, which she does from home on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  She has many recognized clients in the area.  Chicha de Jora is an ancient drink which is fermented and made from a corn base.  Its consumption is very common in the north of Peru, especially in rural communities.

Josefa also works raising poultry which she sells to the people of her village and the local market.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of chicha, as well as make improvements to her kitchen that are urgently needed.

This loan will allow her to continue to develop her business and improve her quality of life.  Josefa is a client known to Edpyme Alternativa, and her first loan was promptly repaid.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for chica (a traditional drink) and to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 36 years old, is working in the factory with his wife. Their income is $7 per day. They have one child and he is studying. Every month, Sopheap has to spend around $75 year old for the family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He plans to get a small place for his wife to sell groceries at home, instead of working in the factory, so that she can take care the children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 46 años de edad. Actualmente,  Sonia  vive en la  ciudad del Cusco junto con su único hijo.  Su actividad principal de Sonia es la venta de desayunos, mates, bebidas calientes y frías y otras cosas más, ella tiene un pequeño cafetín donde vende sus productos. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Sonia  requiere el préstamo para comprar azúcar, panes, pasteles y otras cosas más.

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Sonia was born in the city of Paucartambo (Cusco, Peru) and is 46 years old. Currently, Sonia lives in the city of Cusco together with her only child. Sonia's main activity is selling breakfast, mate [tea], hot and cold drinks, and other items. She has a small cafe where she sells her products. She has operated this business for 5 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. At this time, Sonia needs a loan to buy sugar, bread, cakes and other items. 

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her fellow members invited her to participate in the “Mosoq Allpa” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, cakes and other items.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 49-year-old woman, married and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Living with her is her only child.

It is her passion to raise animals such as hogs and she is definitely enjoying the job. This is her source of income. She has been doing this for six years, which shows her endurance and that she is an animal lover. She earns PHP 6,000 a month from this work, not exactly enough for the needs of her family.

Lilia has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from GDMPC to purchase hog feed for fattening and nourishing the hogs to grow quickly into firmly-bodied hogs and for the maintenance of the pig shelter. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to raise more hogs in the future and increase her usual monthly earnings.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and for the maintenance of a pig shelter

loans.name: Renelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Renelita works hard to support her family. 

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Renelita is borrowing 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving business. 

Renelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos, la mayor tiene 22 años y es estudiante de nivel superior en contabilidad, y el menor tiene 11 años estudiante del nivel primario.

Es una mujer muy activa, dedicada a atender a sus hijos.  Motivada por una amiga, se inicia en la venta de productos de belleza con un capital de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, actividad que en la actualidad incrementó, ahora cuenta con una variedad de productos como perfumes, colonias, talcos, desodorantes, cremas para la piel, y otros.  Cuenta con clientes Fijos, quienes están muy satisfechos por la diversidad de productos.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará productos de belleza para su stock como: perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas faciales, shampoos para adultos y niños, polvos compactos, talcos,  lápices labiales, delineadores de ojos y cejas, esmaltes de uñas, además de otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.
Nelly es una mujer  soñadora, se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus suieños. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, 43 years old and has 2 children: the older is 22 and is a college student in accounting and the younger is 11 and in elementary school.

She is a very active woman, dedicated to caring for her children. Encouraged by a friend, she started to sell beauty products with a working capital of 300 nuevos soles, a business that nowadays has expanded. At present she has a variety of products such as perfume, cologne, talcum powder, deodorant, face creams and others. She has loyal customers who are very satisfied with the variety of her products.

With this new loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, she will buy a supply of beauty products such as perfume for women and men, facial cream, shampoos for children and adults, compact powder, talcum, lipstick, eye and eyelash liner, nail polish as well as another display case for her products.

Nelly is a woman full of dreams. She is very happy and wants to continue working to realize her dreams. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER for giving women like herself the opportunity to develop within their own environment..

loans.use: to buy cosmetics: perfume for women and men, facial cream, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a hardworking, 30-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who go to school. For the past 4 years he has been operating a hotel to make a living. He supplements his income from farming and a motorcycle transport business. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his business and to be making more profit. He is requesting a loan of 40000 Kenya shillings to buy eggs, wheat flour and soft drinks. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, wheat flour and soft drinks

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
This is Josie, age 43, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is the wife of her husband Wilfredo, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josie operates a foam/pillow manufacturing business. Her products are foam for beds and pillows. They assemble foam and pillows out of materials she buys from the factory. They prepare the bed and pillowcases and assemble them with the foam materials. She sells her products directly to the market and the local community. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Josie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 28, 22 and 20.

Rose works as a farmer in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rose also raises pigs to help augment her income. Rose requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. Rose hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Joylinda

texts.en:
Joylinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Joylinda has a retail shop, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Joylinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joylinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Susan has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more of a traditional food called pocho, since famine has been rampant and pocho is now in high demand. This will help Susan generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees and other family bills. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to finish building her new home. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Susan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more of a traditional food called pocho

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by providing motorcycle (or habal-habal) services. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and gasoline. Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2008 and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her transportation service.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 29 años, es una hombre bueno y muy amable. Es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia solo, pero el aún tiene el compromiso de aportar en los gastos en el hogar de sus padres, por quienes siempre esta al pendiente para poder brindarles lo que necesiten. El trabajo de Juan consiste en la venta de bebidas, el compra al por mayor y los vende al menudeo agregándole algunos complementos como venderlos helado y con sorbetes cada uno. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace un años. Cuando empezó se encontró que había mucha competencia pero al pasar el tiempo empezaron a preferir sus productos por que les daba muy heladitas y con buen humor, el trabaja solo y es muy fundamental para tener un ingreso extra. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo de poder hacer otras cosas más, además trabaja en una entidad bancaria de la ciudad y eso le permite tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene dos ingresos y desea seguir así ya que tiene en mente implementar aún áas su negocio. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así sentirá seguro para poder avanzar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más bebidas para seguir con su venta y seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 29 years old, is a good, very kind, man. He is single, has no children, and lives alone in his own house, but he still undertakes to contribute to his parents' household expenses. He always keeps an eye on his parents so that he can offer them anything they need.

Juan's work consists of selling drinks, which he buys in bulk, and oftn sells alongside related products such as ice-cream and sorbets. He has been doing this work for a year. When he began, he found he had a lot of competition, but as time has gone on people began to prefer his products, because the products are always well chilled and served with a smile. He works alone, which is esential to maintaining his income. What he likes about his work is that it gives him time to do other things: he also works in a bank in the city, which gives him greater financial stability. Things are going very well because he has two incomes - and while he would like to continue this way, he has it in mind to build up his business. This will be his first loan from MFP. He is very happy to know he can access this financial support, because with it he feels he has more security in developing his business. With the sum he has requested, he will buy more drinks to continue increasing his sales and improving his earnings.

loans.use: To buy more drinks.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Christine is the facilitator of the Tumaini group. Christine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Christine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Christine will invest in a cow and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.es: El señor Ilarion, nacido en la comunidad las Liras, distante a 35 km de el Torno, convive con la Sra. Fabiana, con la cual tienen tres hijos, ella es ama de casa, y el Sr. Ilarion se dedica  ala agricultura,  tienen su parcela  a  40 km de el Torno en Nuevo Surutu, en la cual se dedican a la agricultura, siembran: maíz, arroz solicita el  crédito para la siembra de Arroz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra y también se dedican a sacar madera, para la venta  a los carpinteros, hace 6 créditos que vienen  trabajando con emprender, por lo cual se sienten muy agradecidos por el apoyo que se le ha brindado para mejorar su calidad de vida, el sr. Ilarion es joven y muy trabajador esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia, ya que la cosecha lo lleva a vender al mercado de la localidad, directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Ilarion was born in the community of Las Liras, 35km from El Torno.  He lives with Fabiana and the couple have three children.  Fabiana takes care of the house and Ilarion farms.  He has a plot of land 40km from El Torno, in Nuevo Surutu.  There he farms, growing corn and rice.  He is requesting this loan for his rice growing and to prepare his land.  He also cuts down trees to sell to carpenters.

Ilarion has been working with Emprender for six loan cycles and he feels very grateful for the support that he has been given which has allowed him to improve his quality of life.  Ilarion is young and very hard working.  This is his only source of income through which he provides for his family.  He takes his harvests to the town market to sell, directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing rice and to prepare his land

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 55 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 12 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items, such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries, to sell. Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 21,000 with KADET ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Selma Fabiola

texts.en:
For the last four years, I’ve been selling magazines by order and lotions. I am currently pregnant, and I have to look for ways to feed my kids, and help support the house. I need to buy products to sell during the Christmas season. My main clients are my neighbors and people that work at offices.

Loan Use: Purchase lotions, shampoo, body powder, cosmetics, underwear.

Desde hace 4 años me dedico a vender productos de revistas por encargo y lociones. En este momento me encuentro embarazada y tengo que buscar la manera de ayudar a mis hijos con el alimento y el sostenimiento de la casa. Ahora necesito comprar producto para vender en temporada navideña, mis mayores clientes son mis vecinos y personas de oficinas que visito.

loans.use: Compra de cremas, shapoo, lociones, talcos, cosmeticos, ropa interior.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto R. is a hardworking rice farmer. He has owned his lands for about 4 years, deciding to move away from his family's plot shortly after having his first child. Although his farm is small, it provides enough rice to support the household. He learned rice farming from his father, who has been farming for his entire life as well. He and his wife Andrea have two children, one who is 5 and the other who is 2. They are optimistic about the loan and are hoping their lands continue to be productive.

The Paypayales Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Roberto is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Paypayales Communal Bank. All bank members are part of a rice farmers' cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all the guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Plant rice on his farm

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir A. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. This single 26-year-old has worked for the last 10 years in a food market. After a previous loan from Normicro a few years ago, he was able to purchase his own store and become a business owner. He has worked hard to grow his small business and is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to expand his current inventory further and provide many items that other stores in the region do not stock. (Pictured is Samir and one of his employees.)

loans.use: To expand his current inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has two children ages 11 and 15. Her husband is a rural police officer, but the salary he receives is not sufficient to meet the needs of their family. With this need, Juana started to sell shoes 13 years ago, and at the beginning her sister helped her, but as her children grew, the need to obtain a better income motivated her to become independent and start her own business.

Fortunately, thanks to the good service that she offers, she has been able to gain many customers and make her business grow, she now needs a loan of $250 that will go for the purchase of merchandise, to fulfill the orders she has and have a better variety. She is able to return this amount in 3 months. Be an important part in the life of this family. They will thank you sincerely for your help.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, su esposo es policía rural pero el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ante esta necesidad Juana comenzó a vender calzado desde hace 13 años, al principio le ayudaba a su hermana, pero al ir creciendo sus hijos las necesidad de obtener un mejor ingreso la motivo a independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio.

Afortunadamente, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene y contar con una mejor variedad, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ruhadiyah

texts.id:
Ruhadiyah and her husband, Sunarto is in the business of buying to be recycled (junk) products to be sold to the Recycler. They live with one of their daughters, Suniarti who is 12 years old, but could not afford to go to school. They live in a rented room, for which they pay Rp 140,000.00 (about US$15)/month. Every day the left at 6:00AM with their push cart, which also function as storage for the to be recycled products (more like trash condition) they bought on the route they found. Everyday they push the cart and buy junk goods for about 2 km, by walking, and for that every day they could profit about Rp 50,000 (about $6), and that money is used to pay for daily expenses. Their hope was for a better life, their children could go to school, and live in their own house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ruhadiyah bersama dengan suaminya, Sunarto, menjalankan usaha membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul. Mereka tinggal bersama serorang putri mereka, Sumiati yang berumur 12 tahun namun tidak sekolah. Mereka tinggal di kos-kosan yang dikontrak dengan membayar Rp 140.000,00/ bulannya. Setiap hari mereka berangkat jam 6 pagi dengan menggunakan gerobak yang berfungsi sebagai tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli di setiap perjalanan yang mereka temui. Setiap hari mereka berkeliling menempuh jarak kurang lebih 2 kilo meter dengan berjalan kaki dan setiap harinya mereka bias menghasilkan keuntungan Rp 50.000,00. yang nantinya dari uang tersebut akan dipakai untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Harapan mereka adalah kehidupan yang lebih baik. Anak mereka bisa bersekolah dan memiliki rumah sendiri.

loans.use:
To buy to be recycled (junk) products and repair push cart

Membeli barang-barang rongsokan dan memperbaiki gerobak

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora C., 57, is married to Fernando Casco, 64, a retired soldier. Together they have three children; all of them are married with their own homes and jobs. 
Teodora has been running her grocery store for the past 13 years. Now that she is retired she has more time to focus on her store. She decided to continue with this business in order to ensure her personal progress as well as better the lives of her children. 
With the credit she has asked for Teodora plans to buy merchandise for her store. This includes: rice, sugar, breads, yerba mate, dairy products and drinks. These products will help meet demand, as well as increase her monthly profit.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, SUGAR, BREAD, TEA, DAIRY PRODUCTS AND DRINKS FOR HER GROCERY STORE.

loans.name: Francisca P.

texts.es:
Francisca Paulina lives in a house she owns, with her husband and children, in the km.7 street of the Alto San Pedro region of the city of La Paz. She works as a secretary at the soccer school and her husband works at a radio station. The requested loan will be used to pay her son’s school tuition deposit, as well as to repair the ceiling of the house, which is leaking badly during this rainy season.

She is considered a very good customer and, thanks to her credit history, she is eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca Paulina vive en casa propia, con su esposo y sus hijos, en la calle kilómetro 7 de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como secretaria en la escuela de fútbol y su esposo trabaja en una estación radial. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la reserva en el colegio de su hijo y parte del mismo lo usara para reparar el tumbado de la casa, ya que en esta época de lluvias gotea mucho.

Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito y se la considera muy buena cliente.

loans.use: Payment of her son's school tuition fees and repair of her house ceiling.

loans.name: Night's Group

texts.en: Night, the Group Leader, sells jewelry and cosmetics. She intends  to use the extra profits to diversify her current business.

loans.use: To increase her jewelry and cosmetics stock

loans.name: Mawero East A(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Sadi R.. She currently sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Sadi is 40 years old and is married; her husband sells matooke (plantain). She has 3 children ranging in age from 18 to 22. Each week, Sadi makes approximately UGS 40000 (US$24.00) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to complete her house, which is under construction. Sadi has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGS 300000 (US$175) to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sadi is joined in her small group by Kadija K., Annet S. and Zaituni N.. Kadija K. sells charcoal sales and wants to increase her stock. Annet S., who also sells charcoal, wants a loan to expand and become a wholesaler. Zaituni N. operates a retail shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock in the shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal business

loans.name: Munakukama B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Babirye M..  She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to add to her business.  Babirye is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 20 and her children go to school.  Each week, Babirye makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and cater for her family.  Babirye has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Babirye is joined in her small group by Beatrice B., Okello K., Mawazi N., and Hawa M..  Beatrice B. has a business selling fish and tomatoes and wants to expand her fish business.  Okello K. is currently operating a drug shop business and wants a loan to add more stock.  Mawazi N. operates a business in tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth fabric.  Hawa M. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more hair chemicals.

loans.use: To expand maize selling business and increase profits

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em T., age 29, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province since 2000. Everyday, she breeds pigs at her house and earns $5 a day in revenue. Her husband, Mr. Seng Doung, age 40, works as a police man and makes a total of about $3 a day.

In order for her family to earn more income, Mrs. Em T. has decided to borrow from Kiva to purchase more pigs to breed. She plans to use the leftovers for renovating the house. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed and renovate the house.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 38 year old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Fouad is a curtain ttailor. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to buy a car for business use.

loans.use: He is planning to buy a car

loans.name: Ni Made Wisani

texts.id:
After her first loan from DINARI has been settled, Ni Made Wisani, a Melayan pig breeder, enjoy a significant impact. With Rp 1,400,000.00 as her initial capital that she earned 6 months a go from DINARI, Wisani could earn Rp 1,000,000.00 income. The result is also supported by DINARI team who gave coaching and facilitation. All income she earned from the business is used to fulfill her family’s daily needs, to be saved, and to invest in piglets.

Thinks that the economic condition of her family is getting better because of her business, Ni Made Wisani is very happy, and getting more and more excited in managing it. And with support from her husband, Ni Made Wisani asked for the second loan from DINARI with the same value as the previous. The second loan will be used to invest in fodder for the pigs.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah melalui pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Made Wisani seorang peternak babi asal Melaya merasakan hasil yang di perolehnya cukup lumayan. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 1.400.000.- yang diterimanya 6 bulan lalu dari Dinari, Wisani bisa meraup keuntungan bersih Rp.1000.000.- Hal ini juga tak terlepas dari pembinaan dan pendampingan yang di lakukan oleh Dinari. Semua keuntungan itu dipergunakannya untuk kebutuhan keluarga, menabung dan untuk membeli bibit babi. Merasa perekonomian keluarganya berangsur - angsur membaik oleh adanya usaha ini, Ni Made Wisani merasa sangat senang dan lebih bersemangat lagi dalam mengembangkannya. Dan dengan mendapat dorongan semangat dari suaminya, Ni Made Wisani melanjutkan pinjamannya ke periode kedua dengan jumlah yang sama. Hal ini dilakukannya karena dari hasil beternak ini Ni Made Wisani bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Pinjaman kedua dipergunakannya untuk membeli pakan ternak

loans.use: To invest in piglets and fodder

loans.name: Ya Kaday Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ya Kaday. Its members include: Regina K. who sells cooked rice; Yeabu B. who sells ready-to-wear clothes, and Yeabu M. who sells palm oil. The three are asking for a loan of US$ 1050. This group has been with SMT for 2 years now. They always repay their loans on time and then ask again for a new loan to further increase their businesses.

Regina is the leader of Ya Kaday group. She was born in Rolakoh 40 years ago. She now lives with her motor-driver husband with whom she has 5 children.

loans.use: To buy more plates, spoons, and cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb R. is a villager in Tep Or Chun village in the Kandal province. She is a farmer who does not have enough rice equipment to cultivate rice. She would like to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with cows to plow her rice field. Additionally, Mrs. Chroeb R. would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seed to grow.

Mrs. Chroeb R. is a 49-year-old widow with five children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while another is a construction worker. Another child is attending school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with cows to plow her rice field. Mrs. Chroeb Ros would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seed.

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
Mrs. Lom K., who is 41 years old, is pig raiser; additionally, she distills alcohol for sale. Her husband, Mr. Poch Yuk, who is 42 years old, has a milling machine; he charges service from people who come to grind rice. Lom has four children, one of whom is married and another of whom helps Lom raise pigs. The others live at home and go to school.

To increase her family's income, Lom would like to request a loan to purchase rice to grind for sale. The remainder of loan will be used to purchase more piglets to raise. She hopes that the loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her family's income. Lom's husband is pictured because Lom was unavailable.

loans.use: Purchasing rice to grind and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José Antonio tiene 32 años, es soltero, trabaja brindando servicios de cabinas públicas de Internet.Empezó en este negocio con solo 4 computadoras, ahora cuenta con más de 10 máquinas y se siente orgulloso del crecimiento de su negocio. Mediante este servicio brinda muchas facilidades a las personas de su entorno, sin embargo, no sólo quiere quedarse en eso, él tiene visiones para otros negocios. Por ahora, quiere mandar a ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su local y para esto estima de un capital en lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 32 years sold, single, and his work involves providing internet stations for public use. He started his business with only four computers, and he now has more than ten. He is very proud of the growth he’s seen in his business. Through this enterprise, he provides a great service to the people of his area. Despite this, however, he doesn’t want to just provide internet access services but would also like to expand into other businesses. For now, he would like to expand and improve his location and for this he needs capital as soon as possible.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of the location where he has his internet access computer stations.

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
El tejido a mano de chompas, abrigos, mantillas para adultos y niños, es una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación “margaritas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch. Además  tejido algunas también se dedican al bordado a maquina, singulares diseños son aplicados en prendas de vestir, Todas casadas han encontrado en Pro-Mujer la oportunidad de crear pequeños negocios, que les permite obtener ganancias suficientes para el sustento diario de sus familias. 
La asociación Margaritas desea ampliar sus ventas con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias, para esto precisa mayor capital para la compra de prima.
texts.en:
Hand-knitting of sweaters, coats and shawls for adults and children is one of the most widespread activities within the “Margaritas” Association, who work in the municipal center of the province of Germán Busch. In addition to knitting, some also work at machine embroidery, producing unique designs that are used on clothing. All married, they have found in Pro-Mujer the opportunity to create small businesses that allow them to earn enough to provide for their families’ daily needs.

The Margaritas Association would like to expand their sales in order to obtain higher earnings, and for this they need more capital to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Sigamos Adelante Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Sigamos Adelante, somos un grupo bien unido, tenemos muchos años de conocernos, siempre hemos trabajado juntos, somos vecinos y tenemos mucho tiempo de concernos, todos decidimos poner nuestros propios negocios ya que en nuestro pais es dificil conseguir trabajo y la unica manera de generar ingresos para nuestros hogares es teniendo nuestro propio negocio, todos estamos muy felices ya que nos va muy bien pero como en todo negocio todo tiene sus altos y bajos, en estos momentos necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios. nuestras actividades son las siguientes:
Herlinda M.: soy la coordinadora del grupo mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia ISIS KARINA, soy casada y madre de 6 hijos, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para sacar adelante nuestro hogar, entre ambos logramos cubrir los gastos familiares.
Digna H.: ella es comerciante individual, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades y caserios, ella es casada y es madre de 5 hijos, ella tiene la ayuda de su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, entre los dos cubren con los gastos del hogar.
Miguel B.: el se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y de res, en estos momentos esta interesado en vender pollos tambien, esta venta la hace por las mañanas ya que en la tarde se dedica a la agricultura.
Maria Emelia M.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene su tienda en la casa de habitacion, tambien ella vende recargas de llamadas para una empresa de telefonia movil, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el esposo de ella se dedica a la agricultura y ambos se audan para sacar adelante su hogar.
Norma N.: ella se dedica a vender carne de pollo, res y cerdo, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi no descuida a sus hijos, ella tiene 3 hijos, mi esposo me ayuda a vender mis carnes en diferentes caserios y comunidades cercanas a nuestro hogar,.

todos necesitamos del credito para salir adelante, queremos y deseamos superarnos.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the “Sigamos Adelante” (“Let's Move Forward!”) group. We are a very close group of neighbors and have known each other and worked together for many years. Because it is difficult to find work in our country and the only way to generate income is to be entrepreneurial, we decided to start our own businesses. We are all very happy and everything is going well, but every business has its ups and downs. So, we currently need a loan to continue to develop our businesses. Our activities are the following: Herlinda M.: I am the coordinator of the group. My primary activity is the sale of common household items. I have a small general store called “Isis Karina's Shop.” I am a married mother of six children. My husband helps maintain our home, and between the two of us we successfully cover our household expenses. Digna H.: Digna is an independent shopkeeper. She travels to different towns and villages to sell new clothes. She is married and the mother of five children. Digna is assisted by her husband, a farmer and cattle rancher. Together, they cover their household expenses. Miguel B.: Miguel sells pork and beef. Currently, he is interested in selling chickens as well. Because he spends his afternoons farming, he is only able to sell meat in the mornings. Maria Emelia M.: Maria sells common household items from a shop in her home. She also sells prepaid phone cards for a mobile telephone company. Maria is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their home. Norma N.: Norma sells chicken, beef, and pork. Her business is located in her home so that she can take care of her three children. Her husband helps sell the meat in several nearby communities. We all need this loan to get ahead. We truly want to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es: Khaty tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja diariamente disponiendo de sus horarios para vender productos naturales, va en búsqueda de sus clientes caminado por las calles, así vende sus productos, y aunque para ella no fue nada fácil comenzar este trabajo, hoy mira con satisfacción los resultados, pues ahora sus clientes recomiendan a otros sus productos y de esta manera es una forma de captar nuevos clientes. Adicionalmente, Kathy tiene un puesto de venta de jugos que generalmente es atendido en las mañanas, este también es un espacio para ofrecer sus productos. Hace algunos días su puesto de jugo estuvo cerrado, porque Kahty estaba ocupando casi todo su tiempo en la venta de sus productos naturales, pero ya está dispuesta a volver a vender sus deliciosos jugos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado durante este tiempo ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero será utilizado en la compra de los productos que vende, además de fruta para su puesto de jugos.
texts.en:
Kathy is 25 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons. She works daily around her schedule to sell natural products. She goes in search of her clients by walking through the streets, and this is how she sells her products. Although it was not easy for her to start this business, today she can look with satisfaction on the results, since now her clients recommend her products to others and this is one way for her to get new clients. In addition, Kathy has a juice stand that she generally works from in the mornings. Her juice stand is also a place where she can sell her products. It was closed a few days ago because Kathy was busy almost the whole time selling her natural products, but now she is ready to sell her delicious juices again. This is the second time that she is requesting a loan with MFP, and during this time she has proven to be responsible with her payments. The money will be used to buy the products she sells and fruit for her juice stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of products she sells

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Upendo K., age 28, is married with two children, ages 6 and 1. She sells food in the marketplace. She started this business in 2008 and works daily from 6am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 89.

This will be Upendo’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first to start selling cold drinks and beers and has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to buy a blender and a good stock of fruit, so that she can make and sell more juice.

Upendo will share this loan with subgroup A of the Kichangani group. The subgroup has 6 members, who sell vegetables, cosmetics, "bites", clothes, utensils, fruit, other foods, etc. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Upendo is the 1st from the left in front (black blouse).

loans.use: To buy a blender and more fruit to sell juice

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es: Nuria tiene 33 años, es casada hace 11 años, madre de dos hijos viven en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo son agricultores, tienen cultivos de fruta cítrica en terrenos de sus familiares, cosechan desde enero al mes de marzo, al pasar esta temporada, no tienen otros ingresos, por lo que su esposo trabaja como albañil y Nuria realiza distintas actividades, una de ellas es vender ropa con su hermana cada 15 días, los fines de semana (como aparece en la foto); y fue con este negocio que Nuria conoció a personas que se dedican a la sericultura; desde entonces, hace un año, empezó a criar gusanos de seda. A esta labor le presta mucha atención porque le complace y cree que le será muy rentable. Nuria sueña en convertirse en una próspera negociante, y no esperar con mucha ansiedad solo las cosechas de sus cítricos para tener ingresos económicos. También tiene muchas esperanzas de progresar como persona, y dentro de su banco comunal. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida en pagar las cuotas en las fechas señaladas, para no caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y para sembrar fréjoles, asimismo abonar sus cítricos, y si le alcanza algo de dinero lo invertirá en la crianza de gusanos.
texts.en:
Nuria is 33 years old and has been married to her husband for 11 years. They have 2 children, who are both living at home. Nuria and her husband are farmers. They cultivate citrus fruit on their family's plots and they harvest the fruit between January and March. Because their farming does not bring in any money the rest of the year, Nuria's husband also works as a builder and she dedicates herself to a variety of activities. For example, she sells clothes with her sister every other weekend (see photo). Once, while she and her sister were selling clothes, they met people who farmed silk and who had been raising their own silkworms for a year. Listening to these people carefully, Nuria realized that the idea of becoming a silk farmer really appealed to her. She also thinks it will be quite profitable and would love to become a successful businesswoman in this trade. It would be wonderful to have another steady income, and not to have to wait so anxiously for the citrus harvest each year. Nuria also hopes to become a very active member of her communal bank and thus grow as a person. This is her first loan from MFP, and she is committed to making her repayments punctually. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the citrus trees, to plant beans and, if there is any money left, she will use it to start raising silkworms.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for fertilizers

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes le ayudan mucho. Ella es una experta en el arte de las manualidades, ya que hace tejidos para carteras, collares, aretes, brazaletes, entre otras variedades. Estos artículos hechos con sus expertas manos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchas personas con quienes se socializa y le es muy rentable porque sus productos se venden muy bien, y a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son mujeres les encantan. Ella posteriormente quiere poner un taller de bijouteria y tejidos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de piedras finas para hacer sus trabajos de manualidades, telas e hilos para bordados, gastará 500 soles, con lo restante comprará un motocarro de segundo uso para que su esposo trabaje en transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Kelly is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and her three children who help her a lot. She is an expert in handicrafts, and already has weaved wallets, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, amongst many others. These articles, made by her expert hands, are sold in different places in her area. What she likes about her job is that she meets a lot of people with whom she socializes, and it’s very profitable because her products sell well and her clients, of which the majority are women, love her work. She now wants to start a workshop for jewelry and weavings. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and with the money that she requests she will buy materials and fine stones to do her handicrafts, fabrics and threads for embroidery. This will cost 500 soles, and she will buy a second-hand motorcar with the rest so her husband can work as a passenger transportation service.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Djobo

texts.fr: Née le 09 avril 1970 à Sokodé, Mme A. DJOBO est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants.  Elle réside actuellement à Adétikopé où elle exerce comme activité la vente des ustensiles ménagers en aluminium et en plastique. C’est un commerce qui marche très bien pour elle mais elle est souvent confrontée à de fréquentes ruptures de stocks. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour des achats de marchandises en gros afin de pouvoir satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Cela lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born April 9, 1970 in Sokodé, Mrs A. Djobe is married and is the mother of six children. She lives in Adétikopé where she sells household items made of aluminum or plastic. The business is going very well for her but she is often left short of inventory. She is seeking a loan to purchase goods on a wholesale basis so that she can satisfy her clients' demands. This will allow her to increase her sales and income.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale goods

loans.name: Chanyean

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanyean T., 30, and her husband, Mr. Heng Men, 36, who live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 2000 and have two children: a young son and daughter. Besides her children, her mother also lives with her. 
 
Chanyean has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes them to sell in market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has constructed beds for a living for ten years. Chanyean is requesting her first loan of $150 to purchase the wooden materials needed to construct more beds.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials to construct beds.

loans.name: Candilaria

texts.en:
Candilaria B., 59 years old, is a widow with three children, all of them married. They live in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is an active member of Paglaum Coop and has been sealed with MIGS (Member in Good Standing) since she began her membership.

Candilaria loaned Php 15,000 for additional capital for her existing seafood-vending business. She sells during market day at their location and also in neighboring towns and cities.

She is grateful to Paglaum and Kiva lenders who support her and make her business more progressive.

loans.use: To buy more seafood products to sell

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Lê Thị (1702060029) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Toàn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 4th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and married with five children. She plants cassava, maize and pineapple on her farm. She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase cassava stems and pineapple suckers to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pineapple suckers and cassava stems to plant

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly manages a vegetable-vending stall in her village. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to make her vending more progressive. Beverly has two children, EJ and Lyra Mona. She is married to Edgar S., a simple farmer. Their major source of income comes from farming. Her dream in relation to the loan requested is to use it for the growth of her business to increase her daily income and support her children's educational needs.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia S. , tiene la edad de 29 años , habita en el barrio Las enramadas , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo y actualmente ella espera un bebé, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder construir su vivienda , ella desde hace trece años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la erosión de suelo , doña Karla inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicarlo al cultivo.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia S. is 29 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with her husband, who helps her with the household tasks. They have a son and she is currently expecting a baby. Her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions and be able to build their home. She has been working in agriculture for thirteen years. The greatest difficulty that it has presented to her is the lack of financing and soil erosion. Karla began this business with the support of her parents. Her future plan for her crops is to be able to diversify them. With the loan, she will buy fertilizers and supplies to use for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve production.

loans.name: Bayanbat

texts.en:
Since 2007, Bayanbat T. has been running a small cafe together with his spouse, Chimgee, in a rental place near the local market. He has two employees. Bayanbat is a 22-year-old married father of one. His family lives in a ger (nomadic tent housing) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

With his profit, he maintained and expanded his cafe last year. This couple hopes to have their own business place as soon as their business is quite successful. During the last three years, Bayanbat's working capital has increased from 500,000 tugrugs to 1,200,000 tugrugs ($1 US = ~1450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase flour, rice, whole animal meat and vegetables for his business. He says, "My wish is to keep my only son healthy and help him become a good person."

Thanks, Bayanbat - an open, cheerful and hardworking person!

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, whole animal meat and vegetables for a cafe

loans.name: Limber Alejandro

texts.es: Limber es soltero vive junto a sus padres, trabaja en la empresa de Ascensores Normalizados como técnico de mantenimiento de ascensores, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro ya que trabaja desde hace cuatro años atrás, no cuenta con competencia ya que es dependiente de la empresa, el crédito que se le otorgo es para comprar un automóvil el cliente contaba con aporte propio para el efecto, el mismo le servirá para poder movilizarse y poder trabajar con el mismo en horarios fuera de oficina, en agrocapital se le otorgo 3 créditos donde demostró un muy buen comportamiento de pagos, cliente de familia humilde y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Limber is single and lives with his parents. He is an employee with the Ascensores Noramlizados, working as an elevator maintenance technician. He has a great deal of experience in this field, having worked for the past four years in that occupation. He sees no competition as he is gainfullyu employed. The loan he is requesting is to purchase a car. He will use the car to be able to travel to work especially outside of office hours. Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) has granted him 3 past loans. He has demonstrated responsibility with his payments. He is from a humble and hard working family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: United Club Group

texts.en:
United Club is a group of five borrowers, led by Gamon Y., who is living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Gamon is 29 years old with three children, aged two to four years old.  She is illiterate because although she wanted to attend school, her husband pressured her against it since the cultural norm is for girls to rely on their husbands to provide. Gamon’s husband is a farmer but doesn’t earn enough to support the family.  She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town in a refugee camp because the town was burned to the ground during the war.  

Gamon’s business consists of selling dry food goods, such as onions, biscuits and spices, of which she imports from nearby Guinea. She sells these items in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors.  She has been running her business for three years now.  She is successful because her customers like her personality and customer service.  Her dream is to grow her business until she can build a permanent shop.  With the profits from her business, Gamon dreams of building a permanent house, sending her children to school, and learning how to read and write.

loans.use: To increase her dry goods inventory and sales so that she can build a permanent house, send her children to school, and learn how to read and write.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn manages a village store which is situated in front of her house. She is 30 years old, married and living with her family in the village of Rizal, Santiago City. Arlyn is able to generate an average gross income of PHP 4,000 a week, which is just enough to meet her family's daily needs. With a desire to make her business grow, she is borrowing PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that the business will grow and become more successful. Arlyn says that her income from the business is a big help to her family. She is patiently doing her best to make her business productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy O. is 38 years-old and married to Allen O., who is a truck driver for a cargo forwarder. They live in the village of Bulubitoon, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, in Negros Occidental with their three children, who range in age from six to twelve years-old. Jeremy's mission in life is to help her husband raise their three children well, and provide them with a good future through education. In the short term, she plans to earn enough income to defray their small family's household expenses.

Her aspirations for her family became more attainable when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access the microcredit loans it offers using the Grameen methodology. She used the first loan as capital to set up her own general store. She was very happy when she saw that even with just a small amount of capital and its small returns, she was able to help provide for her family and set aside some savings for future security. She was able to increase her next loan amount by paying back each weekly installment on time, and paying off the loan within the set term. As a result, she was able to expand her business and started a food vending business. She knows that she is well on her way to attaining her dreams, as each new loan has also increased her monthly income. At present, she earns an average income of PHP 8,000 per month from her business activities.

In her previous ninth loan cycle, she borrowed PHP 16,000, which she used as additional capital in her business. She maintained her good track record by paying each installment on time, and paying back the full amount within the set loan term. Jeremy plans to borrow PHP 17,000 for her tenth loan cycle to buy stocks for her business, such as the very in-demand firecrackers and fireworks, in preparation for the coming holiday season.

Jeremy is shown in the attached picture with her 2 sons.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Stock for business

loans.name: Motuya Plus Group

texts.fr:
Thoms K. est dirigeant de son groupe dont le nom est « Motuya Plus » qui signifie « Value Plus » en anglais, constitué de 21 membres unis solidairement pour développer leurs affaires à travers des prêts.
Thoms est gérant de sa propre cabine téléphonique depuis 2005. Il a acquit une expérience en gestion et en marketing. Il a déjà reçu 3 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés correctement. Il compte avec le prochain prêt renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant des cartes prépayées qui sont bien vendues dans son quartier. Thoms est célibataire âgé de 28 ans.
texts.en:
Thoms K. is the leader of his group named “Motuya Plus”, which means “Value Plus” in English. It is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to develop their businesses through loans. Thoms has been the manager of his own phone booth since 2005. He has acquired management and marketing experience. Thoms has already received a loan three times from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to bolster his stock of merchandise by buying prepaid cards, which sell well in his district. Thoms is an unmarried man who is 28 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cards for resale in order to boost his capital

loans.name: Lakeja

texts.en:
Lakeja R. sells local Sudanese bread cooked by frying in cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour and cooking oil.  Lakeja is 25 years old and is married to a security guard. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and provide enough food.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Jafari

texts.en: Jafari S. is a Tanzanianan entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a hardware shop at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam.  He sells various business goods including cement. He purchases the materials from the wholesale hardware shops and sells at retail. He has been in the business for the past 10 years and he managed to buy a car with his business income. His business plan is to run a wholesale shop but capital is the most limiting factor. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Mrs. Eufracia C. is happily married and gifted with four children. She operates a business which is the buying and selling of junk items. Her average gross sales is about 2,000 pesos per day which can really help with their daily expenditures.

Eufracia sells her junk items daily. She is requesting a loan of 5,750 pesos so she can buy more junk items which she will then sell again. She is quite happy in her business and has it expand as people become more aware of recycling. 
  
Eufracia is already on her 8th loan and her previous loan was 5,500 pesos. She's very thankful that her business is growing fast with the help of her micro-finance loans from PMPC.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more junk items to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 19-year-old son, Yevgenyi. She lives in the town of Vodyanoye. Natalya owns two big spacious greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale at the market. She has been in farming for 8 years. Presently, Natalya has 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this project. She spends about 10,000 – 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

Natalya is seeking a 10,000 Grivnyas loan to construct a new greenhouse. A new greenhouse will increase the amount of produce she can offer for sale. Natalya is willing to work very hard to see her plans fulfilled. One of her personal goals is to generate enough income to build a garage, which has been a vital need for their family for awhile. 

Note: In the photo, Natalya is with her husband, a retired policeman.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad has worked as a furniture maker since 1999 after seeing a need for such services in the region..He is 46 years-old and married.  He is the father of six children, three of whom are unemployed. Ziad is requesting a loan of $500 in order to expand his business by buying a special compressor to better cater to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 42 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans et y a bénéficié de 6 prêts. elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Ses revenus lui permettent de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PALENE for three years and has received 6 loans. She extracts and sells peanut oil. Her income allows her to put aside more savings and help support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little oil-making business

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeu M. is 44 years old and lives with another family member in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married with two kids who are going to school or work as temporary laborers. Her husband (pictured), Sol Kiple, is 40 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi.
