Yeu M. is a wedding chef. Yeu M. complains that her current income is not adequate to support her family. Hence, she would like to look for assistance via HKL. She will use her loan to invest in the grocery sales trade so she can get extra profit.

loans.use: To invest in grocery sales

loans.name: Akmurod

texts.ru: Гафуров Акмурод проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Акмурод занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сажает оващи. В этой деятельности более 10 лет. До этого он работал в мастерской, починкой автомашины. Акмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен посеить разные другие виды оващей. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Akmurod G. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 45 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife takes care of the household. Akmurod himself cultivates crops, mainly vegetables. He has been growing crops for more than ten years. Prior to this, he worked as a car mechanic at a repair shop. Akmurod would like to expand his business. He would like plant new types of vegetables. He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has been working in agriculture since 2001. He plants tomatoes, cucumber, and lettuce in his green house. He is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of vegetables and knows how to take care of his green house. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he took after his family’s business. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his work merchandise. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 
In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his work merchandise.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C., aged 52, is married and resides with her 16-year-old child in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is engaged in the business of producing and selling hand-made brooms in the city, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a middleman involved in buying and selling cows at the market, earning an income of USD 3 per day. He travels in his province every day to purchase cows from the villagers. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. Leng C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase chickens to raise for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 30 años, está casada con Alberto de 32 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona alta de Tarma. Desde hace 10 años que Silvia empieza su día, cada mañana con la preparación de los alimentos, luego atiende a sus animales que tiene, como: gallinas, cerdos y vacas, de éste último, extrae leche para elaborar quesos, que son ofrecidos posteriormente en las tiendas de su localidad, después se traslada a su terreno agrícola, en donde cuida los cultivos de papa, maíz y arveja, en tanto su esposo se dedica a la mudanza de muebles, debido a que cuenta con un carro para realizar tal labor, cobrando por viaje, S/. 60.00 soles, dependiendo además de la distancia. Como ambos tienen ingresos económicos, lo derivan en los gastos de sus menores hijos, para que no le falte nada. Sabe que sus cosechas son bastante productivas, es por ello que para el futuro desea sembrar en mayor cantidad arvejas. Este es su primera vez con MFP, por lo que se muestra muy entusiasta y atenta a las decisiones que acuerdan dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semillas de arveja y tres sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, is married to Alberto, 32, and they have two children; they all live together in their own home which is located in the high part of Tarma. For the last 10 years, Silvia starts her day off preparing meals and then caring for the animals, chickens, pigs and cows, that she has; she milks the cows to extract milk to make cheese that she then sells to local stores. Next, she goes to her fields to tend to her potato, corn and pea crops. Her husband works as a furniture mover because he has a vehicle appropriate for this kind of work; he charges 60 soles per load depending on distance. Since they both have sources of income, they can see to their children’s needs so that they won’t lack anything. She knows that her crops are quite profitable so she’d like to plant more peas in the future. This is her first loan request with MFP and she is enthusiastic and attentive to her communal group decisions. She will use the requested funds to buy a sack of pea seed and three sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nasibdjon

texts.en:
Nasibdjon S. is 26 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Nasibdjon is an optimistic, hardworking man. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Nasibdjon has been in agribusiness for about ten years. He learned this skill from his beloved father, who takes care of his land while Nasibdjon travels to market to sell his crops or cattle. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni. With the desire to realize his plan, Nasibdjon appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan. She is 57 years old. Evelyn is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business providing repair services to local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Thac Qua 1-6 Group

texts.en:
Duyen T. D. was born in 1962 and is the leader of this five-member group loan. She has two children and lives in Thac Qua village, Dong Anh district. Not only does she grow rice and breed poultry, but Duyen T. D. has worked as a tailor for the past five years. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She has participated in Kiva partner, SEDA, since 2006. For her last loan, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount. In this loan cycle, Duyen would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND in order to buy cloth to make clothes.

About the other borrowers in her group
Tu T. N. is 36 years old. She is a teacher and also raises pigs. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy pig food.
Quynh N. H. is 31 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to expand her store.
Huong T. D. is 35 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Khoa T. N. is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey L., 47, is the village bank president selected by the seventeen members of this group loan, located in Leuk Daek village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.
 
Mrs. Srey L. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice and her husband, Mr. Hara Maem, is a construction worker. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The farm's soil is now infertile and there is not enough water to irrigate the crops. Thus, Mrs. Srey L. decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline for her water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support her crop. Mrs. Srey L. is the mother of five children: one is a construction worker, one is a waiter in a restaurant and the others attend the local school and also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed and gasoline for her water machine

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La  socia es la Sra. Fanny; ella tiene 37 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos,  la socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, la socia ofrece sus diversos catálogos de productos de belleza y ella también pide todos los productos que están en oferta para tener en stock, La socia es una mujer muy dedicada a su hogar y este trabajo le permite acomodar sus horarios para estar con sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar del catálogo las ofertas y más adelante venderlos a un poco más. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Fanny belongs to the “QORICHUSPA” communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. Fanny is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. She makes a living selling cosmetics from catalogues—she offers different beauty product catalogs, and also orders all of the products that appear in the catalogues so that she has them in stock. Fanny is a woman who is very dedicated to her home, and her work allows her to adjust her hours so that she can be with her children. She is asking for a loan so that she can purchase beauty products from a catalogue and then sell them for a little more than the cost. Fanny greatly appreciates the loan that is being offered, since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products from a catalogue and then selling them for a little more than the cost

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem M., 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. M. is a farmer and grows rice for an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day. 

M. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase more plots of farmland.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants rice crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Seang T. has been married for years and has five teenage children. Two are employed at the construction field and the other three are going to school. The coming heavy rainfall is good for growing; Seang T. is looking for assistance in order to help support her in the farm business.

loans.use: To help support her in the farm business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Rachel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Rachel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget A. was born in 1983 and lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ret Noun, is a fisherman and he is also a farm laborer. Through those activities, this couple supports two children, both too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Nget A.’s problem is that it is time to grow rice but she does not have rice seed. So, to improve matters, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed; with the rest of the loan she plans to buy fertilizer and hire a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to hire a plowing machine to plow her field

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.en:
J. Mahmadsaid is a very hard-working and enterprising man who works at cultivating his farmland. It is to his crop that he owes his daily bread, so he tries to take care of it as best he can. 

Mahmadsaid is one of the most dedicated farmers, and every morning the town sees him walking to his work. He is one of the most respected people in the area and is known as an example for his children and the rest of the town. The courage and perseverance he puts into his job as a farmer is what stands out in this man, who is devoted to his family and his farmland. 

Nonetheless, he has difficulties and financial problems that are bringing him irregularities and losses. For this reason, Mahmadsaid is requesting your help with a loan of $1000 to increase his production with the purchase of additional seeds and fertilizer.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Anjelina M., who is in her mid-forties, is married with three children.  She has a powered soap, sarong and fabrics business. She started her business 2 years ago and works daily from 10am until 6pm. She is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be  Anjelina’s  1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to buy more stock of all her products. 
	
Anjelina will share this loan with her loan group, Wega, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

 In the picture, Anjelina is 2nd from left, front row.

loans.use: To increase  her stock of all her products

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: Chhean P. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Kandal province. He is a fisherman and also works as a construction worker. On average, he makes US$4 of profit a day. His wife, pictured here, owns a grocery store and also works as a professional tailor. She earns US$7 per day. Chhean P. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for the family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ibagdathan

texts.en:
Ibagdathan S. is a 54 year-old villager who lives in Masy village, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has one daughter.  She graduated from the Andizhan cotton institute and has devoted 35 years of her life to cotton cultivating.  

Her responsible and precise attitude to this activity allowed Ibagdathan to achieve success and broaden her business by purchasing livestock. Currently she breeds twelve cows and earns about 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms a month.  

Ibagdathan is a reliable Bai-Tushum borrower who repaid her loans without any delay and used them as intended. Now Ibagdathan needs to manure the land to get a good harvest next year.  That is why she is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase fertilizers and to plant the seeds.  

With the revenues from the business, she plans to build a house for her family. Ibagdathan is a real go-getter and makes every effort to improve her family’s life. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 43-year-old dairy farmer.  He is married to Pauline, who is shown in the photo here and who helps him with the farming business.  They have two children.  Patrick has been doing dairy farming for the past year, and his monthly income is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Patrick has never borrowed from any microfinance institution (MFI) before.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and this is his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to purchase animal feeds (e.g., maize jam and dairy meal) and animal insecticides.  With the anticipated profits from the business, he intends to expand his dairy farming business and begin poultry farming.

Patrick was away on a business trip at the time his profile details were being gathered and thus we have featured the wife in the photo.  Patrick's hopes and dreams are to become a leading local dairy farmer in his hometown and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and animal insecticides

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia D. C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is 48 years old, married and has four children.  To make a living, Lilia plants and harvests rice for sale.  Lilia does her best to be a responsible wife and mother. 

Lilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to buy seeds and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 35 años y es madre soltera de 4 hijo de 15, 8, 4 y 1 años, el mayor esta en colegio y otro de sus hijos esta en escuela lo que para Carmen le resulta muy difícil ya que es padre y madre a la vez.

Se dedica a la cría de animales y además junto a su hijo venden legumbres en el mercado, trabajan todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 14h00, los chanchos los compra pequeños los cría por tres meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados y venderlos por libras, en algunos casos también ella los vende por libra ya que le dejan mejores ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos pequeños y comida para estos. Además de legumbres y frutas. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que brinda la institución para otros créditos como el crédito emergente o de estudios. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Here we meet 35 year-old Carmen.  She is a single mother and has 4 children aged 15, 8, 4 and 1.  Her eldest child is in high school and her second child is in elementary school.  This is very difficult for Carmen as she must be both father and mother at the same time.

Carmen raises animals and also sells vegetables in the market with her son.  They work every day from 6.00am to 2.00pm.  They buy the pigs when they are young and then raise them for three months.  They sell then them to traders who come to her house to take the pigs to market and sell them by the pound.  Sometimes she also sells the pigs herself by the pounds since this makes her more profits.

Carmen will use this loan to buy young pigs and pig feed as well as fruit and vegetables.  This is her second loan with her community bank and she likes it for the opportunity that the institution provides for other loans such as emergency loans or student loans.  Her dreams are to see her children grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy pigs, pig feed, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es:
Ruth Elena 
Asesor: Flor     
Fecha historia: Diciembre 22 de 2010 

De domingo a domingo desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m. labora Ruth Elena en su propio negocio, una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos legumbres, granos y snaks, así es como recibe mejores ingresos para subsistir diariamente y aportar a su hogar, pues tener 6 hijos implica una lucha constante para salir adelante. 

Desde hace año y medio Ruth Elena tomó la decisión de convertirse en microempresaria y aportar con su trabajo a los ingresos del hogar, pues cada vez se hacía más difícil la subsistencia, hoy puede decir con alegría que aporta para mejorar la calidad de vida de su numerosa familia. 

Ruth Elena espera adquirir más surtido para su tienda con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ruth Elena
Advisor: Flor
Date: December 22, 2010

From Sunday to Sunday Ruth Elena works from 6:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m. in her own business.  She has a store, and she sells vegetables, grains, and snacks to her neighbors.  That is how she gets better earnings to contribute daily to her household income.  She has six children, and this involves a constant struggle to get ahead.

A year and a half ago Ruth Elena made the decision to become a small businesswoman.  She did this to contribute, through her work, to the household income.  Survival becomes more difficult each day.  She can now happily say that she contributes in order to improve the quality of live for her large family.

Ruth Elena hopes to get more stock for her store.  She wants to do this in order to improve her sales and to increase their family income.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey H. is married woman with four children, three of whom are studying in local public school, but the youngest one is five years old. She and her family are living in Ta Muong village in Takeo province. She was born in 1966. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Van Sok, is a construction worker and fisherman. Although they do a lot of work, they can earn a little income. So to improve her family living, Mrs. Srey H. is requesting for a loan to buy a cow, some piglets, and pig food for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow, some piglets, and pig food

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 46-year old widow who supports her family by operating a restaurant. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 34,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).  

Analie is  borrowing 25,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  

Analie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mibame

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mibame a 22 ans. Elle est née à Tsévié et habite quartier Hédzranawoé. Elle fait le commerce de produits d'alimtentation générale. Elle a commencé en 2008 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend les produits au marché de hédzranawoé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Ms. Mibame is 22 years old. She is born in Tsévié and lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She sells general food products. She has started this business in 2008 and stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She then resells her goods at the Hédzranawoé market. She is seeking a loan in order to replenish her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing general food products

loans.name: Irlanda Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Asunción se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí encontramos a la Señora Irlanda, tiene 49 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad, todos viven independientes y ella vive con un hermano.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de algunas marcas, su sistema de venta es puerta a puerta, ella ofrece sus productos, los anota y luego realiza los pedidos mes a mes en un local en el centro de Portoviejo y ahí mismo recibe los pedidos. En la actualidad esta también vendiendo zapatillas y sandalias de temporada, trabaja todos los días ya que las ventas han aumentado, cobra la mitad en la entrega y después de quince días la totalidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sandalias, zapatillas, camisetas, trajes de baño, bermudas y todo tipo de ropa de temporada que es lo que más salida tiene en la actualidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años y le gusta la forma de trabajar de la institución. Sus metas son seguir creciendo y tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The village bank Maria Asuncion meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place know for its commercial zone, traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Here we find Irlanda, 49 years old, and separated from the father of her 3 children who are all grown and live on their own.  Irlanda lives with one of her brothers.  

She sells several brands of catalog clothing door-to-door.  She offers her products, notes them down, and then meets the requests monthly in a store in the center of Portoviejo, where she also receives orders.  Currently she is also selling tennis shoes and seasonal sandals.  She works every day now that her sales have increased.  She charges half upon delivery, and the remainder within 15 days.  

This credit will be used to buy sandals, tennis shoes, t-shirts, bathing suits, shorts and all kinds of seasonal clothing, which is what is selling the most right now.  She has been part of the village bank for 10 years and likes the way the institution works.  Her goals are to continue growing and to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy sandals, tennis shoes, t-shirts, bathing suits, shorts and seasonal clothing

loans.name: Saihantuya

texts.en:
Saihantuya, 44, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, her older son attends a local secondary school and her younger daughter goes to kindergarten.

Saihantuya began operating a bakery business in 1998 and started selling clothing in 2000. She imports consumer goods from Erlian, a Chinese border city, and sells them at her rented stall. She wants to expand her business and increase her variety of goods. Saihantuya is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to carry on this business and make more profit in order to be able to afford my children's school fees." She is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to import more consumer goods from China.

loans.use: to import more consumer goods

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 30 years old and single with three children. He has no other dependents and lives in a rented home in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his goal is to educate his children up to university. 

He has a textile business and has been running it for four years, Jimmy is a policeman and started his business from his salary savings. He faces a challenge of seasonality. 

In the future, he hopes his business will grow and become self sustaining with no debts. 

Jimmy needs the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to pay for clothes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for eight years.

Nancy sells items like oil, vinegar and noodles. She also sells vegetables. Nancy is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

In the future, she hopes to start another business. She also wishes for her children to finish school and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Mirian Fani

texts.es:
Mirian de 26 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad hace poco ella vino de la sierra por motivo del trabajop de su esposo y con loas primeras utilidades decidio poner su tienda.

Ella trabaja en su negocio de 6H00 am a 8H00 pm con la ayuda de su esposo. Le dificulta en su trabajo la delicuencia ya que por su sector se ha vuelto peligroso. Con la ayuda del prestamo quiere comprar mas productos para su tienda de viveres. Lo que mas anhela es tener su negocio mas grande y terminar su vivienda para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is 26 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who recently started her business.  She came from the mountains to work with her husband and they decided to put their profits into their store.

She works at her business from 6:00am until 8:00pm with the help of her husband.  A difficult part of their work is delinquency because their area has become dangerous.  With the help of the loan, she wants to purchase more products for her general store.  In the future, she would like her business to get larger and finish her home to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks, and oil.

loans.name: Perlicana

texts.en: Perlicana, 36 years old, is married to a farmer. They have three children. She has operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to use in the expansion of her store and to purchase additional food products and beverages to sell. Perlicana is grateful for having Kiva lenders and ASKI MFI who support her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Eliana

texts.es:
Elizabeth Eliana tiene 20 años, es soltera vive  con los padres  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es llegar a terminar la carrera universitaria.

Se considera una persona alegre y solidaria.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Eliana is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents in the Chillanes neighborhood, province of Bolívar.

The V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel Communal Bank is located in the Pailaloma area some 60 minutes from the office in the Chillanes neighborhood. The Bank is made up of 13 members who are in agriculture; they grow corn, potatoes and wheat.

Elizabeth is a farmer; she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. She buys her products in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month and later sells them in the Sunday market of Chillanes.

Elizabeth needs the loan to buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure. The loan will help her economically to meet her needs and increase her production as she fights plagues, diseases and the change in climate that affects her crops. Elizabeth’s dream is to finish her university education.

She considers herself to be a loyal and happy-go-lucky person.

loans.use: buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 25 años, es una mujer alegre y responsable, es madre soltera de 2 hermosos hijos Jeyson de 8 y Jeniffer de 3 meses de nacida; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Hace 2 años que se dedica a la siembra de diferentes productos como plátano, yuca y maíz híbrido (llamado también polenta); del cual menciona le sirve para poder obtener ganancias en diferentes temporadas del año: como por ejemplo, el maíz lo cosecha a los 6 meses de plantación, la yuca después de cosechar el maíz y el plátano cada 15 días; eso le ayuda a invertir más. Cuando sus cultivos están maduros; los vende a los compradores que llegan los fines de semana a la comunidad nativa; lo que más le agrada a Lida es poder sembrar diferentes variedades de frutos; además de dedicarse en sus tiempos libres a cultivar y machetear en otros terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan un dinero extra de acuerdo al periodo de trabajo que dura. Ahora tiene planes de sembrar cítricos, ya que estas plantaciones son cuidadas durante 8 años para que proporcionen fruto; tiempo suficiente para poder generar mayores ganancias a futuro. Mientras tanto está aprovechando la cosecha de café en estos meses, donde está segura podrá obtener muchas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Lida de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en: Lida is 25 years old. She is a cheerful and responsible woman and a single mother of 2 beautiful children:  Jeyson,  8 and Jeniffer,   3 months old. They live in their own house located in the Peruvian jungle (a native community called Centro Pumpuriani). For 2 years she has planted different products, such as plantains, yucca, and hybrid corn. This brings her earnings at different times of the year. For example, she harvests the corn 6 months after planting, the yucca after the corn, and the plantains every two weeks. This helps her invest more. When her crops are ready, she sells them to buyers who come on weekends to the native community. What Lida likes the most is being able to plant different varieties of products, in addition to spending her free time planting and clearing on other land, where they pay her extra money according to how long she works there. Now she plans to plant citrus, since these crops are grown for 8 years before they begin producing- enough time to be able to generate more income in the future. Meanwhile, she is taking advantage of the coffee harvest these months, when she for sure will be able to make some income. She belongs to the “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” [Little Bees of Pumpuriani] community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to have their cooperation to achieve her goals. She is also committed once again to making her payments, as with the previous loans she had. In addition, she likes being a part of her community bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. With your support, Lida will invest the money she has asked for in buying various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her coffee and plantain plantings.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat, who is photographed in FATEN's branch, is a 39-year-old woman from Zbabdeh village near Jenin city. Mervat has three daughters and three sons. Mervat's house needs urgent painting as the walls are in very bad shape. Besides that, the garden needs a fence around it and a front gate as it is the only place where her children can play during the day.

Mervat's husband is an employee and can't afford to cover these expenses at one time, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the painting and other expenses.

loans.use: to improve her house: paint the walls and install a fence around the garden and a front gate.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos 13, 9, 7 meses de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista; ella compra al por mayor gaseosas de los diferentes depósitos y también golosinas (caramelos, dulces, galletas, gomas de mascar, piqueos snack) al por mayor que la socia compra de los almacenes para vender al por menor; la socia vende de forma ambulatoria ella tiene una carreta armadas de todos los productos y no tiene un sitio establecido pero casi siempre es en una esquina cerca a un colegio o en una avenida principal, la socia ahora desea invertir el préstamo  en su vivienda, la socia comprara los materiales para hacer los acabados y revestimientos  en su vivienda.  

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 36, is a member of the “El Diamante de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s Diamond) communal bank located in Urubamba District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and three children who are 13 and 9 years and 7 months of age.  She is a retailer.  She buys soft drinks at wholesale from the various warehouses and also snacks (candy, caramels, cookies, chewing gum, chips) at wholesale from the various wholesale marts for subsequent resale at retail.

She is a street vendor; she has a cart loaded with all her products and does not have a fixed location but can almost always be found at a corner near a school or on the main street.  She wants to invest the loan in her home.  She will buy the materials and supplies to do the finishing touches and resurfacing on her house.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat is 32 years old and her husband, Ry, is 36 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Yat sells second-hand clothes. She buys clothes from Phnom Penh markets and sells them in the local market. Her husband is a farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free from farming. 

Yat is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom is a garment factory worker with an income of $3.5 per day. She is a single mother with three children. Two of her children are studying. Every month she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on rent, and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy rice and other materials for her sister to make food to sell.  She wants to help her sister's career run well to get some income to help with other expenses in the famiL.. For her children, she will help them to study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy rice and other materials to make food to sell

loans.name: Herminia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  Señora  Herminia tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo menor .Ella trabajo desde muy joven con su madre y su tío; con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro independizarse y montar su propio negocio desde hace 6  años .
Herminia tiene una despensa, que es su medio de subsistencia. Ya tiene una clientela bien formada en los alrededores del barrio donde vive. Con este trabajo logro construir su pequeña vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a su hijo. Lucha día a día por su hijo, ya que el es su mayor motivación a seguir adelante. Le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio, con lo cual podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de los mismos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, panificados, lácteos, bebidas y demás para el abastecimiento de su local. Está muy esperanzada con el crédito ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Herminia is 34 years old and a single mother with a young son. She had been working with her mother and her uncle ever since she was a young girl. With great effort and dedication, she was able to become independent and establish her own business six years ago.

Herminia has a food pantry which enables her to support herself. She has a well-established customer base from the surrounding areas of the neighborhood where she lives. Through her work, Herminia was able to build a small house and provide her son the necessary education. With great motivation, she and her son strive each day to move forward.

Herminia would like to expand her business so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers and meet their demands. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food products, baked goods, dairy products, beverages, and other items to restock her food pantry. She is extremely hopeful that this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy food products, baked goods, dairy products, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is proud that she belongs to the Igorot tribe. She is 55 years old and a widowed mother with five adult children. At her age, Anita still has her healthy body and does field work that is her source of income. She also shares her belief that the Igorot are physically fit. Anita manages her farming business and plants and harvests rice. Her business has allowed her to provide for her children in spite of being alone. This is why Anita loves farming.

Anita is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to sustain her farm and so she won’t lose her source of income despite her lack of financial resources. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for her crops and as well as seed to plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and seed

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, green grams, and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, green grams, and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a farmer working in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She helps her family till their land and plant rice crops. Marissa had to stop her studies due to financial difficulties in her family. Marissa works hard to support her family and save for her schooling.

Marissa requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to go back to school and finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.
 
Melchor has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants, ampalaya, red bell pepper, and squash. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Melchor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melchor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
D`Amour is 36 years old and married with four children between 3 and 10 years old. He makes a living by selling local drinks. This is his third successful year in this business and his work is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. 

D`Amour has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his stationary store, which offers services like photocopying and printing, and sells traditional stationary like books. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationary like reams of paper and will help Moses to generate greater profits and buy a refrigerator. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to finish building his house. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stationary like reams of paper

loans.name: Astrd Marcela

texts.es:
Astrid vive en el municipio de Sonsón con su esposo, desde hace varios años ella elabora artesanías como muñecos, pesebres, entre otros. Ella con esto le ayuda a su esposo para conseguir el sustento diario.

Ella quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para esto necesita comprar mas insumos para realizar mas artesanías para la venta, además ella quiere poder vender sus productos en otros municipios y así continuar con su progreso.
texts.en:
Astrid lives in the town of Sonsón with her husband. For several years, she has made artisanal crafts such as dolls, mangers, and more. With this, she helps her husband obtain their daily support.  

She wants to improve her quality of life and for that she needs to buy more materials to make artisanal crafts to sell. In addition, she wants to sell her products in other towns to continue her product.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artisanal crafts in fabric, polystyrene, and wool.

loans.name: Ines Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Ines Albertina es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos. Ines se dedica a la elaboración de ollas, cantaros, gallos y otros adornos elaborados de barro, se levanta temprano todos los dias para preparar su artesanía.
sus clientes son las personas que se dedican a comercializar con artesanía y los turistas que visitan la zona.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de las artesanias.
texts.en: Inés Albertina is a single mother; she has three children.  Inés manufactures pots, jugs, roosters and other decorations made from clay.  She rises early every day to make her crafts.  Her customers are people who sell crafts and tourists who visit the area.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make the crafts.

loans.use: to buy soil, clay, firewood, brushes and paint.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Angela sigue con su negocio de ropa nueva, venta de calzado,el cual lleva varios años en su negocio, su esposo sigue trabajando como docente y de sus tres hijos dos trabajan y la menor estudia.
Este año ha sido dificil, ya que con el credito anterior, lo desvio, ya que su hija menor se le enfermo de cancer cervico uterino, lo que fue una gran impresión y muchos gastos y que sirvio de mucho el financiamiento para suplir los medicamentos. Es por tal razon tiene poca mercaderia y que desea recuperarse en su inventario y ventas para seguir solventando los gastos.
Con este prestamo comprara: ropa variada, de dama y caballeros, trajes de niños y zpatos. Y lograr equilibrarse, para el bien comun de su familia.
texts.en:
Angela has been selling new clothing and shoes for some years now. Her husband works as a teacher and 2 of her children also work, while the youngest is still in school. 

This year has been difficult because her youngest daughter got cervical-uterine cancer which was a big shock and caused a lot of expenses, so they had to divert her previous loan to pay for her daughter's medications. For this reason she doesn't have a lot of merchandise and wants to recoup her inventory and sales to cover their expenses.

With this loan she will buy a variety of clothing and shoes for women, men and children. She hopes to achieve balance, for the common good of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for women, men and children to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Nenita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is married and has 3 children, one of whom is in school.

Dulce is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Dulce requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Dulce has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Rubango Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Sivia is a single hardworking woman who operates a bar for income generation. To supplement her incomes she earns a government salary working as a teacher. Her business dream is being economically well off and then plans to marry when she has stable income sources to look after her family. Her business is affected by high rental and license fees which reduces her returns. 

Sivia is in need of a loan to buy sodas and beers to sell. She is a member of Rubango Tweyombeke Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan since they don’t pledge security.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Since 2003, Tatyana has had a small business selling women’s lingerie. She is divorced and has one son. The business is the main source of income for her and her son. Tatyana acknowledges that through her experience she has learned a tremendous amount about every aspect of business. Her resolution and determination in her work have helped her learn flexibility and develop qualities like patience, perseverance and customer-friendliness. Tatyana’s ability to learn her customer’s preferences and tastes has helped her be more effective in her trade and achieve sales success. Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a vending facility and begin construction of a kiosk. She is also planning to use some money to re-stock her inventory so she can increase her sales. We believe that her hard work and common sense in combination with financial assistance will help Tatyana achieve her goals and expand her business as a result.

Тетяна займається продажем жіночої білизни вже з 2003 року. Вона – розлучена, в неї один син. Її бізнес – це єдине джерело прибутку для неї та її сина. Тетяна визнає, що завдяки багатому досвіду багато чого навчилася про кожний аспект бізнесу. Рішучість та цілеспрямованість Тетяни в роботі допомогли їй навчитися гнучкості та розвинути такі якості, як терпіння, наполегливість та привітність в обслуговуванні клієнтів. Здатність Тетяни передбачати смаки та побажання покупців дали можливість ефективно вести торгівлю та досягти успіху в бізнесі. Тетяна просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб купити торгівельне приміщення для подальшого будівництва кіоску. Вона також планує використати частину грошей для того, щоб вкласти їх в товар та збільшити обсяги продажів. Ми переконані, що наполеглива праця та розсудливість у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможуть Тетяні досягти мети та розширити власний бізнес.

loans.use: To purchase a vending facility

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana lives with her husband and sixteen-year-old daughter in Nikopol, Ukraine. For ten years, she has owned her own small clothing business where she sells a variety of women’s dress suits, coats, and shirts. Prior to owning her own business, Tatyana worked as an engineer at a steel/concrete plant.

Tatyana’s good work ethic and the availability of capital through Nadiya Ukraine have been keys that have helped her business grow and succeed. In the future, Tatyana hopes to further expand her business by opening additional sales kiosks.

Tatyana has requested a loan for 5050 Ukrainian Hrivna, or $1000, to help her purchase needed inventory for her kiosk. She normally buys around $1500 worth of new product twice a month in order to keep a good selection on hand to meet customer demand. This loan will provide continued support for Tatyana’s business as she works to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs Meas S. is 45 and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a construction worker and earns 2 dollars a day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns 5 dollars a day. They have 4 children. Two of them are still students. They need to repair their house that leaks during the rainy season. In the future, they would like to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To repair her house which leaks during the rainy season

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a young married woman of 28 years of age. Her husband looks after their plantation, and he is a very hard working husband. Amelia's plantation has many different crops. The taro blight discouraged her husband from growing taro, but the chemicals used for taro blight are now available in Samoa. Now her husband is spending more time on the taro plantation because he knows taro is always in demand. Amelia used her first loan with SPBD to buy some fertilizers, blight chemical, and paid for two laborers who helped her husband. Amelia is a happy mother now, as she is selling her taro in the new market twice a week. She hopes that she will have enough profit so she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To assist with her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice would like to increase her stock and rent a permanent premise for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Medet

texts.en: Medet M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 47 years old, married and has three sons.  He is engaged in sheep-breeding.  He has 20 years of experience in this business.  His sons help him at his business.  Medet wants to increase the number of his sheep.  To do this, he has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $900.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Eliza M. is 27 years old. She is married with three children. In 2000, Eliza established a used clothing business.  She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

Second-hand clothing comes across the ocean from America and Europe.  They are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets.  The clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk

loans.name: Mugunza A(Vi) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Winnie L.. She currently owns a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand her hotel business. Winnie is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging in age from 3 to 10 years and her children go to school. Each week, Winnie makes approximately UGX 70000 (US$41.00) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to buy more furniture for the hotel. Winnie has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 (US$59.00) to invest in her business by adding more stock in the shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Winnie is joined in her small group by Esname A. and Madina N.. Esname A. sells maize flour and Madina N. operates a business hotel. Both women want a loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Mrs. Tang S., 52, has six children. She owns a plot of land and grows rice, earning approximately one dollar a day. Her husband works as a construction worker and makes on average, about three dollars a day.

Two daughters work as a garment workers with a salary $80 a month; three other children are students, one of whom lives outside the family home.

Mrs. Tang will use this loan to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Margaret Kyamulabi’S Group

texts.en:
Margret K., age 25, is the leader of this group.  Margret is married with 5 children ranging from 1½- to 10 years old. Margret’s children are not in school because she is not able to pay school fees.  

Margret is a charcoal seller in Nakulabye, a suburb outside of Kampala City.  The loan will enable Margret to expand on her stock, provide food for family, and pay school fees for her children.  Margret’s major challenge is paying the store rent where she sells charcoal.

loans.use: The loan will enable Margret to expand her stock.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
This woman sells fish at the fishing dock, and she is asking for a loan to be repaid in 12 months in order to buy boxes and to strengthen her fish business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Cette femme vend du poisson au quai de pêche, elle sollicite un prêt remboursable en 12 mois pour acheter des bacs et renforcer son commerce de poissons.

loans.use: To buy boxes and to strengthen her fish-selling business

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: Kurbon A. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and employs three people on his farm, where he grows dehkan and raises livestock.  His business is stable and he has been able to pay back previous loans, which were used to buy pedigree bulls and other livestock.  Kurbon dreams of having a large flock one day, and therefore wants to open a trading outlet to sell meat and milk-sour products.  Therefore, he has applied for a loan of $1,200 for ten months, which will be used to buy the equipment necessary for producing commercially valuable milk-sour and meat products.

loans.use: To buy equipment for producing milk-sour and meat products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business producing food in a new market.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem L. lives in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province and makes a living by fishing. Her business faces a problem because she does have enough equipment, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more of the items she needs to do her work. Her husband, Mr. Phath Phan, is a pig breeder. Mrs. Khoem L. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. Last year, one of her children got dengue fever and she had to spent $75 to cure the disease. This is why Mrs. Khoem L. does not have enough money to buy the equipment on her own.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en: Saroun N., who is 27 years old, raises pigs; additionally, she distills alcohol for sale. Her husband is a construction worker. It takes 3 to 4 months to raise the pigs before selling them to butchers. During that time, Saroun uses the sale of alcohol to supplement her family's income. She works hard for her family and cares for two children, all of whom are too young to work. In order to expand her pig raising business, she would like to request a loan to purchase more piglets to raise. The remainder of the loan would be used to purchase wine materials. Saroun's husband is pictured because Saroun is unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and wine materials

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia tiene 24 años de edad,  inicio su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo golosinas, maíz, aguas gaseosas y fríjol.  Su pequeña tienda de productos de consumo ha crecido  paso el tiempo, y ha surtido mas.  Hoy en día ella también tiene un depósito de aguas gaseosas, y las que reparte a otros negocios mas pequeños cercanos al área donde vive, también vende y pan a domicilio. Con el tiempo ella ha ayudado a su esposo con el negocio que el tiene que es la elaboración de camisas de vestir. Ella desea el crédito ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes, y quiere hacer más grande su tienda, para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.  Su sueño es ahorrar y cuando sus hijos pequeños estudien poder cubrir y ayudar a esos gastos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 24 years old and started her business 3 years ago selling candies, corn, sodas, and beans. Her small store of products has grown over time and has developed significantly. Today she also has a warehouse of sodas that she distributes to other smaller businesses close to the area where she lives. She also sells and delivers bread. During this time, she has helped her husband with his business that manufactures shirts. She desires this loan because she has a large demand of customers and would like to grow her store to take advantage of the end of the year parties. Her dream is to save and be able to cover the bills when her small children become students.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in groceries for the growth of her business.

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua la señora Julia S. posee su propio tramo donde vende frutas y verduras ofreciéndolas a los clientes que día a día visitan el mercado en busca de sus productos. Debido a que la competencia de la señora Julia se ha incrementado, hoy en día le urge aumentar sus ventas y ofertar mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras y es por este motivo que una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos.

Hoy en día espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio y de esta forma continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia S. has her own stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua where she sells fruits and vegetables to her clients, who visit the market day after day in search of her products. Because of her ability, the business has grown. Today, it is necessary for her to increase her sales and offer more fruits and vegetables. As a result, she has come to Ceprodel again to get a loan, which will allow her to buy products.

She hopes that this loan will be offered to her so that she can continue her business and, in this way, continue bringing sustenance to her house.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem C. is 41 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables such as water-lilies and cabbages to sell. She is a mother of five children; three are in school and two are fisherman. Her husband, Mr. On Louy, 47, is a local fisherman who fishes around Tunle Sap Lake for fish to sell and to eat. Tem is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 to purchase furniture for decorating her house. The family lives in Kotlokkroam Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her house

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.es: Perseveranda tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijas mayores. Elabora  todo tipo de pasteles que ella misma decora para todo tipo de compromisos sociales, para cada semana hace un inventario de los pedido, luego va a comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar sus pasteles y cumplir puntualmente con sus pedidos, de esa manera garantiza los ingresos para su familia. Esta labor la viene haciendo desde su juventud y gracias a esta dedicación pudo sostener a sus hijos. Por el momento Perseveranda está a la espera de los  y preparando los implementos para hacer una bonita decoración. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad de dinero podrá invertir en la compra de harina, saborizantes, manteca, entre otros, ingredientes al por mayor, de este modo cubrirá los pedidos que tiene para realizar los pasteles.
texts.en:
Perseveranda is 64 years old and lives with her husband and older daughters. She creates all kinds of cakes that she decorates for all kinds of social events. Each week she takes an inventory of her orders; later she purchases all of the ingredients required to make the cakes and she works hard to complete her orders on time. Creating and decorating the cakes is how Perseveranda makes a living and supports her family. She has been working in this profession since she was young and thanks to her dedication she has been able to support her children. At the moment Perseveranda is waiting to purchase ingredients and preparing to create a beautiful decoration. This is the second time she has applied for a loan with MFP and she has demonstrated her ability to make her payments on time. With this loan she will be able to invest it by purchasing flour, flavoring, shortening, and other ingredients at wholesale prices. This will enable her to complete her orders and create beautiful cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her cake business

loans.name: Isioma

texts.en: Isioma N. is 39 years old and is married with 6 children. Isioma lives in Asaba, Delta state. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She has lots of customers and she works to meet the demands of her customers. She needs kiva's loan assistance to help expand her business. Isioma is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase more pepper soup ingredients and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup to sell

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
C. Anne-Marie a 49 ans et elle est scolarisée jusqu’au primaire. Elle a 5 enfants dont 2 sont décédés. Ses enfants s’appellent Arnaud, Hermane, et Laurrinda. Ca fait 20 ans qu’elle a commencé de vendre les produits de beauté et les sacs. Actuellement, elle continue de vendre les produits de beauté et elle a ajouté le divers comme les pâtes alimentaires, les produits concentrés, les sandalettes, et les savons. Anne-Marie était victime de vol et elle avait eu des problèmes d’approvisionnement, pourtant, le revenu de ses autres crédits lui a permis de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Anne-Marie voudrait changer son lieu d’activité à une boutique plus grande.
texts.en:
The meaning of the word Alide in the local Benin language is "there is always a road for the most poor". Benin is a small country in west Africa, beside Nigeria, where the yearly earning per capita is $1500. Alide offers special loans at 0% interest to the most vulnerable and is involved in a group about to start a micro-assurance health program. Anne-Marie C. is 49 years old and has a primary school education. She had 5 children, though two are deceased. Her children's names are Arnaud, Hermane, and Laurrinda. She started selling beauty products and bags twenty years ago. She continues to sell her beauty products but has added an assortment of items such as food spreads, concentrates, sandels and soaps. Anne-Marie was a robery victum so she had a provisioning problem. However, revenue earned with an earlier loan allowed her to meet the needs of her family. Anne-Marie would like to change the location of her business to a larger shop.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted items

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. Chek K. was born in 1961 and he now lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. He is a recycling collector who buys wastes such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on to re-sell to a recycling factory. Aside from this business, he is an ice cream seller. Since these businesses are going well, he wants to expand them, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more recycling waste to re-sell and he plans to use the rest of the loan to buy ice cream ingredients to make ice cream to sell. His wife, Mrs. Kheom Chan, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Chek K. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more recycling wastes to re-sell and to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura est composé de six femmes mariées dans des familles monogamiques exceptée une seule. Âgées en moyenne de 34 ans avec 4 enfants, elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Ségou Coura Somono de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali.)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié  et professionnel et exercent comme activité l’achat vente d’habits, de la pomme de terre, des fruits et légumes, des céréales et des condiments alimentaires tels que l’oignon, le sel de cuisine et des tomates. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs de riz, 6 sacs d’arachide en gousse dont une bonne partie est grillée et 400 kg de banane. Elles se ravitaillent en riz à Ségou  avec les forains de Siribala ; en arachide au grand marché de Ségou et la banane est livrée à domicile par les fournisseurs. Elles vendent en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants à domicile, au bord du goudron à Ségou Coura,  en ambulant et au marché du quartier.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de  38000FCFA qui sera  utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et des tontines. 
Leur ambition est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The group Soutoura is composed of six married women in monogamous families, except one. They average 34 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in the Ségou Coura Somono district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and profession. And they do buying and selling of clothing, potatoes, fruits and vegetables, grain, and condiments, such as onions, salt, and tomatoes.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their fourth gourp loan (solidarity loan). This loan will be used to buy: 20 sacks of rice, 6 sacks of unshelled peanuts (some of which will be roasted), and 400 kg of bananas.
