She hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable this year and she will get a good harvest, which will be sold locally. Nargila will use the extra income to finance the family’s daily living costs.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. For the past ten years she has had a food shop or sari-sari store from which she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gulira

texts.ru: Гулире 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулиры - среднее образование, она работает в школе поваром, также, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад с покупки скота на 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 коров, 15 овец. Для содержания скота на зиму подготовлены сараи, заготовлено сено и кукуруза стоимостью 40,000 сом (KGS), в качестве корма для скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Gulira is 40 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three children. Gulira has a secondary education. She works in a school as a cook. As an additional source for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulira's hard work, she currently has 7 cows and 15 sheep on her farm. For the further development of her farm, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 70,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd. Gulira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Priscillah wants to buy 1 dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
The money will be used to buy products to add more supplies to her store and increase sales. 

El capital lo invertirá en la compra de productos para abastecer su distribuidora e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.en:
Ms Delicia is 74 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband works in the coffee fields because the zone in which they live is a coffee region; it is surrounded by great vegetation and mountains. Delicia purchases pigs, and her children sell them to the indigenous communities surrounding her home. The meat of the animals, as well as piglets, is sold in the market or to other members of the community for their own raising. Delicia asks for a loan in order to purchase more pigs. This would enable her to support her children’s education. She is part of the Santa Catarina 3 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA DELICIA TIENE 74 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA,SIETE HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL CAFE PORQUE EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE ES UN SECTOR CAFETERO, RODEADA DE MUCHA VEGETACION Y DE MONTAÑAS. DELICIA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE PUERCOS Y A SU CRIANZA VENDIENDO A LAS COMUNIDADES INDIGENAS CERCANAS A SU CASA, LA CARNE DE LOS ANIMALES Y LOS PUERQUITOS CHIQUITOS LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO O A OTROS MIEMBROS DE LA COMUNIDAD PARA SU CRIANZA. DELICIA NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS PUERCOS Y COLABORAR DE ESTA FORMA A LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 3.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, mainly pigs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline C. R. lives in the May 1st neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She is single and the mother of three children. She has had an internet café business, located in her house, for the past five years.

She began 10 years ago by selling household appliances in the July 16th Market. Two years later she joined Pro Mujer and got her first micro loan, with which she increased her amount of merchandise and her sales until she was able to save up a small amount of capital. Her continued association with Pro Mujer allowed her to open her internet business.

Due to the demand in her neighborhood, Jacqueline needs to invest in more computer equipment and furniture, with the goal of expanding her business to meet existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jacqueline C. R., vive en la zona 1º de Mayo de la ciudad de El Alto, soltera, pero madre de tres hijos, hace 5 años es propietaria de una sala de Internet ubicada en su domicilio. Comenzó hace 10 años vendiendo electrodomésticos en la Feria 16 de Julio, dos años después ingresó a Pro Mujer, accediendo a su primer micro crédito con el cual incrementó su mercadería y sus ventas hasta lograr reunir un pequeño capital, que asociada a su continuidad en Pro Mujer le permite la apertura de una sala de Internet. Debido a la demanda de salas en su zona, Jacqueline necesita invertir para la compra de más equipos de computación y mobiliario con el fin de ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and furniture to expand her internet cafe business

loans.name: Alikhan

texts.en:
Alikhan has been farming for 8 years. He is 42 years old, married and has one child. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region.
He requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his farm.

loans.use: Tp purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Sra. Elida P. is 56 years old living in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. She has two children. One of her children is married. The other is 15 years old and lives at home while attending high school. Elida pays for her education. Elida sells fruits and vegetables on a rolling cart that she was able to obtain bit by bit through much hard work and sacrifice. Before she had this cart she used a metal basket, which she had attached to motorcycle wheels. Elida is able to sell many fruits and vegetables, and is always warm and optimistic with her customers.

Elida also runs a small kiosk out of her house, which she established after the death of her husband. Her daughter takes care of the kiosk while Elida is selling her fruits and vegetables around the neighborhood. When her daughter is at school Elida returns to her house to manage the kiosk as well as take care of household chores. Elida has an indomitable spirit that allows her to move forward and succeed in her life. Other than the money she earns from selling her fruit and through the kiosk, she also receives a monthly stipend of $58, which was allotted to her due to the death of her husband. Elida wishes to enlarge her stock and activities by purchasing various items for her store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise including: Fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, herbs, noodles, cookies, cigarettes, spices and others.

loans.name: Onah

texts.en: Onah is 40 years old and the mother of a child aged 13. She produces and sells cakes and also brings them to several shops, earning about US$ 15 per week. Her husband, S., is a laborer who only earns a small income. Onah has to work very hard to earn extra money to support her family. She is requesting a loan of US$ 100 so she can produce more varieties of cakes. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more varieties of cakes

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Needing money for her children made Ada begin selling vegetables in the market. 17 years later, she continues selling in the same locale. Now her worry is taking care of her 70 year old father who suffers from rheumatism.

Thanks to her business, Ada has been able to give a good education to her 4 children and one of her nephews.

Since she was young she dreamed of having a restaurant or soda fountain, for which she is asking a loan of 3 thousand soles to be able to achieve this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad de dinero para sus hijos, hizo que la señora Ada comenzara a vender verduras en un Mercado. 17 años después, sigue vendiendo en el mismo puesto. Ahora su preocupación es cuidar a su padre de 70 años quien sufre de reumatismo.

Gracias a su negocio, Ada ha podido darles una buena educación a sus 4 hijos y a uno de sus sobrinos.

Desde joven su sueño fue tener un restaurante o fuente de soda, por lo que de tener un préstamo de 3 mil soles, podría lograrlo.

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 35 year old father of 4. He works and lives with his wife and children in south Lebanon, in Tyre. Mohamad is a butcher and needs a loan to buy provisions. He is determined to generate enough revenue to buy a car to use for his business transportation work. He is doing the best he can to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his butcher shop

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add capital. Rose is 30 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Margret O., Hamida M., Loyce O., and Betty T.. Margret O. has a business selling maize and wants to purchase more raw maize. Hamida M. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to buy more saucepans and furniture. Loyce O. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more shelves and stock. Betty T. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To boost clothing sales business

loans.name: Tubia

texts.en:
Tubia is 32 years old and is married woman. She takes care of 1 person, age 60 years old. Tubia owns a small shop, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 9am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $475 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 22 years old and is a single woman. Hawa owns a small general store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Hello from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Maria S.. She is married, and has two children aged 15 and 20. She has three dependents, In 2003, Maria established her home decorations business. Maria requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of home decorations. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of home decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a collection of chic jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Chu Thi Nghien Group

texts.vi:
Ms, C. Thi Nghien is 40 years old. Her family has 2 children and very good income. Her husband delivers merchandise and selling to businesses. She raises pigs and sells chickens and pigs. She had borrowed money before and repaid. She would like to borrow 205.00 USD to purchase additional merchandise to sell. In her group there are the following members: Ms. Phạm thị Ngà, loan amount 205.00 USD to buy pigs to raise; Ms. Ngô thị Bình, loan amount 205.00 USD to invest in a retail shop; Ms. Ngô thị Liên, loan amount 205.00 USD to invest in a silkworm shop; Ms. Hoàng thị Thức, loan amount 130.00 USD to raise chickens and ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị C. thị Nghiên năm nay 40 tuổi MS 09050017,gia đình chị có 2 con và có khá nhiều thu nhập: Chồng lái xe ô tô chuyên vận chuyển hàng hoá kinh doanh, buôn bán. Chị vừa chăn nuôi lợn, bán cám gà, cám lợn...C. kỳ trước chị đã tham gia vay vốn và trả rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay 3.360.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên :

  • Chị Phạm thị Ngà MS 09050019 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • Chị Ngô thị Bình MS 09050020 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hoá
  • Chị Ngô thị Liên MS 09050021 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để làm hàng tơ tằm
  • Chị Hoàng thị Thức MS 09050093 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để chăn nuôi vịt gà

loans.use: retail business

loans.name: Šaha

texts.en:
Šaha is from village Stupari, near the town Kladanj. She lives with her husband and two children who go to school. Her husband works as a seasonal constructor in Croatia.

Šaha does agriculture and cattle breeding and sells milk and milk products. She can earn about 150 KM monthly.

This is her first loan at Women for Women International, in the amount of 1000 KM ($US750), and she will use it to buy additional hay for her cow. Šaha will need more food for her cow because the winter will be long and her cow will bear a calf at the beginning of the next year.

loans.use: To buy hay.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Prek Teng, 48, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children study in local schools. One daughter is a silk weaver.

Mrs. Sina has been a silk weaver for eleven years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle M. in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years.

Mrs. Sina is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase silk materials to continue her and her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Morona Nº 144, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado administrativo en el Magisterio. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de refrescos, tamales, empanadas y otros. 
 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio. De Lunes a Viernes en las mañanas vende en la I.E Comercio (empanadas, tamales, refrescos, aguajes y otros antojitos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un saco de azúcar, 5 litros de aceite, un ciento de cocona, 2 sacos de aguajes, etc.

Sofía manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que les gusta luchar y trabajar en la vida.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" [United Neighbours] communal bank located at Jr. Morona Nº 144, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 44 years old and has 5 adult children. She is married, her husband works in educational administration. Sofia decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, 300 soles in the sale of soft drinks, pies, tamales (Peruvian stuffed corn pastries) and other goods.

At the moment she continues in the same business. She sells pasties, tamales, soft drinks, palm fruit and other snacks at the trade school in the mornings from Monday to Friday.

She will purchase a sack of sugar, 5 litres of oil, a hundred coconas, 2 sacks of palm fruit etc. with this loan of 1000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 4 months.

Sofia demonstrates that the communal bank is a great help for all women who like to fight and work.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase sugar, oil, cocona, palm fruit, etc.

loans.name: Thourk

texts.en: Mrs. Thourk O. is a villager in Kradass Khor village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice for a living. She earns a small amount of revenue from rice sales and would like to increase her income and has decided to request a loan to buy additional land to cultivate more rice. Her husband, Mr. Naov Liv, is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Thourk O. is 49 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy an additonal piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P., 42 year old mother of four, lives in the province of Pursat. Two of her sons are students; one daughter is a farmer; and another daughter is married and lives away from home. Mrs. P. has been growing rice and vegetable crops for nearly twenty years. 

Her husband, Ram Roeun, is 42 years old. He works with his wife as a rice farmer, and raises ducks, chickens, and pigs at their home. He usually sells his animals four or five months after raising them for poultry purposes. Poultry is the main source of income for the family. Mrs. P. has requested a loan for her husband to buy more piglets, ducks, and chickens to raise. 

Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy piglets, ducks, and chickens to raise

loans.name: Ndèye Badji

texts.fr: Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à  acheter et revendre du jus de citron et de l’huile de palme .Elle achète en Guinée pour revendre à Dakar. Ndèye veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 years old, is married and cares for seven children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Peyrissac village bank for seven and a half years. She buys and sells lemon juice and palm oil. She travels to Guinée to buy and sells in Dakar. Ndèye wants to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell lemons and palm oil.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata C. est une femme mariée, mère de 02 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés (Thioup), ce qu’elle exerce depuis plusieurs années déjà. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata C. is a married woman, the mother of 2 children for whom she is responsible. She wants this loan to bolster her business selling locally dyed cloth (known as Thiob). She has been in this business for several years already. Her goal is to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of locally dyed cloth made using indigo

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa G. D. V., resiD. en El Junquillo departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y pequeños hijos. A sus 50 años D. edad, Margarita trabaja haciendo comida típica la cual la venD. al contado. Así también posee una pequeña tienda en la cual venD. algunas golosinas. Junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para lograr cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, afortunadamente ambos son conocidos como personas muy honradas y trabajadoras, así también poseen muy buenas ventas. Es por ello que el anhelo D. Margarita es poder aumentar los productos D. su tienda, así también desea contar con el dinero para poder comprar más materia prima para realizar los platillos típicos. Es por eso que Margarita solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda invertir y ver las ganancias necesarias para gozar D. una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa G. D. Velásquez resides in El Junquillo in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and small children. In her 50 years of age, Margarita works preparing traditional food which she sells for cash. She also owns a small store in which she sells certain sweets. Luisa and her husband work arduously to be able to cover all the costs of their home; fortunately, both are well known as honest and hardworking people, and for that reason they have very good sales. Due to this Margarita yearns to be able to increase the products in her store, and also wishes to count on the money to be able to purchase more basic materials to make her traditional dishes. It is because of this that Margarita is requesting a loan through which she may be able to invest and attain the necessary profits to be able to enjoy a better life accompanied by her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for food preparation.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois (3), dame A. Akouvi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois, de maïs et d’ignames. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2005 et tire beaucoup de profit qui lui permet d’aider son mari qui est chauffeur dans les dépenses de la famille.
Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 50 tubercules d’ignames et 12 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Akouvi A. sells charcoal, corn and yams. She started her business in 2005 and is able to make good profits which allow her to help her husband, a driver, with the family expenses. Having repaid her first loan on time, she is asking for this, her second loan, to buy 50 yam tubers and 12 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and charcoal

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en: Aminat A. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells drinks. She is requesting for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for resale

loans.name: Lucia Virgenia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Lucia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además tiene un bar en donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas. En algunas oportunidades Lucia viaja a las ferias en donde compra carne y queso.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, queso, carne.
Lucia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una buena casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Bienestar communal bank. She is married, 43 years old and has 4 children. Lucia has a store in her house where she sells groceries. She also has a bar selling drink, which she does with the help of her daughters. Sometimes Lucia travels to various markets where she purchases meat and cheese to sell. Lucia needs a loan of 900 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of grains, cheese and meat. Lucia's dreams are that her children become professionals, having a good house and purchasing a car.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains, cheese and meat to sell

loans.name: Olina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32 years old Olina N. from Mbeya. She is single. Olina has been running a crop buying and selling business since 2007.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Olina currently earns about US $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Olina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ines Alfonso

texts.es: Inés Alfonso E. G. tiene 55 años de edad ya esta casado y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales seis viven de manera independiente y la menor de 14 años aun esta bajo su responsabilidad. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de granos básicos, se inicio en este rubro económico ya que era profesor y su salario era tan bajo que decidió experimentar con la venta de cerdos, esto le ayudo mucho pero no era lo que el había esperado, asi que nuevamente experimento con la compra y venta de granos básicos la que le ha dado buenas ganancias, desde entonces su negocio ha prosperado considerablemente pues ha logrado comprar cada vez mas cantidad de granos básicos a los productores, y aunque ha sufrido muchos problemas de salud ha podido mantenerse firme y  ha logrado preparar a sus hijos mayores con una buena educación y aun sigue con su hija pequeña, para la cual el desea verla toda una profesional con buenos valores. Su más grande deseo es comprar un camión de carga que le permita transportar artículos desde el norte del país.
texts.en:
Ines Alfonso E. G. is 55 years old and married with 7 children. Six of them live independently and the seventh is 14 and still lives at home. Ines works buying and selling staple grains, a business he started as a high school teacher when his salary was so low that he decided to try out selling pigs. This helped him much more than he was anticipating, and from there he moved on to his current venture which has been very profitable. Since its beginning, his business has prospered since he has been able to buy more grains from the wholesalers each time, and although he has had many health problems, he has stayed strong, and has managed to provide his older children with a good education. His youngest daughter is still in school, and he wants to see her grow up to become a successful young woman with solid values. Ines' deepest wish is to buy a bulk truck which will allow him to transport grains from the northern part of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: María Azucena C. E. tiene 43 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. Hace más de 18 años que vende comida. Ya que cuando ella inicio este negocio fue, por cuenta propia para ayudar en los gastos de la familia y además sacar a su hijos adelante, por lo que desde muy joven aprendió este oficio, para que a sus hijos pudieran estudiar. María Azucena dio inicio con una pequeña mesa en las afueras del mercado, muy humildemente se levanta todos los días temprano en busca de las compras y además tiene que preparar los alimentos para llevarlos a ofrecer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de carnes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, plátanos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Azucena C. E. is 43 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children in her care. She has been selling food for over 18 years. When she began this business on her own it was to help with the family expenses and to help her children get ahead, so she learned this profession at a young age so her children would be able to go to school María Azucena began with a small table outside the market. Humbly she would get up early every morning to shop and then she had to prepare the food to take and sell. The financing she seeks is to buy meat, oil, rice, beans, bananas, and more. Her wish is to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Usocan. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has two adult children. Teresita operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (about $58) a month for these activities.

In 2000, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. NORMA ELIZABETH M.  se dedica al comercio, ella vende jeans para caballero y botas de cuero,  cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio ya que antes de tener su propio negocio ella trabajo en una tienda similar a la que hoy en dia tiene pues ya tiene mas de 1 año de tener su propia tienda la cual opera bajo el nombre Tiendita YONOR.
esta ubicada en la zona comercial del municipio de Las Trojes frente a Golosinas DELITYPIC ella nos 
comento que una de las razones que le ha permitido salir adelante es que desea terminar de construir su casa. 
con el credito que esta solicitando lograra dar un paso y subir un peldaño en la escalera de sus sueños puntualizo chevita como popularmente se le conoce en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Señora NORMA ELIZABETH M. sells men's jeans and leather boots. She has 12 years of experience with this kind of business. Before having her own business, she worked in a similar store and now has had her own store for more than a year. She calls it Yonor. Its located in a commercial area in the city of Las Trojes across from Delitypic, a candy store. She told us that one of the reasons that she has been able to get ahead is because she wants to finish building her home. With this credit, she will be able to take another step forward and climb a rung on the ladder of her dreams, Chevita (how she is known in her community) pointed out.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and leather boots for men

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón esta casado con la Sra. Laura hace varios años tienen 3 hijos menores que aún están en la escuela primaria, el mayor tiene 12 años y ya le ayuda a sus padres en el negocio,-
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente. El Sr. Ramón además trabaja como transportista en el micro centro,- 
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden   educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.-
Ellos han demostrado ser  personas muy responsables y honestas en sus compromisos. 
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones,-

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías Varias, azúcar, arroz, fideo, jabones varios y otros,-

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa Chimiddorj is 55 years old and lives with her husband in their apartment in Arkhangai Province in central Mongolia. They have raised their two children, who are now fully grown and live on their own. 

Gerelmaa operates a sewing business in her town with the help of her retired husband. She provides new, neat and inexpensive clothes to her many customers and is best known for her dressmaking. Gerelmaa started her sewing businss in 1996 with capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~$36 USD). She has worked hard and has steadily grown her business over the years. Because the sewing business is the only source of income for her and her husband, it is vital that Gerelmaa increase her sales and invest more in her business to continue their quality of life. 

Gerelmaa is very passionate about her trade and loves the work. She says,"Sewing clothes for others makes me the happiest person." For the future, she hopes to increase the variety of clothes that she produces to attract new customers. She is requesting a 100,000 tugrug ($75 USD) loan to buy more thread, materials, fabrics and needles for her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy more thread, materials, fabrics and needles

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es: El señor Sabas vive con su esposa la señora Emelia y son padres de familia de dos pequeñitos y ellos iniciaron un negocio propio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, negocio que tienen establecido y aun pequeño desde hace 2 años, están tramitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima como harina, rexal, manteca etc.; para elaborar su producto que está gustando a la ciudadanía ya que las colocan en tienditas de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Sabas lives with his wife, Emelia, and they have two small children. They started their own business making flour tortillas. They established their small business two years ago. They are asking for this loan to buy raw materials like flour, baking powder, and shortening, etc. to make their product. People enjoy their product, which is located in grocery stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make flour tortillas

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una socia alegre y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años D. edad, madre tres hijos, todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. comida por las mañanas, actividad que lo realiza todos los días D. la semana en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es chofer D. autos. Rosa integra el Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Valientes” desD. hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en alimento balanceado para pollos, actividad que realizaba antes y los vendía en el mercado, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. mesas, sillas, manteles y utensilios para su negocio D. venta D. comida. La meta D.  Rosa es tener un restaurante  y  salir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a happy and dynamic associate who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 57 years old and the mother of three grown children. She concentrates on selling food in the mornings which she does from her home each day of the week, counting on the support of her husband who is a car driver. Rosa has been a member of the "Mujeres Valientes" Communal Bank for four years. The first loan she received allowed her to invest in balanced feed for chickens, which she used to sell in the market. Currently she needs a loan of 1300 soles that will let her invest in the purchase of tables, chairs, tablecloths and utensils for her food business. Rosa's goal is to own a restaurant and move ahead in her work.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths and utensils for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a kiosk selling groceries like tomatoes, sukuma wiki (kale), spinach, onions, and fruit. She has been running her kiosk for nine years and mainly sells to families in the area. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy fruit, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. She hopes to enlarge her grocery business and compete better with the goal of building her family a home. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious and says that loans from Faulu have enabled her to sustain her family.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fruit, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Honey Lou

texts.en:
Honey Lou H. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and married. To make a living, Honey Lou owns and operates a business making and selling food. She sells bread, cakes and cookies to the local community. Honey Lou has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Honey Lou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Honey Lou is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 38 years old and married with a child.  He lives in Ibadan Oyo State, Nigeria. He sells bags of dried pepper and has been selling it for the past seven years.  With this business, he is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of N50,000, he plans to expand his bags of dried pepper business, which is now booming. With this kind of business, he hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for his children's education. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of dried pepper to sell

loans.name: Sohada

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’agoè atsanvé, elle est une célibataire ; pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle a commencé en 1998 la vente de bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle car beaucoup de personnes viennent déjeuner chez elle le matin. Actuellement les matières nécessaires à son activité sont épuisées, elle souhaiterait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de sucres, 2 sacs de mil et divers.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Atsanvé neighborhood. She is unmarried. To meet her own needs, she started to sell cornmeal porridge in 1998. This business is going well because many people come to eat at her place in the morning. Currently the supplies needed for her business are exhausted and she would like to resupply. That is why she asked WAGES for her first loan to buy two sacks of corn, three sacks of sugar, two sacks of millet and various other things.

Translated from French by Bruce Popp, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Corn, Sugar and Other Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Chann T. is a villager from Royak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband (shown on the right of the photo), Mr. Tho Thuok, is a construction worker. The couple has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest attends the local school. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Chann T. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. In this way, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ndiolé

texts.fr: Ndiolé Y. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, une activité qui lui génère de revenus lui permettant de participer aux différentes charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndiolé Y. is a 45-year-old married mother of one child. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 2 and half years. She raises cattle, and this business generates an income that allows her to participate in providing for various family needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Traoré est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 1 enfant qui  vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père  à Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, il décida de partir à l’aventure, précisément en Côte d’Ivoire à la recherche d’une vie meilleure. Ses ambitions n’ont pas été réalisés, il décida de retourner à Bougouni auprès de son père pour apprendre le commerce, notamment l’achat et la vente d’articles divers tels les articles de fête, les cosmétiques, les mèches pour cheveux etc. Avec une expérience de 11 ans, Monsieur Mohamed Traoré maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité et apprécié.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Il compte acheter des articles de fêtes, des tissus pour pantalons et chemises,  des produits de beauté et des parfums.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako,(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes  Ses clients sont composés d’hommes et femmes. 
Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
 Il ambitionne dans les années à venir agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed Traoré is 30-year-old married man, father of one child. He lives with his wife and child at his father’s home in Bougouni (Third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) in the neighborhood of North Hérémakono. After attending Koranic School, he decided to venture in search of a better life, more precisely in Ivory Coast. His aspirations were not realized. He decided to return to his father in Bougouni to learn to trade, specifically the sale of various articles such as party items, cosmetics, hair extensions etc… Mr. Mohamed Traoré has 11 years of experience and he masters his trade, he is very much in demand and appreciated. In his search for additional financial resources, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second individual loan; the first one has been fully reimbursed. He is planning on buying party items, cloth for pants and shirts, cosmetic products and perfumes. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako (Capital of the Republic of Mali). His customers are men and women. The religious holidays and big occasions (baptism, weddings) are times when the sale of his articles is intense. With this loan he is planning on making a monthly profit of 70, 000 Franc CFA. It will be used to provide for the family’s needs and reinvested the rest in the business. In the coming years, he would like to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles es una joven mujer humilde, trabajadora, sencilla la cual se dedica al diseño y elaboración de calzado femenino. En un comienzo su taller era un pequeño espacio actualmente este a ido creciendo.

Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima para la producción de una línea de verano entre los materiales se encuentran  plantillas, cuerina, brasil, pega, hilo, suelas etc.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles is a young, simple, hard working, and humble woman who designs and makes women's shoes. At one time her workshop was a tiny space and today it has been growing. She will invest her loan in the purchase of prime materials for the production of a summer line. Some of the materials are: insoles,faux leather, brasil, glue, thread, soles etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make women's shoes

loans.name: Bud

texts.en:
Bud C., age 55, is married and resides with her children in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has six children. She is engaged in a business of selling peanuts, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since C. and her husband have had these businesses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike with a compartment attached. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike with a compartment attached

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya C. (in the photo), 52 and her husband, Mr. Samnang Kroes, 64, have been married since 1978 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, another two work for a garment factory, one is a chef, and other one is a construction worker. The family lives in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh.  

Ya stays at home. The main source of income is from her children’s salaries. But, it’s very difficult for them to get to work. They must commute to work, which is very far from their home, and they have to take a motor taxi, which is very expensive. 

Therefore, Ya is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to get work.

loans.name: Sandya

texts.en:
Sandya is a 32-year-old married woman living in the town of Kekanadura in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has two sons and her husband works as a mason. Sandya has managed a business sewing clothes and selling them to local customers for three years. She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing cloth.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth for a sewing business

loans.name: Mambetalieva's Group

texts.en:
The life of a small city differs from that of a village. In a village people at least possess a piece of land and may have some cattle to breed and can grow different kinds of vegetables and fruits in their gardens. For city residents the situation is somehow more specific. First of all, people depend on employers and markets. Especially in Kyrgyzstan, where cities used to be centers of industry, they now resemble villages because the living standards have worsened. 

However, even in that situation there are many people who, unlike their compatriots, find energy, ideas and inspiration to look for a better life and opportunities. P. Mambetalieva is the leader of this group. She is twenty-three, married, and has a four-year-old son. Her husband trades in spare parts for cars in a specialized market.

P. does her best to help her husband support the family, selling women’s clothes at retail prices. She has been doing this for the last two years and now her monthly income is around $200. P. has many plans regarding her occupation. She decided to apply for this loan because it would help her purchase new items of clothing (summer and fall) and thus expand her assortment. 

P.’s partners:

N. Jyrnova, 42, is married and, together with her husband, they keep a household and raise cattle. Apart from trading in cattle they also sell milk and manage to earn about $190 a month. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy a calf for feeding.

T. Abduldayev, 24, is married and has a four-month-old daughter. His wife stays at home with the child. To provide for the family, T. manufactures furniture. He used to work in a factory but now has his own business. T. needs this loan to buy materials for making furniture. 

Z. Abduldayeva, 27, is married and has a son. Her husband is a welder. Z. cannot work now and stays at home with the child. Her husband’s monthly income is around $205. She has applied for this loan to buy a calf for feeding and thus help her husband financially. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase new items of clothing to expand her assortment

loans.name: Progressive Women Group

texts.en:
John Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Progressive Women. He is 37 years old, married and has two children who range from 18 to 22 years old. He was only able to attend school through eighth grade due to financial difficulties. 

For 17 years, he has been selling T-shirts and trousers on Carey Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more T-shirts and trousers.

His dream is to grow his business, make more profit, venture into international business and continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more T-shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Shonazar

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Шоназар проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает шнурки для обуви, ножницы, брелок, т.е. разную мелочь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Shonazar S. lives in the J. Rumi region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He has been selling on the market for more than five years. Shonazar mainly sells shoe laces, scissors, keychains and other small items. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Wilner Oswaldo

texts.es:
Wilner Oswaldo D. T. tiene 31 años. Tiene 2 niños, Bryan (6) y Jairon (3), y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Wilner es un socio de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Wilner se dedica a la agricultura. Realiza sus compras y ventas en el mercado la Merced en Chillanes.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la agricultura. Su sueño es hacer una casa par sus hijos. 

Le gusta jugar fútbol y correr en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Wilner Oswaldo D. T. is 31 years old. He has two sons, six year old Bryan and three year old Jairon. He is in a common law marriage, and he lives in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province. Wilner is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank, which is one and a half hours from the Cillanes canton. There are 18 members in all. Most of them have their own businesses. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San José. Wilner works in agriculture. He makes his purchases and sales in the Merced market in Chillanes. He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture. His dream is to build a house for his children. In his free time he likes to play soccer and run.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in agriculture

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda K. is currently in the business of selling food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

Roda is 21 years old and is married to a driver. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor area of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
A. Akramjon is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He is a hardworking man struggling to feed his children by selling fabrics for national dresses. Akramjon has a trading place in the central local market of Dushanbe city. He tries to stock a wide range of goods to meet the requirements of his customers and satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income.
Akramjon, a devoted father, is doing his utmost in order for his children to be well educated and happy. Today, he feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to jumpstart his business and raise his family's standard of living.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina J. is from the city of Hinagdong Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Gina is single. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business that provides motor transport "HABAL-HABAL" services. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle so she can provide better service. This will be Gina's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle so she can provide better service

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en:
Taulau T. is 34 and married with 8 children. She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Taulau has three years of experience in this business. Taulau needs a loan of 1500 talas to buy flour, flavorings, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $135 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Taulau joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Taulau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy flour, flavorings, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 47 años de edad, está casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos el mayor de 4 años, ellos administran un pequeño negocio donde ofrecen comida y venden productos de la canasta básica, el negocio fue iniciativa propia y juntos lo tienen desde hace 12 años trabajando desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería y aumentar su negocio, ayudando a que su inventario este fuerte y puedan cubrir con las demandas de los clientes; ellos desean comprar gaseosas, jugos, queso, jamón, y otros que le son necesario para la preparación de la comida que ofrecen cada día a los clientes.
El sueño de don Santos es crecer con su negocio, aumentar sus ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
47-year old Don Santos is married and lives with his wife and two children, the elder of whom is four years old. He and his wife run a small business where they sell food and other basic supplies. They started the business on their own initiative and have had it for twelve years, working from 8 am to 10 pm. Santos is seeking a loan to buy merchandise and stock his business with more products. This way he will be able to satisfy his customers’ requests. He wishes to buy such items as soft drinks, juices, cheese, ham, and whatever else he needs for the food he offers each day to his customers. Santos’s dream is to expand the business and increase his income so that he can provide a better life for his family and education for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Sayyi Group

texts.en: Pictured here are members of the Sayyi Group. They run small scale businesses in Magburaka town, in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. The leader of this group is William B.. William, age 52, was born in Mabonto village. He is married with eleven children. His wife is a businesswoman. Six of his children are attending primary school and five are in secondary schools. For many years now, William has been selling palm wine (wine tapped from palm trees), cigarettes, mints, biscuits, etc. William is requesting a loan of 800,000 leones in order to buy gallons of palm oil and cigarettes to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil and cigarettes for his business

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai T. V. is 48 years old with two children who are attending college. She is a farmer who cultivates 2,160 square meters. Mai grows rice, fresh vegetables, and corn. She has been a client of SEDA since 2006 and has effectively used loans in the past. Mai is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy fertilizer and a tow truck to reduce her labor force.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a tow truck

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 30 años, es conviviente y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Marisol es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de gorros y tambien se dedica a la venta comida. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Marisol con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para uso personal. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marisol is 30 years old, she has a live-in partner and participates in the community bank “Señor De Los Temblores II” of the Arariwa microfinance unit of the city of Cusco, Peru. Marisol is an entrepreneur and working mother who sells hats and food. (One of the eight wonders of the world is located in Cusco, the citadel of the Incas called Machu Picchu).

Marisol, with her next loan which she expects of 1500 PEN will invest the money on personal uses.
 
The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded to her by this medium and agrees to maker her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta and other supplies.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kalpana S.. She is married and has three children, aged 22, 20 and 16. In 2006, she established a grocery store. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. In the future, Kalpana plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory stocked and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Solomon Oyieko

texts.en:
Solomon M. is twenty-seven-year-old single man from Kisumu City, a lakeside city on Lake Victoria. He runs a secondhand business at Kondele, a busy shopping center that is about 2 km. from the heart of the city. He has been in this business for the last six years. He has vast experience and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Solomon recently joined KADET in order to access microcredit. He has been awarded a 50,000 KES loan that he will use to buy more used clothing for sale.  He will use the profits to invest in the business by obtaining what his clientele demands.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

Mwanarusi has operated a food stall business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also has housing properties that provide her with additional lincome. Mwanarusi faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes as well as fruits for making natural juices. She decided to join Yehu because of its absence of complex legal requirements, and hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, and fruits for making natural juices.

loans.name: Lorgio Cristobal

texts.es:
Lorgio Cristobal T. B. tiene 49 años de edad, es Soltero vive solo en el Cantón de Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Lorgio Cristobal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del pueblo.
texts.en:
Lorgio Cristobal T. B. is 49 years old.  He is single and lives alone in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for many years.

Lorgio Cristobal is a farmer.  He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in the Matilde Esther shopping area and sells his products in Bucay.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.

The support of this loan will help Lorgio Cristobal to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.  He enjoys taking part in the town's fiestas.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Savorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. has been selected president by the twelve members of this village bank loan group living in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeu Set, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. He is a construction worker. Mrs. Sao S. is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow to start a new business breeding cattle. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia C. is from the village of Naggasican, Santiago City. She is 50 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge Eliecer E. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboraciòn y venta de “peto”, una deliciosa  bebeida o chicha caliente, que se prepara con maiz pilado, azucar una pizca de sal y canela; esta actividad la iniciò para cambiar su antiguo negocio de fabricaciòn de un embutido costeño y muy artesanal llamado “butifarra”, al que se  dedicaba anteriormente solo los fines de semanas, pero como Jorge Eliecer es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable de su familia, decidiò adicionar otra actividad rentable que le generara ingresos todos los dias,  asi es que conociendo el oficio de vender peto, en el cual trabaja su padre, decidiò reemplazarlo  para tener mayores ingresos, pues en su familia en la medida que crecen, aumenta las necesidades del hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años.  Desde que iniciò en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con su primer financiamiento vio cambios positivos en su negocio, especialmente porque es un  nuevo capital de trabajo que invierte y genera otras utilidades imprimiendole la fuerza de trabajo. El credikiva es su segundo financiamiento y con èl cambiará el triciclO (vehiculo de tres ruedas) y  los tanques de aluminio  condicionando su infraestructura y  ademàs comprará insumos para la elaboracion del producto. 
Su principal sueño es tener una casa propia para aumentar el bienestar de su famlia y por eso trabaja arduamente porque ellos son su inspiraciòn para hacerlo. En la actualidad su negocio presenta una rentabilidad  sobre la venta del 22%, un endeudamiento futuro muy bajo lo que con su capacidad de trabajo y experiencia emprendedora haran que esta nueva inversion tenga éxito, porque impactarà sus ingresos
texts.en:
Jorge Eliecer E. lives in the city of Barranquilla.  He makes and sells “peto” , a delicious drink, or warm  “chicha”  (a drink derived from corn).  It is prepared with husked corn, sugar, a pinch of salt and cinnamon.

He started this activity in order to change from his old business of making handmade coastal sausages called “butifarra”.  Previously he only worked on this on the week-ends.  But, as Jorge Eliecer is a very hard-working and responsible family man, he decided to add another business activity that would generate income every day.  That is how he got to know the job of selling peto, a business in which his father works.  He decided to fill in for him in order to have greater earnings.  

As his family grows, the household necessities increase.  His home is made up of his wife and their two children, ages 9 and 15.

Since he started with his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domino, he has seen positive changes in his business.  This is especially true because it is new working capital that he invests.  It generates other benefits, leaving the imprint of the strength of his work.

The Kiva loan is his second loan.  He will use it to change the “triciclo” (vehicle with three wheels) and the aluminum tanks.  Doing so will improve the condition of his infrastructure.  He will also buy supplies to make his product.

His main dream is to have his own house in order to increase his family’s well-being.  Therefore, he will work arduously because his family is his inspiration for doing so.  His business currently generates a profit margin of 22% and will carry a very low future debt ratio.  With his capacity for work and his entrepreneurial experience, this new investment will be successful because it will impact his income.

loans.use: He will change his tricycle and the aluminum tanks, which will improve the condition of his infrastructure for his new business.  He will also buy supplies for making his product

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, vive con su familia conformada por: Sus padres y dos hermanos de 17 y 19 años de edad, él es soltero.
El negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de algunos amigos, hace algunos años, no tiene un horario fijo de venta porque visita varios lugares y varia su hora de regreso a casa. Él está solicitando un crédito  para  mejorar la vivienda, ya que tiene que hacerle algunas reparaciones.
Las aspiraciones de Tomas es que en el corto plazo pueda tener ganancias del negocio para continuar mejorando poco a poco la vivienda, ya que quiere que sus padres estén en un lugar más cómodo y amplio.
texts.en:
