Tomas lives in Transito in the department of San Miguel. He is 39 years old and he sells homeopathic medicines. He lives with his family and is it made up of his parents and two brothers, 17 and 19 years of age. He is single. 

He started his business with the help of some friends a few years ago. He doesn't have a fixed work schedule because he travels to various locales and he comes back home at different hours of the day. He requests a loan to improve his house. It needs to have some repairs done. 

In the short term, Tomas aspires to earn an income from his business to progressively continue making improvements to their house. He wants to see his parents live in a place that is more comfortable and more spacious.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, 43, lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old while the youngest is only 4.

Estrella is a rice farmer and has been selling rice for quite some time now. Her husband is also a farmer. Estrella says they work hard to keep their farm productive. Estrella also requested for a loan of 6,000 PHP to fund their farm. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Ruth has a business of outside catering, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and baking flour for making chapattis for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and baking flour for making chapattis for resale.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, age 40, is a hard-working entrepreneur who owns and operates a fish vending business. She has been in this business for 11 years. She and her husband have three children, all in school. 

Analiza has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ruth Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth B. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con 4 ríos  que la bañan y con varios lugares turísticos, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 49 años, está separada y tiene 5 hijos  de 30, 27, 25, 24 y 14 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son casados e independientes, su hijo de 27 años trabaja y le ayuda  economícamente y su hijo de 14 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es propia.
 
La Señora. Ruth se dedica a la venta de quintales de arroz y azúcar, este negocio lo tiene en su casa hace un año

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de quintales de azúcar y arroz para su negocio.

Su meta es vender sus  productos al por mayor.
texts.en: Ruth B. is member of the communal bank El Ahorro ( The Savings), she lives by the Cebollar sector in the city of Cuenca; this city is a cultural heritage site.  It is replenished by 4 rivers and has various tourist locations.  Its people are very friendly and cordial.  Ruth is 49 years old, divorced, and has 5 children of ages: 30,27,25,24, and 14 years of age.  Three of her children are married and independent, her 27 year old son works and helps her financially, and her 14 year old studies at a school in the city.  The house she lives in is her own.  Ruth sells quintals of rice and sugar, a business she has been running out of her home for a year.  This is her first loan while in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of quintals of sugar and rice for the business.  Her goal is to sell her products in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase quintals of rice and sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been running a food restaurant in Ngalaiya Tala town for 11 years. She is 35 years old and married to Charles. They do not yet have children.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. This is her third loan, which she plans to use to buy cereals for cooking, flour and vegetables.

Her desire is to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, and vegetables

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del Banco comunal “Nueva La Greda” perteneciente a la localidad de Penco, ciudad de Concepción. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 25 años. Juana trabaja desde su casa, para lo cual utiliza el espacio de su comedor, como taller para atender a sus clientas en la prueba de ropa y toma de medidas. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en un horario de 7ºº a 22ºº horas. Sus clientes requieren sus servicios a pedido, especialmente para la temporada de colegio, temporada de Fiestas patrias, matrimonios y fiestas de graduación. Juana es quien se encarga de comprar la tela para posteriormente confeccionar, ya que tiene una vasta experiencia y conocimiento en la calidad de telas y comercios donde comprar. Junto con esto les brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes. Ella siempre está innovando en sus confecciones, de acuerdo a la moda de temporada.
El crédito lo utilizará para comprar telas, napas y cenefas para incursionar en el cortinaje, confección de cortinas.
Sus metas son ampliar su casa, para habilitar su taller de confección en un espacio de su casa que no interfiera con su vida cotidiana y familiar. Además anhela comprar otra máquina industrial para su taller de confección. 
Juana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 21 y 13 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia técnico en enfermería y arsenalería. Sus sueños a nivel personal son continuar trabajando en el mismo rubro de corte y confección, para costear los estudios superiores de sus hijas.
Juana está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que es una oportunidad para invertir en su negocio, lo cual le permitirá generar mayores ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones que se realizan junto al grupo del Banco comunal, estas son muy amenas y Juana ha aprendido a registrar sus gastos, el trato a sus clientes y la búsqueda de redes sociales.
Penco es una comuna cercana a la ciudad de Concepción, al sur de Chile, región del Biobío. Su nombre  viene del mapudungun y significa "agua de peumo". Es una de las comunas con mayor cantidad de habitantes en la región. Cuenta con centros industriales y un puerto.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Nueva La Greda", in the town of Penco in the city of Concepción.

She has been in the dress-making business for 25 years, and works out of her home in an area in the dining room set up to attend to customers for fittings and taking measurements.  Her works hours are Monday through Friday, from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She takes orders especially during the school season, and for patron saint festivities, marriage ceremonies and graduations.  Juana takes care of buying the fabric because of her vast experience and knowledge regarding fabric quality and places to shop.  She also gives easy payment terms and is constantly renewing her designs according to the latest fashions.

The loan will be used to buy fabric, leather and borders to begin making curtains.  Her goal is to expand her house and build a sewing shop somewhere inside it that does not interfere with everyday family life.  She also wants to buy an industrial sewing machine for her shop.

Juana lives with her husband and has two daughters, ages 21 and 13, and her eldest daughter is studying to be a nurse technician and surgeon's assistant.  Juana's goal is to keep working in the same field and be able to pay for her daughters' higher education.  She is pleased and grateful for the loan through Fondo Esperanza since it allows her to invest in her business and generate more income.  Regarding the meetings held at the communal bank, Juana finds them amenable and has been able to learn about keeping expense records, how to treat customers and use of social networks.

Penco is a community close to the cty of Concepción, in southern Chile, in the region of Biobío.  The name comes from the Mapudungun and means "peumo water".  It has one of the largest populations in the region, and industrial centers and a port.

loans.use: To buy fabric, leather and borders to make curtains.

loans.name: La Esperanza De Los Pobres Group

texts.es:
La señora Magday  tiene treinta y un años de edad ella es casad y a su responsabilidad están cuatro hijos y son: Weimar de doce años de edad, Abimael de diez años de edad, Yuriana de seis años de edad y el más pequeño es Marvin de cinco años de edad.

     Ella se dedica  desde hace  tres años a la compra y venta de artículos de la marca  avon, jafra y fuler y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más mercancías para  que así mejor sea su compra de cosas y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan y le encargan.

   Comenta que por su propia creatividad inicio con este tipo de trabajo para que ha sí apoye a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y con los ahorros que valla obteniendo  darle una vida mejor a sus hijos que están creciendo y no les haga falta lo más necesario.

    Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo que ha  solicitado pueda mejorar su calidad de compra y con el tiempo tener su propia actividad y así seguir apoyando a sus  hijos a que sigan estudiando.

    Las señoras  que integran el grupo son  la señora: Dilia, quien se dedica a la  compra  y venta de pollos aliñados (destazados), también se integra la señora Evangelina, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos.
texts.en:
Sra. Magday is 31 years old, married, and responsible for four children: Weimar (age 12), Abimael (age 10), Yuriana (age 6), and Marvin (age 5).

For the past three years, she has been buying and selling products from the Avon, Jafra, and Fuller brands. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. Magday says that it is better to buy products and keep them on hand so that customers can find what they need when placing their orders.

She indicates that she had to be creative when starting this type of business. Magday is able to support her husband with the household income and provide a better life for her children. As a result, they will be able to grow and not lack in the necessities.

Her greatest wish is that the loan she requested will help improve the quality of her purchases. Eventually she wants to have an established business and continue supporting her children with their studies.

The other women in the group are as follows: • Dilia buys and sells butchered chickens. • Evangelina buys and sells cheese.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics of various brands.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. Her husband is a vegetable seller. He operates his business in his community and offers fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. 

Rukhsana has given birth to six children. Her eldest daughter is illiterate while the other five are studying, attending a nearby school. Her elder daughter stays at home and helps Rukhsana manage the household work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables in bulk to offer to his customers for sale. He has been operating his business for the past four years and Rukhsana hopes that it will improve further after the loan investment.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Vianca es socia del banco comunal La Lupuna, del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
El tiempo que está en Manuela Ramos le ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio porque todo los préstamos que recibió los ha ido invirtiendo en la implementación de su bodega, que con mucha dedicación ha sabido mantener.
Su espso se dedica  al servicio de mecánica.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de ayudin, 3 tiras de enjuague para ropa, 1 caja de azul para ropa, 1 caja de leche Nestlé chico, 1caja de conservas, 1 bolsa de fideos, 2 cajas de galletas soda, 1 caja de galleta vainilla.
De esta manera su bodega estará más surtida y tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus vecinos que acuden diariamente a comprar. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los créditos otorgados a su persona.
texts.en:
Vianca is a member of the "La Lupuna" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 25 years old, married, and has one child.

During the time she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Vianca has managed to grow her business.  She has invested all of her loans in stocking her grocery store and has managed to keep it running with a great deal of commitment on her part.

Vianca's husband is a mechanic.

With this new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles, Vianca will buy one case of Ayudin (a brand of household cleaning products), three lots of laundry wash, one box of Azul-brand laundry wash, one box of Nestle milk, one lot of canned food, one bag of noodles, two boxes of soda crackers and one box of vanilla cookies.  This will enable her to have a better stocked store and more products to sell to her neighbors who come to her store every day to buy from her.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans they have given her.

loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 29 year-old single mother of 3 children between 4 months and 8 years old.  She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda.  For four years she has been in the bar business.  She started with 1,800,000 shillings and she currently has working capital of four million shillings.  Sylvia faces the challenge of price fluctuations and stiff competition.  Nonetheless, she dreams of setting up a hotel. Sylvia needs the loan to buy beer to sell in her bar.

loans.use: To buy beer for the bar

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom raises chickens for sale.  Her husband is a goldsmith and their income is $6 per day.  She has four children, one is studying in school and other three are working and earning $2.50 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on school fee, and $30 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy equipment for decorating gold.  Right now, her husband also teaches others to be goldsmiths so her husband needs more equipment to do it.  In the future, she wants to send the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy equipment for decorating gold

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge , es habitante del municipio de Masaya , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y comprar una casita para dejársela a sus hijos y que no anden rodando de casa en casa , don Jorge desde hace varios años se dedica a la reparación de parlantes , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un recurso disponible (capital ) para poder expedirse  mas el negocio ya que en ocasiones  sus clientes le piden que si puede mejorar la apariencia del cajón de los parlante , retocando un poco la pintura  ; lo cual por problemas de materia  prima y herramienta dice que no . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva , para seguir creciendo en su negocio .
texts.en:
Jorge lives in Masaya with his family.  His future plan is to improve living conditions and to buy a small house to leave to his children so that they won’t be going from house to house.  

Jorge has been repairing speakers for several years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having  a disposable resource (capital) to expand more in the business since on occasion customers ask him to improve the appearance of the speaker box, retouching the paint a bit, but because of the lack of raw materials and tools he has to say no.  He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through Kiva funds to continue growing in business

loans.use: to buy parts for speaker repair.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 35, lives with her husband and three young children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. All of her children are school-age. 

Currently, she is a vermicelli seller in a market far away from her community. From this business, she earns about $3 per day. To augment her income, her husband is a carpenter who is able to make around $4 each day. 

They spend a lot of money for taxis, and therefore, she and her husband wish to borrow some funds in order to purchase a motorbike. She hopes that this will bring her family more profits and more happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past seven years, Martin has operated a motorcycle business. The borrowers photo was taken at the town center in front of a car. He operates both from home and at the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season. He dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Martin plans to purchase spare parts, oil, and lubricants to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, oil, and lubricants to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Evelyn has a shop that sells beverages like soft drinks & light liquors. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks & beverages to sell.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old and married, with 2 children.  Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice and food vending.  Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 36 years old and married with 2 children ages 12 years and 15 years. He runs a pharmacy and cosmetics store in Lumley in the western area of Freetown. Both children are currently attending school. 

Musa has been in this business for 8 years and sells medicines and cosmetic like cream, Vaseline, pads, blood syrup (tonic), cola syrup and malaria drugs at his store. He also earns income from another business, a taxi transportation business. He says that the main challenges to his business are competition among sellers and price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more medicines and cosmetic items.  Musa says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living for his family. In the future, he would like to be importing drugs and cosmetics from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines and cosmetic items such as cream and blood syrup

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal products.

Zenaida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando, Tiene 51 años de edad, es originario de La Esperanza, Intibucá donde ha vivido desde su niñez. 
Tiene casa propia por lo que demuestra buena estabilidad domiciliaria, es casado y padre de tres hijos (dos mujeres y un varón) los tres ya no dependen económicamente de él,  pero tiene dos nietos que viven en su casa ya que su hija reside en fuera del país. 
Su negocio consiste en el transporte urbano de personas, él posee más de 30 años de experiencia, es una persona reconocida en la comunidad por tener buenos principios morales, en ODEF ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago en los préstamos anteriores.
En esta fecha solicita un crédito para reparación de la unidad de transporte ya que por el mal estado de la calles se le arruino, la cantidad que necesita es de  22,000 Lempiras.
Su sueño es comprar una unidad de transporte nueva para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Armando, 51, is from La Esperanza, Intibucá where he’s lived since childhood.  He owns his house which indicates housing stability.  He’s married and the father of three children (two girls and one boy); all three no longer depend on him economically but he has two grandchildren that live in his house since his daughter lives abroad.

His business consists in urban passenger transport.  He has more than 30 years’ experience.  He is a person known in his community for having good moral principles.  In ODEF he has shown good payment behavior with previous loans.

On this date he’s asking for a loan to repair his bus because the poor state of the roads has damaged it.  The amount he needs is 22,000 Lempiras.  His dream is to buy a new bus to provide better passenger service and earn higher income.

loans.use: to repair his bus.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: El señor Fortunato nació en  la localidad Florida provincia Cordillera, es agricultor,  casado con La Sra.  Sabina tienen  4 hijos hace 20 años que vive en la localidad de Florida el se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el señor cuenta con una parcela de 48 hectáreas dotación de la reforma agraria, pero actualmente sus tierras están saneadas, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y también para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra,  el solo mantiene el hogar, ya que su esposa es ama de casa  es un cliente antiguo, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con la institución  por el apoyo que se le ha dado para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fortunato was born in the town of Florida, in Cordillera province. He is a farmer. He is married to Sabina and they have 4 children. For the past 20 years he has been living in the town of Florida and working in agriculture and ranching. He has a 48-hectare parcel of land which was granted to him under the agrarian reform. Currently, his lands have been cleared. He will use the funds from the loan to buy seeds to plant corn, and also to carry out the necessary work to prepare the soil. He is the sole support of his household, since his wife is a housewife. He is a longstanding client, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support given to him so he can continue improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is married with two children. Adelyn is 36 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Adelyn owns a general store and sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for six years.  Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and candies.

Adelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Adelyn hopes to save money for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and candies to sell.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 43 years old, married and has one child.  His mother-in-law also lives with the family. He is a farmer from the village Akhasheni, Kakheti Region. Archil is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is their main source of income. They have a milk cow and sell milk on the market. They also sell grapes, harvested on family-owned one-half hectare of land. Archil grows maize on family-owned one-quarter hectare of land. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the monthly pension of Archil’s mother in law. 

Archil's wife is pregnant and is expecting their second baby in December. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to cover the expenses of the maternity hospital. Archil and his wife hope that the childbirth process will be safe and both mother and the newborn will be in good health.

loans.use: to pay for the maternity hospital.

loans.name: Azucena Altagracia

texts.es: Doña Azucena tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo en la aldea Corinto y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo de 6am a 8pm, utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, embutidos y granos basicos, desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de navidad. Su meta es tener una buena pulperia en donde venda de todo.
texts.en: Azucena is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Corinto.  She works selling products for daily consumption.  She has a small grocery store in a room of her house.  Her business is open Monday through Sunday from 6am until 8pm.  She will use her loan to buy various grocery items, milk, sausages and basic grains.  She hopes to supply her business for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to have a good general store that sells a bit of everything.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items, milk, sausages and basic grains.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 41 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in the Ornlong Veng district.  Chan comes from a low-income family and operates a retail business. She sells Khmer cakes in a busy market. She has run this business for many years  and earns $4.00 a day. Her husband generates a small profit by working as a soldier at Preah Vihear province.  

Recently, Chan's living conditions have not been comfortable because a part of her house is broken down and old so it is harmful for her family to live in it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is Florence, a 54-year-old woman who is full of smiles.

She is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her seven children. She is very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Ndalu, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area suffers from lack of employment and money but Florence has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 15 years. 

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Florence is contented with the farming way of life. 

Florence is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family a decent meal. The Ndalu, Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being an older woman and accessing capital in Kitale is very challenging, but Florence feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Florence is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.. 

As the December season is kicks off, Florence wants to close the year on a high note. Please help Florence so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her seven children

loans.name: Sarvan Tiflis Oglu

texts.en:
Sarvan is 35-year old IDP and father of three children. The family income is rather limited. Since 2000 he has been engaged in rendering consulting and training services. He makes up business plans and finds his work very interesting.

Now he needs better office facilities and computer equipment and therefore applies for the loan of 1000$. His previous credit history includes three loans borrowed from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005 and amounted at 600$, 800$, 1000$. The loans paid back timely.

He believes in the success of his business and his ability to pay the whole loan amount back.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment

loans.name: Arieta

texts.en:
Alieta’s business specializes in weaving handbags. These handbags are made of a Samoan leaf called “laufala”. These handbags have different designs that she has made. For some of her bags, she uses tapa cloth to cover the outside of the bag before she wraps it up with plastic to make sure it doesn’t get wet when it rains.

Alieta works six days a week. She uses Saturday to deliver her bags to the market. Alieta lives in her small Samoan house and she looks forward to building a small Samoan house from her income.

loans.use: To purchase plastic, paper, paint, needles and thread.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 48 years old and married with three children. Like many Paraguayans, he emigrated to Argentina when he was young and it is there that he learned his craft. His whole family helps him with his work. They have all learned the craft, and while his children are still in school they feel that what they've already learned will serve them to earn a living.

Victor not only makes and sells his product, but he also teaches leatherwork to young people in his neighborhood, charging them $3 an hour. He plans to use this loan to make more of his most popular product--a leather wristband scented with citronella used to repel mosquitoes. These are popular because the country is plagued by an epidemic of Dengue fever. He needs to increase his income because not only are his three children still in school but his 48-year-old wife has recently begun to finish her secondary education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Victor tiene 48 años y es casado con 3 hijos. Como tantos paraguayos, emigro en su juventud a la Argentina donde aprendió el oficio. En la fabricación de sus productos trabaja con sus tres hijos y su esposa. Todos han aprendido el oficio y aunque continúan estudiando, consideran que lo aprendido ya les sirve para ganarse la vida. Victor no solo fabrica y vende sus productos, sino que además capacita a los jóvenes del mercado municipal que están interesados en aprender el oficio, cobrando por sus servicios US$ 3 la hora. Planea utilizar el crédito para comprar materia prima para aumentar la producción de su mas exitoso producto: la pulsera repelente de mosquitos, fabricada a base de citronella. Este producto tiene una alta demanda debido a la epidemia de dengue que afecta el país. Necesita generar más ingreso, ya que no solo sus tres hijos continúan su educación, sino que su esposa de 48 años ha reanudado sus estudios secundarios.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of leather and 20 liters of citronella.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina M. D. P., 47, is married and the mother of four children, aged 23, 20, 15, and 10. Delfina runs a small grocery store next to a very busy road. When her children are not in school, they also help her at the store.

Delfina started her business two years ago. Before starting her grocery store, she had a business where she sold meat. But due to high rental and transport costs, Delfina decided to open a grocery store located closer to her house. She works everyday from 6 am until 8 pm, closing later in the summer. Delfina is requesting a $200 loan to restock her inventory, particularly the items in highest demand: wine, milk, and bread.

In addition to her grocery store, Delfina also lends out money. She lends small amounts without charging interest, and only to people she knows very well. She lends to about 7 people per month.

Delfina is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase wine, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad is 29 years old, married and has one child.  He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has his own orchard where he has grown grape vines since 2001. Now he plans to buy vine-props and requests a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To buy vine-props for his vineyard

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.en:
It’s impossible to hide the 15 years of wisdom Nelly has gained from running her own beauty salon. She gently speaks with passion about her clients (who are also her friends), services she provides, and the possibility of expanding her business. Nelly found her village bank through her friends and is very excited about receiving her first loan. With this loan of $100 she hopes to expand her product base to offer more variety to satisfy all of her customers’ needs.

Nelly's long-term goal is to go back to school to specialize in a particular area of cosmetology so she can offer specialized services. When expressing her long-term goal of more schooling, Nelly says this is because “without learning, you can't progress”. She and her husband are also hard at work raising their three children, ages 10, 5, and 3.

loans.use: expand her product base to offer more variety

loans.name: Hilaria Martínez

texts.en:
Hilaria is a many-sided businesswoman. She owns Uniflores, a small store where she sells artificial and decorative flowers. She also dedicates herself to the sale of Avon beauty products. She is thirty-three years old, and she and her husband have four daughters who range in age from 7 to 15 years old. They all attend school.

Every day, people from her neighborhood visit Hilaria’s store to purchase her beautiful flowers. In the afternoon, she visits some women to promote and sell the Avon products. Currently, she makes a weekly profit of about US$ 150.

Hilaria hopes her business can grow so that she can greatly increase her income. With the loan requested (her second one from FSMA), she plans to buy more beauty products to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is also thinking about starting to sell women’s shoes via catalog. She told us that doing business is the only way one can get to be financially independent. She would also like to be able to continue her nursing studies at the university.

loans.use: purchase artificial flowers to supply her business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is a trader who sells canned foods, washing and toilet soaps. She is married to an electrical engineer but his monthly income is enough to meet the family’s expenses. Kate is supporting financially with the family needs. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to purchase more stock into her shop.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more stock into her shop.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia O., age 38, is widowed with 2 children (12 and 7 years old). Rukia owns a vegetable stand, which she started 1 year ago. Working from 7am-9pm daily, she earns about $55 a month from this business.

Rukia hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Rukia belongs to the loan group called Kichangani B and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Miza Abdallah, Mariam Rajab, and Mariam Abdallah. These women have businesses dealing in food vending and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy vegetable inventory for her stand

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba Ergashevna N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has secondary education. She is in the retail business and has own vendor space at the local market where she sells polyethylene. She brings in the products from Dushanbe (capital of Tajikistan) where she buys it from wholesalers at a lower price and then resells it for a more profitable price. This business is the main source of income for her family and it's important for Mahbuba to develop and expand it. Her merchandise is in high demand among the local residents. Polyethylene is used in farming and agriculture, such as in greenhouses, and that's why the development of the retail sector for this products allows to supply the markets with it. Mahbuba has been in this business for the past three years. She plans to use the loan to increase her commodity turnover and plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нишонова Махбуба Эргашевна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 30 лет, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли.Имеет торговую точку на рынке.Продает полиэтилен. Товар привозит из города Душанбе покупая у оптовых реализаторов по более низкой цене и перепродает у себя на рынке по более выгодной цене. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи, поэтому необходимо развивать ей свой бизнес.Кроме того продаваемый ею товар пользуется спросом у населения. Используют полиэтилен в сельском хозяйстве, для парников, поэтому развитие торговли данного вида продукции дает возможность обеспечить им (полиэтилен)рынки.. Занимается этим видом бизнеса 3 года. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 16,13 and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 22, 8 and 10 years old. Maria owns a small auto spare parts shop, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Maria has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mary's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20, 14, 10 and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 60 years old. Mary sells clothes; she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 10.30 a.m. to 4.30 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (vitenge) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Ester, Naishie and Theresia, who have businesses dealing in vegetables sales, clothes sales and hairdressing.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge, a cultural favorite) for her business

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde O. is 39 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She lives at Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and jewelery in her shop located in the Okoko area of Lagos State, Nigeria.   She started this business in 1986 after learning it for 4 years from her aunty. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years and she now needs a loan of $850 to buy more inventory. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and jewellery for sales

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es Lic. En Matematicas, trabaja en la UNAN-CUR Chontales en el area de Fisica-Matematicas, tiene 35 años de edad, soltera, no tiene hijos, con 10 años de laborar para el sector educativo. Los créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para ayudar a su mamá y hermanas, este crédito lo solicita para poner el techo a la cocina de la casa de su mamá, ya que cuando no se encuentra el gas tienen que cocinar con leña y el espacio que están utilizando no tiene techo y con las lluvias se le hace dificil cocinar. La profesora durante sus 7 creditos anteriores ha tenido un excelente comportamiento crediticio y mucha responsabilidad con los compromisos adquiridos. Es una joven muy querida por sus alumnos y compañeros de trabajo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Marlene studied Math in College and works at the University located in Chontales in the Physics and Math department; she is 35 years old, single without children and has 10 years of experience in the education sector. Her previous loans have been used to help her mother and sisters; with this particular loan she is planning to use it to pay for putting a roof on her mother’s kitchen. The current kitchen has no roof and she often cooks there when she is using firewood; however, this is often very difficult since it is open to the air and subject to rains. Marlene has had 7 previous loans and has had extremely good credit in the past showing responsibility and dedication to repayment. She is a young woman who is loved by her students and colleagues.

loans.use: Put a roof on the kitchen

loans.name: Diariétou Raby

texts.fr:
Diariétou Raby Sané is 43 years old, married with 5 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Tenghory Transgambienne for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy and re-sell vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and carrots. With her income, she contributes to paying her family's expenses. She would like to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Diariétou Raby Sané, 43 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 4 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des légumes comme des oignons, des tomates et des carottes. Avec ses revenus elle participe aux charges familiales. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell vegetables

loans.name: Kijakazi's Tusivunjane Moyo Group

texts.en:
Kijakazi is 29 years old and married with 3 children, aged 13, 11 and 8. She has been a tailor since 2006. Every day, she works from 8AM to 9pPM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Kijakazi now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Khadija and Salma.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Simara

texts.en: Simara is married and has 2 children, one of whom is pictured in the photograph. She lives in a town called Khachmaz and is involved in the farming business which she started 8 years ago. At present, Simara needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy seeds for her farm.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for a farming business

loans.name: Douch

texts.en: Mrs. Douch N. lives in the village of Brasoung in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Hem Mean, is a Prohok seller. Even though they have two different businesses they still do not make much money to improve their living conditions. Therefore Mrs. Douch N. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to add to her business. She is 29 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other two children are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to her business.

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.en:
A. Mirsharif is 27 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Mirsharif has a specialized education.  His specialization is engineering.  However, he went into agro-business because the salary from engineering was small, and with a small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. 

Mirsharif works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables.  He works from early morning till late night hoping to have a rich harvest.  Mirsharif sells them in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality.  His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. 

His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business.  Today, Mirsharif is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni for the term of 12 months to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer, be better able to meet the demands of his customers who wait for him every Saturday at the market.  Let's help Mirsharif as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Cao Thị Thêm năm nay 51 tuổi,  Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương  gia đình chị đã có thêm một cửa hàng  kinh doanh hàng ăn. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang ngày càng phát triển và cho thu nhập ổn định. Ngoài ra  hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên  kinh tế rất ổn định với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Thêm mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để tếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cao Thị Thêm is 51 years old and has three grown children. She became a member of the TYM Fund in 1998 in order to invest in raising pigs. In the ten years since then, she and her family used the fund to start a restaurant. This family business continues to develop and provide T. with a steady income. In addition, her husband’s wages contribute to the family earnings, so that they now have a very stable income of about 5,000,000 VND (294 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Thêm hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1175 USD) to invest in further improvements in her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells loaves of bread by hawking them in her community. The demand for her bread is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 26 años, tiene una casa propia, donde vive con su esposo y su hija Leydi de tan solo 5 añitos, quiere mejorar su futuro y el de su familia y para eso trabaja arduamente. De manera ambulatoria, Graciela sale todos los días a vender las chuspitas artesanales que teje, las vende en el distrito de Ilave a una hora de la ciudad de Puno, lleva ya 10 años en este negocio, el cual le a traído muchas satisfacciones, ella es una tejedora nata, disfruta mucho de su trabajo, prácticamente teje a cada hora del día, pero le resulta muy difícil trasladar toda su mercadería, desde Puno a Ilave y es justamente este sacrificio lo que hace que venda más, ya que no tiene mucha competencia, Graciela está dispuesta a trabajar mucho, con el fin de darle a su querida hija unos buenos estudios y no hacerle faltar nada, ya que ella sabe lo que es no tener las comodidades necesarias. Este primer préstamo le ayudará mucho a Graciela, para mejorar su negocio y es conciente de que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas, para no perjudicar a su banco comunal. Graciela desea comprar más lana, para hacer sus artesanías, esto le costará alrededor de 300 nuevos soles, con el resto del dinero planea comprar artesanías a otras tejedoras para venderlas en Ilave.
texts.en:
Graciela, 26, owns her own house. She lives there with her husband and her daughter, Leydi, 5. She wants a better future for herself and her family and she's working hard to get it. Graciela works as a street vendor, going out every day to sell home-made "chuspitas" (a knitted or woven bag or purse). She sells them in the "distrito" of Ilave, an hour from the city of Puno. She's operated the business for 10 years and it's given her a lot of satisfaction. She knits like she was born to do it and she enjoys her work. She practically spends every hour of the day knitting, so much that it's become difficult for her to carry all her merchandise from Puno to Ilave. She makes the sacrifice, though, because there's not much competition there and she can sell more. Graciela is happy to work hard because it will allow her to give her darling daughter a good education. Graciela knows what it's like to not have everyday necessities and she wants to make sure her daughter has the things she needs. This first loan will help Graciela improve her business and she's well aware that she has to pay all her installments in order not to prejudice her community bank. Graciela wants to buy more wool to make her crafts. That will cost around 300 new soles. With the rest of the money, she plans to buy crafts from other artisans so that can sell them in Ilave.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool to make crafts for sale.

loans.name: Obiaderi

texts.en: Obiaderi sells beef. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier, de 54 años es padre de 4 hijos, vive junto a su esposa quien le da la mano en todo lo posible. La casa que habitan es propia, y es el resultado de su trabajo. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender comida por las noches en la fachada de su casa, Javier elabora toda clase de platillos, según nota la demanda de sus clientes y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. Para su negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos y eso le alegra mucho, le agrada su trabajo porque se siente bien y es una forma de relajarse porque durante el día trabaja en una institución pública desde hace 20 años, y todos los días regresa muy cansado, pero la venta de comida lo anima, ya que sus comensales lo entretienen con sus conversaciones y carisma particular. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal debido a que fue una oportunidad de salir adelante y continúa integrado porque todos son muy unidos y coordinados. El dinero que está solicitando en esta oportunidad lo invertirá en su negocio comprando víveres e ingredientes para preparar sus comidas, además de sillas, mesas, y otros utensilios necesarios.
texts.en:
Señor Javier is 54 and the father of 4 children. He lives with his wife who helps him in every way possible. The house they live in is their own, as a result of his hard work. For 4 years, he has sold food at night in front of his home. Javier makes all kinds of dishes, according to the demand of his customers. This business has gone very well for him. He has the support of his wife and children, and this makes him very happy. He likes his job because he feels good doing it, and it's a way to relax because during the day he works at a public institution, which he has done for 20 years. Every day he returns home very tired, but selling food livens him up since his dinner companions entertain him with their conversations and individual charisma. This is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he likes to work with his communal bank because it was an opportunity to get ahead. He continues as a member because they are all very united and coordinated. The money he is requesting will be invested in his business. He will buy supplies to prepare his food as well as tables, chairs, and other necessary utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make his food

loans.name: Kuko

texts.en: Kuko A. is a door fabricator and he makes burglary proof doors as well as iron water tanks. He is 46 years old and married with 4 children. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nairas to purchase fabricating materials like panels, rods and electrodes, etc. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fabricating materials for doors

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод приехал в город Исфару несколько лет назад и стал учеником в одной из многочисленных лепешечных которые выпекают традиционный вид таджикского хлеба – лепешки. Дилщод до приезда имел некоторый опыт в этой деятельности, но постепенно работая по найму усовершенствовал свое мастерство и открыл свою собственную лепешечную. Теперь у него свои работники и кроме этого ему помогает его мать. Его младший брат уже кредитуется в МикроИнвест и, видя его успехи, Дилшод тоже решил подать заявку на займ и собирается прикупить муку и уголь для своей лепешечной.
texts.en:
Dilshod moved to the town of Isfar several years ago and became an apprentice in one of the many bakeries where Tajik traditional bread, lepeshka, is made. Prior to his arrival, Dilshod had some experience in this profession, skills which he honed while drawing a wage from others. He then opened his own bakery. Now he has employees of his own and his mother also helps out. Dilshod's younger brother is already a client of MicroInvest. Seeing his successes, Dilshod also decided to apply for a loan, and he plans to purchase flour and charcoal for his bakery.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and charcoal

loans.name: Berta Maria

texts.pt:
Berta Maria D. é natural de Maputo, tem 53 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos onde o mais velho tem 35 anos e o mais novo 24 anos de idade respectivamente, todos já não estudam e os três primeiros estão a viver nas suas casas.

Berta estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras na família, a 5 anos que o marido foi na terra do rand e nunca voltou, a três anos decide iniciar negocio que consiste na compra e venda de capulanas, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt.

Berta solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez, com qual pretende aumentar o seu volumen de negocio, futuramente Berta pretende comprar outro talhão afim de construir casas para aluguer de quartos e conta com ajuda do credito.
texts.en:
Berta Maria D. is a native of Maptuo. She is 53 years old, divorced and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 24. All are past school and the first three are living in their own homes.

Berta studied through 6th grade and stopped due to her family's financial circumstances. Five years ago her husband went to the Rand region and never returned. Three years ago she decided to start a business which consisted of buying and selling capulanas [Note: fabric used as a sarong]. She has a monthly revenue of 12,000 meticais in this business.

Berta is requesting a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, with which she plans to increase her business volume. In the future, Berta plans to purchase another piece of land in order to build houses to rent out rooms with the help of a loan.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell capulanas

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia Pérez tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. Rosa Emilia se dedica a la compra-venta de cosméticos y ropa en general, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Hasta la fecha doña Rosa Emilia ha estado trabajando con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 y nuevamente hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: trajes para niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos, además comprar tallas grandes y extra grandes ya que estas  cuestan encontrarlas y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas, también artículos cosméticos como: delineadores, pinturas labiales y de uñas, polvo, brillos, tintes, cremas, perfumería entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia Pérez is 36 years old, and has 3 children who all work independently. Rosa Emilia works as a cosmetic saleswoman and clothing saleswoman. Since she began, Rosa has established a fixed customer base, which has provided her with enough income to cover her household expenses. She is a single mother. To this day, Rosa has been working with financing from Fundación León 2000. She is now asking for a new loan to purchase certain items, such as: outfits for boys, teenagers, and adults, and to purchase large sizes for her clients. Rosa wants to expand her business, and also purchase cosmetic products such as: eye liner, lipstick, nail polish, creams, perfumes, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana or “Fely” as she is also called in their village is a high school graduate, happily married to Florencio. They live in the rural community of Buliwao in Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. They strive to send their three children to school up through college so that they will find a good job someday.

Despite the hardships of life, Feliciana and husband are helping one another to earn a living.  They cultivate their farm lot twice a year, planting rice and vegetables, and sometimes her husband uses their tricycle as a transport business for extra income.  

Fely, on the other hand, manages a rice vending business at home. Her desire to develop her business and progress has motivated her to seek the financial support of Kiva lenders to lend her the amount of PHP 12,000 as additional business capital. She believes that someday she will make her business grow, with her patience and the assistance of lenders.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita L. is a 56-year-old woman, married to Rodolfo L., with two children. Her eldest child is still studying in college and her youngest is a computer programming undergraduate who works as a computer programmer and a sales boy in a private computer shop in town. Her husband has been her partner for life in the business. Rodolfo is the one that managed the business and Rita manages their finances.

Rita joined ASHI in 1999 because she wished to have her own business. Through ASHI she was able to acquire capital to start up a business which she and her husband chose. Rita’s husband is skilled and well experienced in repairing and vulcanizing vehicle tires, therefore Rita thought that doing this kind of business would not require any more training. As years went on, Rita’s loan in ASHI grew from Php5,000 to Php30,000 in her most recent loan. She expanded her business as well, however, it is not as big as she expects and is not earning as much as she imagined due to frequent electric power interruptions. There were times when the interruption lasted for several weeks, especially when there is a typhoon.

Rita knew that only if they have their own electric generator, can their business continue its operation even if the whole town suffers from electric power interruption. Hence, Rita applied for a loan from ASHI. After using the generator and seeing improvements in her business income generation, Rita will borrow a bigger amount to improve their vulcanizing shop and purchase more necessary machines for the business. Rita also wants to have more supplies of vehicle tires to sell to her customers.

Aside from Rita’s business managed by her husband, she is also into a buy and sell business. This is how she makes her weekly payments for her loan from ASHI. Rita is so much happy to have her own business to run and a business that her family is having. She hopes that her vulcanizing shop will grow further and will be successful for this has been her family’s cup of tea and bread for long time.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and vehicle tires for selling.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna H., 45, is a new member of PMPC. She is married with 4 school-aged children and lives in San Isidro Bajo. She owns and operates her own business in the food sector. She earns ~PHP 1,500 from making and selling snacks and delicacies in the community. She has happily enjoyed doing the business for 10 years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients to make food products for sale. She hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Dora Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de septiembre”, en el centro poblado de M. del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria incompleta (2do grado).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir víveres para la preparación de comida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra venta de ganado mayor, tales como vacas y 1 toro,  Dora acude a las comunidades cercanas donde compra se ganado, luego los vende en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es comprar ganado mayor para mejorarlos y venderlos a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the 22 de septiembre Community Bank in the centre of M. in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought supplies for food preparation. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy large livestock like cows and a bull. Dora goes to nearby communities to buy the livestock. She later sells them in the regional fairs. Her wish is to buy large livestock to fatten and sell to the wholesalers. She likes the meetings and savings (of her community bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows and a bull

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe A. is 33 years old, and was born in Yerevan. He has graduated from the State Engineering University of Armenia, Machine Building Economy Department. After graduation he worked in a hothouse as an economist. Vahe is married and his wife is a manager in a travel agency.

Six years ago he began his business, which consists of adornment production of precious metals. He rents a place in a jewelry trade market. Vahe needs $3,000 to fulfill an order for one of his clients, a set of jewelry which contains a ring, earrings and a bangle.

loans.use: Making a set of jewelry, which contains a ring, earrings and a bangle.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Tsetsegee D. is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband and two children in a ger (or Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Chinzorig, is unemployed and babysits their children at home. He owns a car that he sometimes uses to transport people from one place to another. Their two children attend school. Because neither child is in college yet, living expenses are much lower than people whose children go to college or university. 

Tsetsegee makes a living working as a tailor. She worked in a factory until 2003, then started her own business sewing and stitching people's clothes. Her monthly earnings are between 300,000-400,000 tugrugs ($210-290). She sews all kinds of European clothes and all forms of traditional Mongolian dress. Her dream is to finish building her house, which she is working on right now. To make this happen, she works hard to earn money. She has applied for a loan of $650 that she will use to expand her business and finish building her house.

loans.use: To expand her business and finish building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de chaussure

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una madre de 29 años, tiene dos hijos con los que viven en su casa propia. Desde que formó su familia empezó con sus labores agrícolas, desde ese día, laboriosamente apoya a su esposo en la siembra de papas, lechugas y maíz en chacras alquiladas. De todos sus productos el más rentable es la papa, porque las vende como semillas y para consumo, a la acopiadora de su pueblo, evitándose así los ajetreos del transporte de su carga.

En el caso del maíz, como no siempre tiene un buen precio, cuando está bajo los hace secar en mazorcas y así lo vende, sin perder su inversión.
A Marcelina le gusta la actividad que realiza, pero lo que le falta es el capital suficiente para realizar sus siembras como ella desearía.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas para seguir contando con posteriores créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
. Marcelina is a 29-year-old mother of two children; they live in their own home. Since she formed her family she initiated her farming activities. Since that day, she supports her husband with hard work in the farming of potatoes, lettuces and corn on rented farm land. Of all their products, the most profitable is the potatoes because they can be sold both as seed and as a consumable to the local town's crop gathering center thereby avoiding the hassle of having to transport their loads. In the corn's case, since it doesn't always command a good price, when the price is low she lets it dry on the cob and sells it that way, thereby not losing her investment. Marcelina enjoys her work but lacks the capital to have plantings like she would prefer. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time so that she can count on future loans. The funds she is requesting now sill be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina, a client of Asociación Arariwa, is part of a communal bank called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta, consisting of 19 members. A resident of Anta, she is 52 years old and married, with eight children and two grandchildren. Alejandrina works selling eggs and other food at the Sunday market in the main plaza. With this loan, she will pay the monthly school expenses for her son, who is studying to be a machine operator.

Alejandrina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s monthly school expenses

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary K. is a villager in Sam Chort village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice.

In this plantation, Mrs. Nary K. faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump, fertilizers, and pesticides to support the rice field.

Mrs. Nary K. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a bread shop while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Rang Chhaom, is a technician and he is also a pig breeder. He is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump, fertilizers, and pesticides to support her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cow so that she can butcher  and sell its meat retail

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty-six years old. She is divorced but a mother of three children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Grace works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader in beef. She buys the beef from nearby towns and sells on a table top at the market square in her community. She also supplies to food vendors in her community. Grace has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk so she can supply to more customers to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy beef.

loans.name: Ndeye Soce

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Soce S. est une femme de 46 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée, mère d’un enfant  âgé de 14 ans, ayant a sa charge 5 autres personnes. Elle est membre  de  la  caisse de l’U-IMCEC  Yoff depuis février  2004 et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur Madame S. évolue dans le commerce de glace et de petit déjeuner depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle dispose d’un étale  situe en face et a quelques mètres de la caisse de Yoff. Elle a choisi cette activité car elle a toujours voulu vivre hors de la dépendance des autres. Ainsi avec ses bénéfices elle sera capable de résoudre ses propres besoins personnels. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est le contact avec la clientèle avec qui elle sympathise, mais aussi la recherche du profit. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs et cherche à renforcer son fond de roulement pour l’achat de quelques produits destines au petit déjeuner qu’elle vend. Elle envisage aussi d’aménager son étale en achetant quelques bancs et tables locaux  pour permettre a sa clientèle de bien s’installer. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs et l’augmentation de ses revenus lui permettra d’assurer une petite assistance financière sur les dépenses quotidiennes à son mari.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Soce S. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the Ngaparou section of the Yoff area (Dakar). She is married, the mother of a 14-year-old, who also supports five other people. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since February 2004 and has already received a loan. Mrs. S. has been developing an ice cream and breakfast business for ten years. She has a stall facing the Yoff bank. She chose this business because she has always wanted to live without depending on others. Thus with her profits she would be able to take care of her own personal needs. What interests her most about this business is interacting with her customers whom she enjoys, but also making a profit. She is seeking a loan of 50,000frs and looking to build up her working operating in order to buy several products for the breakfasts she sells. She also plans to equip her stall by purchasing several local benches and tables which would allow her customers to sit comfortably. Thus she is asking for a loan of 50,000frs, and the increased income would give her a bit of help with the daily expenses of her husband. Continuing with its focus on active participation in the fight against poverty, with the positive backing of lenders the U-IMCEC succeeds in supporting populations in operating profitable, income-generating businesses, which promotes valued socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en: Adolfo B. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 43 years old. Adolfo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adolfo provides motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Adolfo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Adolfo joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Adolfo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Adolfo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun V., 39, sells fried bananas in the local market in her Takeo province. She is married with four children, who are still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about US$ 4 each day and would like a loan to expand her husband's business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ 500 which her husband needs to purchase more construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 34-year-old lady who runs a salon and a kinyozi (barber shop). She employs two people and serves residents of Mwala in Machakos.  She has been in the business for over five years and also earns a living from her transport business.  She is the mother of two children and married to a teacher.  Mary has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy materials for her salon.  Her dream is to buy a piece of land in the future.  She sees herself owning a high class salon in 10 years.

loans.use: To buy salon materials

loans.name: Lucy Yeni

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Lucy es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Lucy tiene un restaurante llamado Chiquito, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de un personal. Además lucy tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar.
Los sueños de Lucy es construir su casa y que su ultima hija culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is married, 54 years old, and has 3 children. Lucy has a restaurant called "Chiquito" in a rented location. She works in the restaurant every day along with an employee. In addition, Lucy has a grocery store. Lucy needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Lucy dreams of building her own home and having her youngest daughter complete her education.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Kamu Kamu B Nasade Specioza Group

texts.en: N. Specioza is thirty-four years old, married with two children schooling and two other dependents of whom one is schooling, too. She is dealing with clothes and sells soft drinks since she has a fridge in her shop; she has run her business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase clothes and drinks (sodas, passion fruit, etc) for sale. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and drinks (sodas, passion fruits, etc) for sale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
To supply additional income, Ofelia D. M. wants to expand the family retail business with working capital from Kiva through ASHI. Ofelia requests a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase inventory of assorted goods for her store. She believes that having additional stocks will increase revenue and profits for the family’s retail business.

Since 2007, Ofelia has achieved strong performance with regular attendance to group meetings and steady repayments. She is thankful for secure access to capital and loans to support her goals in life. Ofelia is seen old at her age but also strong and a woman of courage to battle challenges in order to achieve her goals. She is a caring mother to 5 adult children. Ofelia enjoys considering that the loan from ASHI and KIVA partner will change their lives and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of assorted goods for her store.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie J. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Lanie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail sho selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
