Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Meet Rukia J. and the Singida Group.  Rukia is 44 years old, married and has three children ages 10, 15 and 22 years old.  All of her children go to school.

For 16 years, Rukia has been running a clothing business.  She started out selling used clothes, but has grown her business and now she sells madila, which are long embroidered robes often worn by Muslim women in Tanzania.  Rukia works from 9 am until 6 pm each day and earns a profit of about 400,000 Tanzanian shillings ($270) per month.

She used her first loan from Tujijenge to increase her stock of madila and will use this loan to buy garments from Mombassa (Kenya) and India.  If she earns a profit from this loan, Rukia will continue to increase her business inventory and will pay for her children's school fees.  EventuA. she hopes to build a larger home for her family.

Rukia is a member of the Singida Group.  The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back this Motisha loan.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. 

In the photo, Rukia is in the front row wearing an orange madila and a red headscarf.

loans.use: To increase clothing stock

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people make up a village bank loan and they live in Veal village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Phalla S. is a village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She is 36 years old. Her position is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family's costs of living. Now she has a problem because it is time to grow rice, but she does not have enough money to prepare the land. So to improve production, Mrs. Phalla S. is asking for a loan to do farming. Her husband, Mr. Bouch BO., is a construction worker. She is a mother of four children: two are construction workers, one is studying in the local public school, and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Alcira;  ella tiene 40 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, La socia está en el rubro da la construcción, ella es profesora de profesión en el distrito de Huarocondo en la provincia de Anta, desde el año 2001, La socia alternando su trabajo ella trabaja junto a su hermana en el área de construcción, ella también vende yeso. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería y aumentar sus ingresos. 
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Alcira is a member of the loan group “ARCANGEL GABRIEL” and lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province, Cusco departent. Alcira is 40 years old, married with a child. She works in the construction sector as has been a vocational teacher in the Huarocondo district in the Anta province since 2001. On top of this she also works with her sister selling plaster for construction purposes. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock and improve her income. This member is extremely grateful for the loan because it will enable her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She is commiitted to paying the loan back in the stipulated term.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plaster to increase her stock.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak S., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. and her husband produce traditional baskets to sell for an income of USD 2.50 each per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to expand the farming business.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two grown children. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk. Sergey sells bags, backpacks, suitcases, etc. He also offers leather accessories repair services. His wife is a KIVA borrower, too. Currently, Sergey has 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Sergey is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to purchase merchandise for his new store location. Sergey started his business as a small market vendor 2 years ago. Recently, he switched his sales location from the marketplace to a rented facility in a local mall called "City" in downtown Novomoskovsk. The floor space is about  861 square feet. Sergey works hard to help his family. His 2 year old grandson has a serious blood disorder and Sergey tries to make enough money to supply him with the necessary medication.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his new store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., from the village of Brgy. Tuoa North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios has been raising pigs for breeding for over four years, earning approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: You Savoen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. You S. is a 35-year-old woman married to Mr. Pov Narith who is 36 years old. They have three children who are attending the local school. You was selected to be the village’s bank president and head of the group loan by sixteen people who live in Ta Reab Doun Sa village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

You and her husband are farmers who decided to ask for a loan to rent two hectares of land to cultivate vegetables and lotus.

loans.use: To rent two hectares of land to cultivate vegetables and lotus

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie B. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, four of whom are in school. Winnie has a business of retail shop. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days a week. Winnie sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Winnie has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

The main business challenge for Winnie is the transportation of her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Winnie lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Por las mañana trabaja en un Wawa Wasi (programa del gobierno cuya función es cuidar niños, mientras sus madres solteras en su mayoría trabajan); asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de ropa. Este último negocio lo realiza mediante pedidos, en un inicio empezó con algunas prendas pero ahora su negocio se ha establecido, por lo que siempre tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes o amistades que viven cerca de su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio en conversar con sus clientes, sin embargo debe tener cuidado con las prendas que tienen y más las que son de color claro, ya que sus clientes son muy observadores al momento de comprar el producto. Por tal motivo desea comprarse unas vitrinas, para exhibir los productos que tiene además que los tendrá en buen estado. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropas para incrementar su stock de ropa.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 42, is a very hard-working, married mother who lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children. In the mornings she works in a Wawa Wasi (a government program whose function is to care for children while their mothers, most of them single, are at work). Likewise in the afternoons she works selling clothing. This latter business is by special order. 

In the beginning she began with a few articles of clothing but now her business has become established so there is always a lot of demand from her customers or friends who live near her. She enjoys speaking with her customers the most. However, she has to take a lot of precautions with the clothing and especially with lighter-colored garments since her customers are sharp-eyed at the moment of purchasing the product. Thus she wishes to purchase some display cases in order to show off the products she has and also to keep them in good condition. 

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she states that the loan will be highly beneficial in the development of her business. With the current loan she plans to purchase more clothing to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock in clothing

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh T. N. is 31 years old and has 2 children who are at primary school. He has been a truck driver for 5 years. Everyday, he goes to the soil beach to deliver soil to construction sites. He generates a good revenue from this business. Since becoming a client of SEDA in 2009, he has been a good repayer. Currently, he wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to maintain his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en:
Donathille is 35 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of three and fifteen. Her husband is a businessman selling a variety of products.

Donathille has a retail shop and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, biscuits and cooking oil. She has had this business for three years.  With this loan she will buy more sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.  

With the profits from this business, Donathille will provide for her family. She says that her business is well-known by people in her community.  In the future, she plans to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jayanti B..  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 13.  In 2007, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for her business.  In the future, Jayanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seed and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buys seed and fertilizer

loans.name: José Franklin

texts.en:
Jose is twenty-two years old.  He lives in the town of Morrope in northern Peru.  It is an agricultural region with many small farmers, field laborers and others who work in the agricultural sector.  Jose is married and lives with his wife and their child.  Their home is near the center of Morrope, an area which is more developed and has some significant trade and commerce.

In the yard behind their home Jose and his wife raise animals.  They feed and care for these animals in corrals until they reach the appropriate size for sale.  They sell the animals in the local markets and to neighbors.  In addition, Jose spends most days driving his mototaxi in the streets of the city and surrounding area, providing transportation services to residents.  He assists them in meeting their daily needs, getting to work, buying supplies and visiting friends.  He is proud of his ability to serve his community.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to the corrals.  He hopes to be able to increase the weight of his animals prior to the holiday season in order to take advantage of the increase in prices.  This will be his third loan with Edpyme Alternativa, and the largest loan.  He has used the prior credit responsibly and repaid punctually.  Edpyme Alternativa is glad to provide him with the opportunity to continue to use credit to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to the corrals.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a married man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is  transport. 

He has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Cosmas faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of sugar, beans and rice for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Maria Celinda

texts.es:
Maria Celinda G. M. tiene 53 años de edad, Es viuda vive con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

 Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria Celinda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder ampliar el negocio.

Le gusta trabajar en el banco.
texts.en:
Maria Celinda G. M. is 53 years old.  She is widowed and lives with her children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Maria Celinda is a farmer.  She grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells her products in Bucay.

Maria Celinda is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She likes working in the community bank.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn N. is from the village of Transville Villaflor. She is 58 years old. Merlyn is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a retail store, primarily selling dry goods in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month.

In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maximiliana Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, ubicado en el Distrito de callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y lo hace en un triciclo cerca a un grifo, ésta actividad la realiza desde las 10 am. 
Con este nuevo préstamo de 1,300.00 nuevos soles, comprará: una vitrina para poner sus dulces, 3 cajas de néctar, 3 cajas de gaseosa, 2 paquetes de agua sin gas, 1 paquete de agua con gas.
La señora maximiliana vive con sus hijos que todavía están estudiando y es por eso es que tiene que trabajar duro para poder dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan.  Su esposo es empleado público y no alcanza su sueldo para solventar todos los gastos que demanda una familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maximiliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Maximiliana sells drinks from a tricycle cart located near a gas station. Her business opens at 10am.

With this new loan of 1300 PEN she will buy a display case for storing sweets, three cases of nectar, three cases of soda, two cases of non-carbonated water, and one case of carbonated water.

Sra. Maximiliana lives with her children who are still in school. For this reason, she must work hard in order to provide what they need. Her husband is a public employee and does not earn enough to cover all of the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase  a display case for storing sweets, three cases of nectar, three cases of soda, two cases of non-carbonated water, and one case of carbonated water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of providing bolo-making services to local community members. (A bolo is a large cutting tool similar to the machete, used particularly in the jungles of Indonesia, the Philippines, and in the sugar fields of Cuba.) She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase metals and other materials needed to provide her service. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make bolo knives

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria M., from the village of Holy Friday, is the 49-year-old group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each group member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gloria M.'s Group.

Gloria, a married mother of seven school-aged children, owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP for the purchase of fertilizers such as manure. This will be Gloria's fourth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: José De Dios

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José De Dios le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa ya que chocaron y se la destruyeron. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que esta necesitando y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora que necesita. 
Desea la seguridad y el bien estar de su familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como repartidor de mercancía de una compañía de piquería.
texts.en:
Jose de Dios' house does not have a surrounding wall following an car accident that destroyed it. 

He requests a loan to be able to purchase construction material that he needs and to hire a person to carry out the project. 

He wants to provide his family with safety and well-being. 

He plans on repaying the loan with the income that he obtains from his work as a delivery person for a snack food business.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en:
Dugersuren is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His older son goes to a local secondary school, while the younger one is in kindergarten. His wife works at a university in her town.

Dugersuren manages a animal hides trading business with the help of his older brother. He started his business in 2001. They collect sheep and goat skins from herders and sell them at a local market. This type of business is quite profitable in local areas of Mongolia.

He is an open-minded man who says, "I want to build a shop with my loan." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to build a shop near to his home.

loans.use: to build a shop near to his home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, ella vive con sus dos hermanos menores y sus padres en una comunidad pequeña y netamente rural del distrito La Arena en Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Rosa  es la producción y comercialización de harina y chicha de Jora (bebida macerada de maíz),que acompaña con pequeños platos de comida. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 7 años en su domicilio y desde muy joven aprendió los secretos de la buena preparación de la chicha y harina de Jora (maíz) algo que le ha traído consigo consecuencias positivas pues ahora ella cuenta con una gran demanda debido a la calidad de sus productos.

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de jora (el cual es el insumo principal de su negocio) pues el precio de este maíz ha aumentado debido a la baja en su cosecha y ella necesita tener la cantidad adecuada para la preparación de sus productos. 

Rosa es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación que desea ampliar su negocio y comercializar su deliciosa chicha y harina a otros sectores.
texts.en:
Rosa, 25, lives with her two younger siblings and her parents in a small, completely rural community in La Arena District in Piura.

Rosa’s activity is making and selling corn flour and “Chicha de Jora” (beverage made from corn) that goes with small plates of food.  She’s been doing this for over 7 years at home.  She learned the secret of preparing delicious chicha and jora (corn) flour while still very young and this is something that has brought positive results because the high quality of her products has led to their being in very high demand.

Rosa asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy jora (which is the main ingredient in her business) because the price of corn has increased due to diminished crop yields and she needs to have the necessary amount to prepare her products.

Rosa is a woman with a strong wish to succeed who wants to expand her business and sell her delicious chicha and flour in other sectors.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Paul

texts.es: Paúl, de 30 años, reside en la  comunidad nativa de Centro Pumpuriani, ahí forjo su familia junto a Ida, su esposa, desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan y educan constantemente. Todas las mañanas como hace 8 años se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra plátanos y café. Según cuenta; antes no tenía el dinero necesario como para comprar más terrenos agrícolas, con el tiempo y trabajo arduo pudo obtener 5 hectáreas de terrenos cultivables, donde ahora siembra de la siguiente manera: 3 hectáreas de cultivo son de plátanos y 2 hectáreas de café. Ya que el plátano tiene mayor acogida y rinde ganancias cada 15 días que dura su maduración. Pero en temporadas de cosecha de café que se realiza una vez al año, obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que una hectárea le produce 60 sacos de café como mínimo. “Cada kilo cuesta S/.12 soles”, comenta Paúl, “Estoy seguro que subirá más”. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de café y se siente muy contento de los resultados que está obteniendo. Por ello está pensando invertir en la siembra de sus cafetales para que en el futuro le puedan ofrecer más ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Paúl de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café y un poco de abono en plátanos; ya que según afirma es muy importante para que produzcan más frutos.
texts.en:
Paul, 30, lives in the indigenous community of Centro Pumpuriani. There he began his family together with Ida, his wife of two years. They have four children that they constantly care for and educate. Every morning for 8 years he heads to his farmland where he plants plantains and coffee. 

According to his story: before, he didn't have the money he needed to buy more farmland; with time and hard work his was able to obtain 5 hectares of arable land. He now plants 3 hectares of plantains and 2 hectares of coffee. The plantain is more in demand and provides earnings every 15 days, which is its cycle of maturation. During the coffee harvest once a year, he makes good money because one hectare of land produces at least 60 sacks of coffee. "Every kilo costs 12 soles", comments Paul, "I'm sure it will go up even more." 

Now is the time to harvest coffee and he's very happy with the results that he's getting. Because of this he's thinking about investing in planting more coffee so that in the future he can make more money. 

He belongs to the village bank "Abjitas de Pumpuriani" and this is his first loan with MFP. He hopes that this collaboration will help him achieve his goals. He promises to make his payments. He is grateful to be part of his village bank because all of the members are responsible and unified.

Once he receives the loan he will invest in the purchase of some sacks of organic compost to spread among his coffee crop and a little for the plantains, because he feels it's very important that they produce more fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Analiza has a shop that sells biscuits, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Mario Alberto vive en la ciudad de Managua 
Trabaja en una empresa situada en la ciudad de Managua.
Don Mario acudió a nuestras oficina para hacer la solicitud de un crédito  por que quiere mejorar el techo de su vivienda porque considera  que es necesario el cambio de el techo de su vivienda.
La inversión que el señor Mario va a invertir es en la compra de zinc y madera para mejorar el techo de la vivienda
El señor Mario se siente agradecido con ceprodel por que el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con créditos de ceprodel ha recibido buenas atenciones  y ha podido mejorar su condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto lives in the city of Managua.  He works for a company located in the city of Managua.  He came by our offices to request a loan because he wants to repair the roof on his house because he feels it’s necessary to replace the roof on his house.  Mario will invest in the purchase of zinc metal sheeting and lumber to improve the roof of his house.

He feels grateful to Ceprodel because in the time he’s been working with Ceprodel loans he’s received good treatment and he has been able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hard working and entrepreneurial 31-year-old businessman. His alternative source of income comes from the earnings he gets from his general store. Previously he was employed. He is married and blessed with two children aged 4 years and 7 months. One of the children is in school. He has been meeting the needs of his family for the last four years by providing bureau services. He wants in the next five years to have a big wholesale shop and his dream is to be a big businessman who has ventured out of the borders.

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy toner and cartridges. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to accumulate a wealth of information about businesses from their informative seminars.

loans.use: to buy toner and cartridges

loans.name: Huynh's Group

texts.en:
Huynh was born in 1983. He lives in Phan Xa village, Dong Anh district. He is married with one child who is still small. His wife is a farmer. 

Mr Huynh has a workshop. He repairs bicycles and motorbikes. He has this job for five years. He has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). He wants to invest in his business. This is the first time he has participated in SEDA. He would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND  to buy bicycle parts.
 
About the other member in his group:

 Van is 49 years old. She has one child. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a grown son. She sells women’s clothing and footwear in her home town of Novaya Kahovka. Natalya launched her trade due to financial struggles many years ago. She managed to survive all the challenges of perestroika and the unfavorable economic climate back in the '90s in Ukraine. Natalya developed her business well. Currently she has two sales locations with 30,000 Grivnyas in monthly sales. 

Natalya is planning to invest the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas in additional merchandise. She is hoping to improve the selection of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosks, thus attracting even more customers to her business. The profits generated will be used to meet her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to improve her product range

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a beauty salon business in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: La señora Carla se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas y también joyas que ofrece en catálogos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cremas para niños  para así surtir su mercadería y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en  alquiler con su madre en una casa la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Belén de la ciudad de La Paz; Carla es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que ella solicita un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Carla sells perfume, creams and costume jewelry via catalogue sales.  She needs the loan to buy children’s creams to stock her inventory and have a wider variety available for her customers.  This is the source of income she has to cover her costs.  

She lives with her mother in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Belén zone.  Carla is single and has no children.  This is the first time she’s asked for an Impro and Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy children's creams.

loans.name: Reynold

texts.en:
Reynold is 26 years-old and is a married man with a  three year-old child. He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Reynold grows rice crops to sell. He requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials. Reynold hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Reynold hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer comes from the village Arali in South Georgia. He is 61 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Lali, two sons (22 and 20 years old) and his 90-year-old father. Vladimer is the lead in the agricultural business for his family. They have a milk cow and sell cheese they produce, which is sold locally.  Vladimer also grows cabbages and potatoes on family-owned land and sells the harvested products locally as well. Lali works in the local branch of an international charity organization and gets a monthly salary in the amount of 150 Laris per month. 

Vladimer requested credit to pay for school tuition for his children, who are students at a high school.  His elder son studies law and the younger one studies economics. They are studying hard in order to get good education and become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: pay school tuition for his children

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik was born in 1955, and he lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his wife and daughter. His daughter is married and lives separately.

He has a 20-year work experience as a driver for different organizations. For the past 15 years, Valerik and his wife are engaged in animal breeding. He has his own plot of land where he runs his animal breeding business. Valerik breeds cows and calves, sheep, chickens, lambs, goats and pigs in his farm. Valerik’s wife helps him in farming and they work very hard. They sell milk produced in the market near to Hrazdan city Sevan area. The couple also sells meat to meat dealers in their region. 

The money earned from farming helps Valerik cover a majority of his family’s expenses and develop their farm business. He is seeking a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy fodder for his swines as well as winter wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy fodder for swines and winter wheat seeds

loans.name: Marah

texts.en: Marah is a 22-year-old young woman; she is married and her husband works in vegetable sales and has a low income. Marah wants to help her husband by purchasing bulk vegetables for sale to increase his collection and increase his income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Marah gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband and purchase bulk vegetables, so he will be able to compete with others and improve his sales and increase his income. This will enable him to provide better living conditions for the family. Marah is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase bulk vegetables for sale

loans.name: Marcia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia es socia del banco comunal Patys FLC, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, esta ciudad tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía la cual cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Marcia tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 11 años de edad y sus dos hijos quienes son gemelos tienen 7 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una  unidad de taxi, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Marcia es profesional en el área de la belleza y labora en su gabinete el cual tiene hace 15 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para su local.

Su meta agrandar su local.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the Patys FLC community bank in Cuenca.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city declared a World Heritage Site in 1999. The climate here is cold, but the people are warm and friendly.  The area is famous for its food and its commitment to the local culture.

Marcia, 30, is married and the mother of 3 children, an 11-year old boy and 7-year old twins.  The three children go to a local school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  They own the house where they live.

Marcia has a beauty salon, a business that she has owned for 15 years.  She works Sundays to Sundays, whenever she has a customer.  

She has been a member of her community bank for a year and she will use this loan to buy beauty products that she will resell.

Her goal for the future is to expand her salon.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora Angelica es una persona muy sociable vive en Chimoré a 160 km D. Cochabamba le costo a la mencionada estar ahora considerada entra las mejores comensales que venD. y deambula con comida rapida, ya que su gran lucha la vivio con sus competidores y permisos por parte D. la Alcaldia ahora la cliente se dedica a la venta D. sandwiches, hamburguesas, tucumanas, ensaladas D. frutas, etc., deambula con su venta por colegios y donD. hay conglomeracion D. personas, siempre se supo auto financiar el capital D. inversion para el giro D. su negocio y algunas veces cuando tenia contratos que cumplir recurria a  solicitar un credito que le cubriera con la necesidad D. cumplir con sus contratos D. servicio D. comidas. Empezo desD. muy joven en la venta D. sus productos y poco a poco se hizo conocer, hasta que adquirio gran clientela y todos los dias le esperan para comprarle sus productos, su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y otras veces lo contratan en una empresa D. expendio D. comidas en gran escala. En esta oportunidad la cliente  dicidio por solicitar este credito  ya que se le avencina un contrato donD. necesitar equipar su negocio para hacer frente a las exigencias que se le piden para ocuparse del servicio D. la comida.
texts.en:
Angelica is a very sociable person. She lives in Chimoré, 160 kilometers from Cochabamba. She walks about selling fast food and is now considered among diners to be one of the best. She has fought great fights against her competitors and having to get city permits. Now she sells sandwiches, hamburgers, meat pastries, fruit salads, and similar foods. She walks about selling by schools where there are many people gathered. 

It has always been said that self-investing capital can turn the business around and sometimes when she has contracts to fulfill she has had to ask for a loan in order to cover the food contracts. 

She started at a very young age in the sale of her products and little by little she became known, until she gained a large client base and every day they wait in order to buy her products. Her husband works as a motorbike taxi driver. Sometimes she is hired by a company to proviD. a great number of meals.

The client is taking this opportunity to ask for a loan in order to go ahead with a contract to equip her business in order to meet the requests being asked for in order to get busy with the service of food.

loans.use: to invest in her food business

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of the Yetana group. Peter and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Peter takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and also due to One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, he had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest one and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Yetana group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land. 
Peter is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 23-year-old single lady. She is the oldest of an 11-member family.

Ameera is a student in one of the Jordanian universities. She is majoring in social sciences, a subject at which she is very talented. Ameera wants to continue to get a Master's degree in the same major after getting her Bachelor's degree.

Now Ameera has applied for a loan to pay her semester tuition.

loans.use: to pay her semester tuition.

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene  43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aún vive en su casa ya que es soltera. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de productos de bazar, ropa y papelería, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  ella en su tienda vende todos sus productos pero a veces también sale a entregar más que todo la ropa la misma que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años y nos comenta que desde que está recibiendo los créditos se le ha hecho más fácil poder surtir su local.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, ropa, productos de bazar y papelería. Lleva 11 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le  da el banco, con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante, comprar un carro y una lancha más grande para su esposo.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton (Manta). This place is known for the beautiful beaches that line its coast. Most of its in inhabitants are very hard working and dedicated to work related to the sea.

Here, we meet Señora María. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children from this marriage. One of her daughters still lives in her home since she is single. Her husband is a fisherman.

María has a general store in her house. There, she sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, and detergents, in addition to educational materials, clothing, and stationary, among other things. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., and sometimes much later. She sells all the products in her shop, but sometimes leaves to deliver, mainly clothing that she sells on credit. She collects the payments every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and tells us that receiving loans has made it easier to be able to stock her shop.

This loan is going to be used to buy inventory for her shop. She is going to buy rice, sugar, clothing, educational materials, and stationary. She has been with the communal bank for 11 years. She likes it because of the help the bank gave her with one of the loans that began her business. Her dreams are to continue progressing, to purchase a car, and to buy a bigger boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, clothing, educational materials, and stationary.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en: Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 28, has been working as a taxi driver since last summer and gained much experience from this business field. His job starts at 7 am and finishes at 11 pm at night during the weekdays. Currently, he lives with his wife and daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Recently, he decided to move out to start his own individual life, but he needs a complete ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent with insulation on the walls, before this coming cold winter. Therefore, his loan will be used to cover the payment of a new ger to start his own individual life.

loans.use: to cover the payment of new ger to start his own individual life

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 31 year old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to make general repairs to her home so that she can make it a more comfortable space for her family.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a 50 year old married female from Al Salt in Jordan. She has 6 children and has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and expenses. In the future, Nawal is planning to build an additional room onto her house.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Alba Isabel

texts.es: Alba tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de artesanías. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño dado que el actual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and she lives in her own house with her children. She is a very enterprising woman who earns a living by selling a variety of hand-crafted items.  

With the desire to improve her living conditions, she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI, in order to invest in the construction of a bathroom, as the current one is deteriorated. 

With the requested amount, she will purchase cement, sand, iron, brick, galvanized sheeting, and such.  She hopes to have this financing and thus begin the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, brick, galvanized sheeting, etc., in order to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Juanita is 39 years old, she lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon; she is single mother and has 2 beautiful children, alone Juanita wants to offer them an education and a better quality of life, for that reason she began her business since 6 years ago. It consists on the quilts and clothes sales: Her sales are usually among her relatives and well-known people, however, her clients are increasing lately, but Juanita doesn\\\'t have the articles variety to her requesting clients, for that reason she needs to increase her capacity of sales products.

Juanita requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her increase the products variety; she hopes this next Christmas season, her sales will increase and her incomes will be bigger. In a term of 3-6 months Juanita plans to return the loan, she requires your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita tiene 39 años de edad, vive en Escobedo Nuevo León; ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hermosos hijos. Juanita solo quiere ofrecerles una educación y una mejor calidad, por lo que inició su negocio hace 6 años. Este consiste en la venta de sobre camas, colchas y ropa, normalmente sus ventas son entre sus familiares y conocidos, sin embargo, últimamente sus clientes están aumentando, pero Juanita no tiene la variedad de artículos que sus clientes necesitan, por lo que ella necesita aumentar su capacidad de productos para vender.

Juanita requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar la variedad de productos que tiene para vender; ella espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen y sus ingresos sean mayores. En un término de 3-6 meses Juanita planea regresar el préstamo, ella requiere de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Catherine Nsoh

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Catherine is a single mother of 3, foster mother of 8 (from her two late sisters), and grandmother of one. Tortured by the deaths of her two sisters within one year and by thoughts of how she prematurely dropped out of school, she is determined to be there for ALL her children.

Since 1998 she has received various empowerment skills in training sessions organized by GHAPE and sister organizations. She succeeded as a mobile food vendor in providing her community with snacks (e.g., fresh groundnuts, sweet yams). Her major achievement has been the payment of tuition for some of her children from her profits. Her goal is to provide education for her children. Building a house in her lifetime for herself and her children is what will make her very happy.

Given a loan of $1200, Catherine plans to diversify her business by buying a motorbike to provide taxi services to the population of Mulang and Ntagkah, which is less accessible by regular urban taxis due to the bad roads. Part of her loan will be used to enlarge her piggery, and she intends to continue with her mobile restaurant. She anticipates repaying her loan with income from her transportation business, paying fees with income from the piggery, and meeting day-to-day needs with income from her mobile restaurant activity.

She plans to pay off her loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Buying a motorbike and pigs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac O. is a married father of three. He makes coffins and other furniture for a living. He would like to apply for a loan of 400 USD, which he intends to use to expand and diversify his business so he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: To expand and diversify my furniture business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She has 8 children – 4 of whom are construction workers and the rest of whom are students. To cover all the famiL.’s expenses, Touch L. sells grocery products to the people in her community where she can typicalL. earn up to $10 each day. Moreover, her husband is a motor-taxi driver and makes an average of $5 to $6 each day, which is another source of income for his large famiL..

Touch L. hopes the $1,000 loan will help her purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate his business more efficientL. and to raise his earnings.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
The will to better her two little one's quality of life has made Bernardina sell candies on the street since eleven years ago - because she knew that her husband's daily wages would become more and more insufficient.

Little by little and with a lot of effort she started her business and now she can offer her products in a stable place close to her home. It took her no time to become the neighborhood's favorite candy-lady.

Today,with her experience, she wishes to improve her business' condition and increment her stocks in order to provide her clients with more variety.

In order to start this project, Bernardina requests a loan of $275 dollars and compromises to repay them within six months. Furthermore, she is convinced that, with the extra income she will generate through this project, she will be able to afford a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

El ímpetu por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeños hijos ha hecho que Bernardina hace 11 años incursione en la venta de dulces en las calles de la ciudad que habita debido a que el ingreso que le proporcionaba diariamente su esposo cada vez era más insuficiente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue implementando su pequeño negocio y ahora puede ofrecerlo en un lugar estable cerca de su domicilio. Fue poco el tiempo que tardó para convertirse en la favorita de su barrio. Ahora y en base a la experiencia que ha adquirido desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y ampliar el stock que tiene para ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes. Para emprender este proyecto Bernardina, solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el fin de llevar a cabo su propósito y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Además está convencida de que con el ingreso que genere el incremento de productos podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase products for a candyshop

loans.name: Marisol Celeste

texts.en:
Marisol and her husband own a taxi that he drives seven days a week in Lima. Unfortunately, he was hit by another car and, although the person responsible for the accident paid to have the car fixed, Marisol and her husband had to go 20 days without the income he takes in as a ‘taxista’. Marisol was then the sole income generator, and she did this by selling sweets on the weekends in the streets of her neighborhood.

Marisol and her husband have an eight-year-old daughter they love very much. Marisol says she would have liked to have had more children but it is too expensive and they cannot afford it. Her dream for her daughter is that she study and become a professional. Her daughter loves English and wants to be an English teacher. With this loan Marisol will be able to perform much needed maintenance on their taxi, starting with getting the oil changed.

loans.use: perform much needed maintenance on their taxi

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan O. is a 50-year-old mother of eight school-aged children. She lives with her husband, who is a retired banker, in Rongo, Kenya.

Before beginning her current business of selling second-hand bed linens and curtains in 1990, she worked as a clerk with Lake Basin Development Authority. Susan runs her business on a busy street along Rongo-Homabay Road. She specializes in selling bed sheets and curtains. She is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices in Nairobi. Susan plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Flor Milagro

texts.en:
Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia are members of the community bank “Prosperidad”.  Flor Milagro has been a member for less than one year; Iris Dilalia has been a member for almost five years.  They both joined because their mothers were associates.  Iris Dilalia has four family members who are members of the bank.  They are happy with their experience and say that they have learned to save and that the lessons about healthy relationships, childcare, and self-esteem have been helpful
	Flor Milagro is 25 and has two children.  She has owned a seamstress business for the past six years.  Before that she worked doing the same thing for another person but enjoys having her own business.
	Iris Dilalia is 23 years old and has one seven-year-old child.  She sells cosmetics.  Before, she worked in a factory but decided to go back to school and no longer had time.  She is studying hotel management.  She is saving to be able to travel around the region with her management program.
	Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.
	Flor Milagro dreams of owning a big store and having a happy healthy family.  Iris Dilalia hopes to one day own her own hotel and a house where she can live with her son.

loans.use: Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.

loans.name: Marach D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jalia N.. She is currently in the business of selling dry foods and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jalia is 39 years old. She has 8 children ranging in age from 5 to 23, and seven of them go to school. Each week, Jalia makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband pay school fees for the children. Jalia previously had a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 500000 to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Jalia is joined in her small group by Sauma Nadudoma, Hanifa M., Zanabu W., and Madina S.. Sauma Nadudoma has a business selling rice and wants to increase stock. Hanifa M. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to expand the business. Zanabu W. sells sweet potatoes and wants to purchase more foods for sale. Madina S. currently operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To purchase more dry foods for sale

loans.name: Zuliat

texts.en:
Zuliat is 35 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12 years old. Zuliat sells timber. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Maria's Tujitume Group

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 12, 8, 6 and 3 years old. Maria sells clothes and bed sheets. She started her business in 2006. Everyday she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Maria has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sophia, who has a business dealing in used clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Celina Esperanza

texts.en:
Celina Esperanza H. V. has a general store and small restaurant in the town of Carabamba high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region. She has 15 years of experience working in retail and 2 with her restaurant. She serves food typical to the region like rice with chicken, lamb, and more. She is very well know and has many loyal customers.

Celina is 52 years old, single, and has 3 children. She is happy to have her businesses because without them she wouldn’t have any way to make money and feed her children. Her dream and motivation to keep moving forward is to educate her children.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Celina is requesting a loan of s/2000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store and buy ingredients for her delicious meals.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store and buy ingredients for her delicious meals.

loans.name: Maud

texts.en:
Maud D. sells baby dresses, creams, powder and panties. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Maud and her two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Norma Soledad

texts.es:
Norma is the mother of three children, and she works as hard as she can for them. She sells delicious wines to her neighbors on holidays. First she collects wine requests and then travels to the city of Chicha, in Ica, where she buys gallons of wine wholesale. Thanks to God Norma has a large quantity of orders and she travels constantly in order to fill them. Norma hopes to increase her investment to her family's quality of life, and to do this she would like to invest money to buy greater quantities of wine. That way she'll be able to purchase more than was ordered, to maintain a reserve of wine in her house and later offer these wines in other areas of the city. Norma would also like to buy or rent a small stall in the local market to sell her wines on a more permanent basis. We hope that you can meet Norma's need to grow and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una madre de tres hijos por quienes trabaja y se esfuerza al máximo. Ella vende deliciosos vinos, que ofrece a sus vecinos en días festivos, con los pedidos viaja a la ciudad de Chicha, en Ica, donde compra galones de vino al por mayor, gracias a Dios doña Norma tiene gran cantidad de pedidos y viaja constantemente para comprarlos. Sin embargo, Norma desea incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar la calidad de vida dentro de su hogar, y por ello quiere invertir dinero en la compra de mayor cantidad de vino y no sólo satisfacer sus pedidos, sino también tener una reserva que guardaría en su propia casa, para luego ofrecer estos vinos en otros lugares de su ciudad. También desea poder adquirir o alquilar un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad donde venda sus vinos de manera permanente. Esperamos que usted pueda atender la necesidad de Norma en poder incrementar y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of products in order to expand her client base to have a permanent stall to sell wines in the local market.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana lives in Nikopol and raises two sons. She owns a small vending store called "Men and Women" where she sells household chemicals and cosmetics. Tatyana offers a nice selection of inventory in her store and receives a good income. Currently, she has about $2000 in merchandise. Her monthly income is about $200. 

Tatyana has been running this business for two years already. She has been consistently increasing her stock and sales as a result. Today she is hoping to get a 3000 Grivna loan to add to assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk. Tatyana is hoping to see her business continually growing and expanding.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en: David N. lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 46 years old and married with 2 children. He owns a motorcycle that he uses for commercial purposes. He is a LAPO client. He is requesting the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy one motorcycle to enable him take his customers from one location to another. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for commercial purpose

loans.name: Afsar

texts.en: Afsar is 39 years old, is married, has three children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Kurdmahmudlu. Five years ago he started a general store business . He would like a loan $1200 to buy more goods to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Thi Hong Hoang Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1954 (Ms 23060023 ), mức vốn vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà . Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Hai con cô đều có việc làm và có thu nhập theo tháng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng : 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Hàng ngày, ngoài công việc chăn nuôi và đồng áng, cô còn tìm những việc làm thêm như phu hồ, khuân vác,… để có thêm thu nhập. Kinh tế gia đình cô còn eo hẹp nên vợ chồng cô luôn cố gắng làm việc và mong được vay vốn thường xuyên để phát triển, nâng cao mức sống. Cùng vay vốn với cô còn có:

     Nguyễn Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1972 (Ms 23060020 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Lê Thị Tôn, sinh năm 1950 (Ms 23060021 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Trần Thị Thanh, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 23060022 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Đào Thị Xuyến, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 23060025 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
     Nguyễ Thị Sáu, sinh năm 1959 (Ms 23060032 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.0000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
     Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 23060034), mức vốn vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng may mặc tại nhà.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khin R., 41, is wedding decorator; she decorates customers' houses for wedding parties, ceremonies, and other special festival. She is married to Mr. Yeang Ros, 38, who raises pigs in their home. They have no children. The couple lives in Kompong Tom Province.

Khin works hard to satisfy her customers. She decided to ask a loan of 2,800,000 riel ($700) to purchase decorator materials. The loan will help this modern business.

loans.use: To purchase decorator materials

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun S. lives in Boeung Basak village in Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife who is a good cook. Her husband, Mr. Ros Thong, is a construction worker. He earns less income than is needed to support his household. In order to improve their living conditions, he wants to become a motorbike taxi driver, and therefore Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start his taxi business. 

She is 42 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one--who is four years old--is too young to work or study. 

Her husband is also presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
Hilaria trabaja preparando comida a pedido. Es decir, ella prepara y reparte comida a obreros que trabajan en obras cercanas a su casa.

Hace tres años ella ayudaba a atender en la tienda de una prima suya, hasta que una amiga la motivo a tener un negocio propio. Hilaria se animó a invertir en el negocio de la comida porque se dio cuenta de que habían muchas fábricas por su casa. Ella vende almuerzos y le dedica toda la mañana a ello.

Por las tardes eventualmente ella continua ayudando a su prima con la atención de la tienda; sin embargo, cada vez que puede también prepara picarones (postre peruano) para venderlos fuera de su casa.

Gracias a su empeño por conseguir siempre recursos con los cuales mantener a su pequeña familia, ha logrado ser padre y madre para su hijo que hoy ya tiene diecinueve años.
texts.en:
Hilaria works making food on demand. She makes and delivers food to workers near by her home. Three years ago, she used to help at a store owned by one of her cousins, until a friend encouraged her to open her own Business. Hilaria, then, decided to do so and invested her savings on this food business as she figured it was a good idea to sell lunch packs to the workers at the factories near by. She devotes all morning to prepare these meals. In the evenings, she still helps her cousin taking care of the store. She also makes special Peruvian deserts called “picarones” for sale. Thanks to her performance, she has always managed to obtain the resources to support her small family. Hilaria is a single mother with a 19 year old son.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's undergraduate studies

loans.name: Vongsarith

texts.en:
Mr. Vongsarith V., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Iyani Choeng, 46, married in 1986 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; two children attend school; one child is a garment factory worker and another one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Vongsarith has been a mason since 1990. His wife was a cleaner in a hotel in Phnom Penh for six years. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 200 to add to his own money to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one to drive to work

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar Mazhar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar baji is a 36-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. H. and he has a thread-selling business. Shahnaz baji is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their home.

Shahnaz baji is a very hard-working lady. She sews clothes for the sake of sharing the financial burden of her husband because his income is very small. From the amount she makes, she pays the school fees of her children and relieves her husband of these expenses. Shahnaz baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute oin Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy thread for her husband’s thread-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kishwar Sultana baji and Kosar Parveen baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her carpet-weaving business. Lal baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy thread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing cassava and corn

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin R. is a 31-year-old farmer who breeds and sells calves in the local livestock bazaar. He is married with two children. He started his business in 2004 when his salary as a policeman was not enough to cover his family’s basic needs. Now he has a successful business, but his income is not sufficient to achieve his main goal - provide best education to his beloved children. He dreams of owning a livestock farm in the future. He is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more calves, which is the first step towards achieving his dream.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Ozodahon

texts.ru:
У Озодахон есть профессия – она швея. Раньше работала в государственном учреждении, но растущие потребности семьи вынудили ее бросить работу и начать свое самостоятельное дело. Она купила несколько швейных машинок, подключила к себе свою дочку и невестку и начала мелкое производство. Озода и ее дочь с невесткой шьют национальные таджикские одеяла – курпачи. Несколько ее клиентов покупают готовые курпачи и затем продают на рынках. Несколько месяцев назад Озода взяла к себе на обучение несколько соседских девочек и стала обучать их мастерству шитья. 
Сейчас у Озоды есть небольшой заказ на курпачи и так как цены на ткани немного упали она решила получить займ на КИВА и закупить ткани.
texts.en:
Ozodahon is a seamstress. Before, she worked for a government agency, but due to increasing needs of her family she had to leave her job and start her own business. She bought several sewing machines, involved her daughter and daughter-in-law, and began a production. Three of them sew traditional Tajik blankets - "kurpachi". Several of her clients purchase kurpachi and them resell them at different markets. A few months ago, Ozoda took several neighboring girls as trainees and began teaching them how to sew. Currently, Ozodahon has an good sized outstanding order. Because of a recent drop in textile prices, she decided to obtain a loan from KIVA and purchase large amounts of textiles.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Sandina

texts.en:
Sandina has been a hairdresser, snack vendor, and pig keeper in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for many years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. She works daily at her business. She belongs to the Msikitini East group loan.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her hairdressing business. She hopes to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Sandina is 42 years old and married. She has six children, ages three, seven, 11, 16, 18, and 22. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Nges Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah S. is married and has one child. He lives in Belo, Cameroon and sets up shop in the Belo Market. Elijah buys and sells goods at his general store. With this loan he plans to purchase one bag of rice, two cartons of soap, a half carton of dry fish, three bags of Maggi (a popular seasoning in Cameroon), one roll of sugar and two buckets of Gari.

Elijah believes his business will succeed because he sells the basic necessities that people need. He also works hard and is good to his customers. Financially, Elijah sells his products at moderate prices and thinks ahead by saving some of his money in a credit union.

Although Elijah has had some obstacles, such as fire destroying his plantain farm and learning how to run a good business, he is still trying. With the profits from this loan, Elijah looks forward to paying his child's school fees, saving some of it with GHAPE, buying plantain to plant in his farm, increasing his business and contributing to his Njangi group.

Njangi groups in Cameroon are an informal way to lend money. Each month a different member collects the group's dues and may use it for whatever they please. It is very prevalent, as you can see groups dressed in their distinct uniforms around town, near the time they meet.

This is Elijah's second loan from GHAPE since he became a member in early 2008. Elijah takes out GHAPE loans because "of their truthfulness" and the way in which everything is documented. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap, dry fish, maggi (a seasoning), sugar, and gari to resell.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is only 25 years old. He manages a two-hectare (5-acre) farm lot planted with corn and rice. Arsenio is still single and chooses to help his parents first before settling down. His family lives in the village of San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela.

The place was poor and far from access to market amenities. Arsenio is hoping to borrow PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as additional working capital for his farm since his income from the previous harvest is no longer enough to sustain his farming.

Arsenio patiently is doing his best in order to help his parents overcome the hardships of life. Sometimes, Arsenio also manages to operate a tricycle transport as another source of income.

loans.use: To use as business capital
